1845                                  * both dreg and sreg need precision
1846                                  * before this insn
1847                                  */
1848                                 *reg_mask |= sreg;
1849                         } /* else dreg += K
1850                            * dreg still needs precision before this insn
1851                            */
1852                 }
1853         } else if (class == BPF_LDX) {
1854                 if (!(*reg_mask & dreg))
1855                         return 0;
1856                 *reg_mask &= ~dreg;
1857 
1858                 /* scalars can only be spilled into stack w/o losing precision.
1859                  * Load from any other memory can be zero extended.
1860                  * The desire to keep that precision is already indicated
1861                  * by 'precise' mark in corresponding register of this state.
1862                  * No further tracking necessary.
1863                  */
1864                 if (insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_FP)
1865                         return 0;
1866                 if (BPF_SIZE(insn->code) != BPF_DW)
1867                         return 0;
1868 
1869                 /* dreg = *(u64 *)[fp - off] was a fill from the stack.
1870                  * that [fp - off] slot contains scalar that needs to be
1871                  * tracked with precision
1872                  */
1873                 spi = (-insn->off - 1) / BPF_REG_SIZE;
1874                 if (spi >= 64) {
1875                         verbose(env, "BUG spi %d\n", spi);
1876                         WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier backtracking bug");
1877                         return -EFAULT;
1878                 }
1879                 *stack_mask |= 1ull << spi;
1880         } else if (class == BPF_STX || class == BPF_ST) {
1881                 if (*reg_mask & dreg)
1882                         /* stx & st shouldn't be using _scalar_ dst_reg
1883                          * to access memory. It means backtracking
1884                          * encountered a case of pointer subtraction.
1885                          */
1886                         return -ENOTSUPP;
1887                 /* scalars can only be spilled into stack */
1888                 if (insn->dst_reg != BPF_REG_FP)
1889                         return 0;
1890                 if (BPF_SIZE(insn->code) != BPF_DW)
1891                         return 0;
1892                 spi = (-insn->off - 1) / BPF_REG_SIZE;
1893                 if (spi >= 64) {
1894                         verbose(env, "BUG spi %d\n", spi);
1895                         WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier backtracking bug");
1896                         return -EFAULT;
1897                 }
1898                 if (!(*stack_mask & (1ull << spi)))
1899                         return 0;
1900                 *stack_mask &= ~(1ull << spi);
1901                 if (class == BPF_STX)
1902                         *reg_mask |= sreg;
1903         } else if (class == BPF_JMP || class == BPF_JMP32) {
1904                 if (opcode == BPF_CALL) {
1905                         if (insn->src_reg == BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
1906                                 return -ENOTSUPP;
1907                         /* regular helper call sets R0 */
1908                         *reg_mask &= ~1;
1909                         if (*reg_mask & 0x3f) {
1910                                 /* if backtracing was looking for registers R1-R5
1911                                  * they should have been found already.
1912                                  */
1913                                 verbose(env, "BUG regs %x\n", *reg_mask);
1914                                 WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier backtracking bug");
1915                                 return -EFAULT;
1916                         }
1917                 } else if (opcode == BPF_EXIT) {
1918                         return -ENOTSUPP;
1919                 }
1920         } else if (class == BPF_LD) {
1921                 if (!(*reg_mask & dreg))
1922                         return 0;
1923                 *reg_mask &= ~dreg;
1924                 /* It's ld_imm64 or ld_abs or ld_ind.
1925                  * For ld_imm64 no further tracking of precision
1926                  * into parent is necessary
1927                  */
1928                 if (mode == BPF_IND || mode == BPF_ABS)
1929                         /* to be analyzed */
1930                         return -ENOTSUPP;
1931         }
1932         return 0;
1933 }
1934 
1935 /* the scalar precision tracking algorithm:
1936  * . at the start all registers have precise=false.
1937  * . scalar ranges are tracked as normal through alu and jmp insns.
1938  * . once precise value of the scalar register is used in:
1939  *   .  ptr + scalar alu
1940  *   . if (scalar cond K|scalar)
1941  *   .  helper_call(.., scalar, ...) where ARG_CONST is expected
1942  *   backtrack through the verifier states and mark all registers and
1943  *   stack slots with spilled constants that these scalar regisers
1944  *   should be precise.
1945  * . during state pruning two registers (or spilled stack slots)
1946  *   are equivalent if both are not precise.
1947  *
1948  * Note the verifier cannot simply walk register parentage chain,
1949  * since many different registers and stack slots could have been
1950  * used to compute single precise scalar.
1951  *
1952  * The approach of starting with precise=true for all registers and then
1953  * backtrack to mark a register as not precise when the verifier detects
1954  * that program doesn't care about specific value (e.g., when helper
1955  * takes register as ARG_ANYTHING parameter) is not safe.
1956  *
1957  * It's ok to walk single parentage chain of the verifier states.
1958  * It's possible that this backtracking will go all the way till 1st insn.
1959  * All other branches will be explored for needing precision later.
1960  *
1961  * The backtracking needs to deal with cases like:
1962  *   R8=map_value(id=0,off=0,ks=4,vs=1952,imm=0) R9_w=map_value(id=0,off=40,ks=4,vs=1952,imm=0)
1963  * r9 -= r8
1964  * r5 = r9
1965  * if r5 > 0x79f goto pc+7
1966  *    R5_w=inv(id=0,umax_value=1951,var_off=(0x0; 0x7ff))
1967  * r5 += 1
1968  * ...
1969  * call bpf_perf_event_output#25
1970  *   where .arg5_type = ARG_CONST_SIZE_OR_ZERO
1971  *
1972  * and this case:
1973  * r6 = 1
1974  * call foo // uses callee's r6 inside to compute r0
1975  * r0 += r6
1976  * if r0 == 0 goto
1977  *
1978  * to track above reg_mask/stack_mask needs to be independent for each frame.
1979  *
1980  * Also if parent's curframe > frame where backtracking started,
1981  * the verifier need to mark registers in both frames, otherwise callees
1982  * may incorrectly prune callers. This is similar to
1983  * commit 7640ead93924 ("bpf: verifier: make sure callees don't prune with caller differences")
1984  *
1985  * For now backtracking falls back into conservative marking.
1986  */
1987 static void mark_all_scalars_precise(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
1988                                      struct bpf_verifier_state *st)
1989 {
1990         struct bpf_func_state *func;
1991         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
1992         int i, j;
1993 
1994         /* big hammer: mark all scalars precise in this path.
1995          * pop_stack may still get !precise scalars.
1996          */
1997         for (; st; st = st->parent)
1998                 for (i = 0; i <= st->curframe; i++) {
1999                         func = st->frame[i];
2000                         for (j = 0; j < BPF_REG_FP; j++) {
2001                                 reg = &func->regs[j];
2002                                 if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE)
2003                                         continue;
2004                                 reg->precise = true;
2005                         }
2006                         for (j = 0; j < func->allocated_stack / BPF_REG_SIZE; j++) {
2007                                 if (func->stack[j].slot_type[0] != STACK_SPILL)
2008                                         continue;
2009                                 reg = &func->stack[j].spilled_ptr;
2010                                 if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE)
2011                                         continue;
2012                                 reg->precise = true;
2013                         }
2014                 }
2015 }
2016 
2017 static int __mark_chain_precision(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno,
2018                                   int spi)
2019 {
2020         struct bpf_verifier_state *st = env->cur_state;
2021         int first_idx = st->first_insn_idx;
2022         int last_idx = env->insn_idx;
2023         struct bpf_func_state *func;
2024         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
2025         u32 reg_mask = regno >= 0 ? 1u << regno : 0;
2026         u64 stack_mask = spi >= 0 ? 1ull << spi : 0;
2027         bool skip_first = true;
2028         bool new_marks = false;
2029         int i, err;
2030 
2031         if (!env->bpf_capable)
2032                 return 0;
2033 
2034         func = st->frame[st->curframe];
2035         if (regno >= 0) {
2036                 reg = &func->regs[regno];
2037                 if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
2038                         WARN_ONCE(1, "backtracing misuse");
2039                         return -EFAULT;
2040                 }
2041                 if (!reg->precise)
2042                         new_marks = true;
2043                 else
2044                         reg_mask = 0;
2045                 reg->precise = true;
2046         }
2047 
2048         while (spi >= 0) {
2049                 if (func->stack[spi].slot_type[0] != STACK_SPILL) {
2050                         stack_mask = 0;
2051                         break;
2052                 }
2053                 reg = &func->stack[spi].spilled_ptr;
2054                 if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
2055                         stack_mask = 0;
2056                         break;
2057                 }
2058                 if (!reg->precise)
2059                         new_marks = true;
2060                 else
2061                         stack_mask = 0;
2062                 reg->precise = true;
2063                 break;
2064         }
2065 
2066         if (!new_marks)
2067                 return 0;
2068         if (!reg_mask && !stack_mask)
2069                 return 0;
2070         for (;;) {
2071                 DECLARE_BITMAP(mask, 64);
2072                 u32 history = st->jmp_history_cnt;
2073 
2074                 if (env->log.level & BPF_LOG_LEVEL)
2075                         verbose(env, "last_idx %d first_idx %d\n", last_idx, first_idx);
2076                 for (i = last_idx;;) {
2077                         if (skip_first) {
2078                                 err = 0;
2079                                 skip_first = false;
2080                         } else {
2081                                 err = backtrack_insn(env, i, &reg_mask, &stack_mask);
2082                         }
2083                         if (err == -ENOTSUPP) {
2084                                 mark_all_scalars_precise(env, st);
2085                                 return 0;
2086                         } else if (err) {
2087                                 return err;
2088                         }
2089                         if (!reg_mask && !stack_mask)
2090                                 /* Found assignment(s) into tracked register in this state.
2091                                  * Since this state is already marked, just return.
2092                                  * Nothing to be tracked further in the parent state.
2093                                  */
2094                                 return 0;
2095                         if (i == first_idx)
2096                                 break;
2097                         i = get_prev_insn_idx(st, i, &history);
2098                         if (i >= env->prog->len) {
2099                                 /* This can happen if backtracking reached insn 0
2100                                  * and there are still reg_mask or stack_mask
2101                                  * to backtrack.
2102                                  * It means the backtracking missed the spot where
2103                                  * particular register was initialized with a constant.
2104                                  */
2105                                 verbose(env, "BUG backtracking idx %d\n", i);
2106                                 WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier backtracking bug");
2107                                 return -EFAULT;
2108                         }
2109                 }
2110                 st = st->parent;
2111                 if (!st)
2112                         break;
2113 
2114                 new_marks = false;
2115                 func = st->frame[st->curframe];
2116                 bitmap_from_u64(mask, reg_mask);
2117                 for_each_set_bit(i, mask, 32) {
2118                         reg = &func->regs[i];
2119                         if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
2120                                 reg_mask &= ~(1u << i);
2121                                 continue;
2122                         }
2123                         if (!reg->precise)
2124                                 new_marks = true;
2125                         reg->precise = true;
2126                 }
2127 
2128                 bitmap_from_u64(mask, stack_mask);
2129                 for_each_set_bit(i, mask, 64) {
2130                         if (i >= func->allocated_stack / BPF_REG_SIZE) {
2131                                 /* the sequence of instructions:
2132                                  * 2: (bf) r3 = r10
2133                                  * 3: (7b) *(u64 *)(r3 -8) = r0
2134                                  * 4: (79) r4 = *(u64 *)(r10 -8)
2135                                  * doesn't contain jmps. It's backtracked
2136                                  * as a single block.
2137                                  * During backtracking insn 3 is not recognized as
2138                                  * stack access, so at the end of backtracking
2139                                  * stack slot fp-8 is still marked in stack_mask.
2140                                  * However the parent state may not have accessed
2141                                  * fp-8 and it's "unallocated" stack space.
2142                                  * In such case fallback to conservative.
2143                                  */
2144                                 mark_all_scalars_precise(env, st);
2145                                 return 0;
2146                         }
2147 
2148                         if (func->stack[i].slot_type[0] != STACK_SPILL) {
2149                                 stack_mask &= ~(1ull << i);
2150                                 continue;
2151                         }
2152                         reg = &func->stack[i].spilled_ptr;
2153                         if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
2154                                 stack_mask &= ~(1ull << i);
2155                                 continue;
2156                         }
2157                         if (!reg->precise)
2158                                 new_marks = true;
2159                         reg->precise = true;
2160                 }
2161                 if (env->log.level & BPF_LOG_LEVEL) {
2162                         print_verifier_state(env, func);
2163                         verbose(env, "parent %s regs=%x stack=%llx marks\n",
2164                                 new_marks ? "didn't have" : "already had",
2165                                 reg_mask, stack_mask);
2166                 }
2167 
2168                 if (!reg_mask && !stack_mask)
2169                         break;
2170                 if (!new_marks)
2171                         break;
2172 
2173                 last_idx = st->last_insn_idx;
2174                 first_idx = st->first_insn_idx;
2175         }
2176         return 0;
2177 }
2178 
2179 static int mark_chain_precision(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
2180 {
2181         return __mark_chain_precision(env, regno, -1);
2182 }
2183 
2184 static int mark_chain_precision_stack(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int spi)
2185 {
2186         return __mark_chain_precision(env, -1, spi);
2187 }
2188 
2189 static bool is_spillable_regtype(enum bpf_reg_type type)
2190 {
2191         switch (type) {
2192         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE:
2193         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE_OR_NULL:
2194         case PTR_TO_STACK:
2195         case PTR_TO_CTX:
2196         case PTR_TO_PACKET:
2197         case PTR_TO_PACKET_META:
2198         case PTR_TO_PACKET_END:
2199         case PTR_TO_FLOW_KEYS:
2200         case CONST_PTR_TO_MAP:
2201         case PTR_TO_SOCKET:
2202         case PTR_TO_SOCKET_OR_NULL:
2203         case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON:
2204         case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON_OR_NULL:
2205         case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK:
2206         case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK_OR_NULL:
2207         case PTR_TO_XDP_SOCK:
2208         case PTR_TO_BTF_ID:
2209         case PTR_TO_BTF_ID_OR_NULL:
2210         case PTR_TO_RDONLY_BUF:
2211         case PTR_TO_RDONLY_BUF_OR_NULL:
2212         case PTR_TO_RDWR_BUF:
2213         case PTR_TO_RDWR_BUF_OR_NULL:
2214         case PTR_TO_PERCPU_BTF_ID:
2215         case PTR_TO_MEM:
2216         case PTR_TO_MEM_OR_NULL:
2217                 return true;
2218         default:
2219                 return false;
2220         }
2221 }
2222 
2223 /* Does this register contain a constant zero? */
2224 static bool register_is_null(struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
2225 {
2226         return reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && tnum_equals_const(reg->var_off, 0);
2227 }
2228 
2229 static bool register_is_const(struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
2230 {
2231         return reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && tnum_is_const(reg->var_off);
2232 }
2233 
2234 static bool __is_scalar_unbounded(struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
2235 {
2236         return tnum_is_unknown(reg->var_off) &&
2237                reg->smin_value == S64_MIN && reg->smax_value == S64_MAX &&
2238                reg->umin_value == 0 && reg->umax_value == U64_MAX &&
2239                reg->s32_min_value == S32_MIN && reg->s32_max_value == S32_MAX &&
2240                reg->u32_min_value == 0 && reg->u32_max_value == U32_MAX;
2241 }
2242 
2243 static bool register_is_bounded(struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
2244 {
2245         return reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && !__is_scalar_unbounded(reg);
2246 }
2247 
2248 static bool __is_pointer_value(bool allow_ptr_leaks,
2249                                const struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
2250 {
2251         if (allow_ptr_leaks)
2252                 return false;
2253 
2254         return reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE;
2255 }
2256 
2257 static void save_register_state(struct bpf_func_state *state,
2258                                 int spi, struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
2259 {
2260         int i;
2261 
2262         state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr = *reg;
2263         state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr.live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
2264 
2265         for (i = 0; i < BPF_REG_SIZE; i++)
2266                 state->stack[spi].slot_type[i] = STACK_SPILL;
2267 }
2268 
2269 /* check_stack_{read,write}_fixed_off functions track spill/fill of registers,
2270  * stack boundary and alignment are checked in check_mem_access()
2271  */
2272 static int check_stack_write_fixed_off(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2273                                        /* stack frame we're writing to */
2274                                        struct bpf_func_state *state,
2275                                        int off, int size, int value_regno,
2276                                        int insn_idx)
2277 {
2278         struct bpf_func_state *cur; /* state of the current function */
2279         int i, slot = -off - 1, spi = slot / BPF_REG_SIZE, err;
2280         u32 dst_reg = env->prog->insnsi[insn_idx].dst_reg;
2281         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = NULL;
2282 
2283         err = realloc_func_state(state, round_up(slot + 1, BPF_REG_SIZE),
2284                                  state->acquired_refs, true);
2285         if (err)
2286                 return err;
2287         /* caller checked that off % size == 0 and -MAX_BPF_STACK <= off < 0,
2288          * so it's aligned access and [off, off + size) are within stack limits
2289          */
2290         if (!env->allow_ptr_leaks &&
2291             state->stack[spi].slot_type[0] == STACK_SPILL &&
2292             size != BPF_REG_SIZE) {
2293                 verbose(env, "attempt to corrupt spilled pointer on stack\n");
2294                 return -EACCES;
2295         }
2296 
2297         cur = env->cur_state->frame[env->cur_state->curframe];
2298         if (value_regno >= 0)
2299                 reg = &cur->regs[value_regno];
2300 
2301         if (reg && size == BPF_REG_SIZE && register_is_bounded(reg) &&
2302             !register_is_null(reg) && env->bpf_capable) {
2303                 if (dst_reg != BPF_REG_FP) {
2304                         /* The backtracking logic can only recognize explicit
2305                          * stack slot address like [fp - 8]. Other spill of
2306                          * scalar via different register has to be conervative.
2307                          * Backtrack from here and mark all registers as precise
2308                          * that contributed into 'reg' being a constant.
2309                          */
2310                         err = mark_chain_precision(env, value_regno);
2311                         if (err)
2312                                 return err;
2313                 }
2314                 save_register_state(state, spi, reg);
2315         } else if (reg && is_spillable_regtype(reg->type)) {
2316                 /* register containing pointer is being spilled into stack */
2317                 if (size != BPF_REG_SIZE) {
2318                         verbose_linfo(env, insn_idx, "; ");
2319                         verbose(env, "invalid size of register spill\n");
2320                         return -EACCES;
2321                 }
2322 
2323                 if (state != cur && reg->type == PTR_TO_STACK) {
2324                         verbose(env, "cannot spill pointers to stack into stack frame of the caller\n");
2325                         return -EINVAL;
2326                 }
2327 
2328                 if (!env->bypass_spec_v4) {
2329                         bool sanitize = false;
2330 
2331                         if (state->stack[spi].slot_type[0] == STACK_SPILL &&
2332                             register_is_const(&state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr))
2333                                 sanitize = true;
2334                         for (i = 0; i < BPF_REG_SIZE; i++)
2335                                 if (state->stack[spi].slot_type[i] == STACK_MISC) {
2336                                         sanitize = true;
2337                                         break;
2338                                 }
2339                         if (sanitize) {
2340                                 int *poff = &env->insn_aux_data[insn_idx].sanitize_stack_off;
2341                                 int soff = (-spi - 1) * BPF_REG_SIZE;
2342 
2343                                 /* detected reuse of integer stack slot with a pointer
2344                                  * which means either llvm is reusing stack slot or
2345                                  * an attacker is trying to exploit CVE-2018-3639
2346                                  * (speculative store bypass)
2347                                  * Have to sanitize that slot with preemptive
2348                                  * store of zero.
2349                                  */
2350                                 if (*poff && *poff != soff) {
2351                                         /* disallow programs where single insn stores
2352                                          * into two different stack slots, since verifier
2353                                          * cannot sanitize them
2354                                          */
2355                                         verbose(env,
2356                                                 "insn %d cannot access two stack slots fp%d and fp%d",
2357                                                 insn_idx, *poff, soff);
2358                                         return -EINVAL;
2359                                 }
2360                                 *poff = soff;
2361                         }
2362                 }
2363                 save_register_state(state, spi, reg);
2364         } else {
2365                 u8 type = STACK_MISC;
2366 
2367                 /* regular write of data into stack destroys any spilled ptr */
2368                 state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr.type = NOT_INIT;
2369                 /* Mark slots as STACK_MISC if they belonged to spilled ptr. */
2370                 if (state->stack[spi].slot_type[0] == STACK_SPILL)
2371                         for (i = 0; i < BPF_REG_SIZE; i++)
2372                                 state->stack[spi].slot_type[i] = STACK_MISC;
2373 
2374                 /* only mark the slot as written if all 8 bytes were written
2375                  * otherwise read propagation may incorrectly stop too soon
2376                  * when stack slots are partially written.
2377                  * This heuristic means that read propagation will be
2378                  * conservative, since it will add reg_live_read marks
2379                  * to stack slots all the way to first state when programs
2380                  * writes+reads less than 8 bytes
2381                  */
2382                 if (size == BPF_REG_SIZE)
2383                         state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr.live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
2384 
2385                 /* when we zero initialize stack slots mark them as such */
2386                 if (reg && register_is_null(reg)) {
2387                         /* backtracking doesn't work for STACK_ZERO yet. */
2388                         err = mark_chain_precision(env, value_regno);
2389                         if (err)
2390                                 return err;
2391                         type = STACK_ZERO;
2392                 }
2393 
2394                 /* Mark slots affected by this stack write. */
2395                 for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
2396                         state->stack[spi].slot_type[(slot - i) % BPF_REG_SIZE] =
2397                                 type;
2398         }
2399         return 0;
2400 }
2401 
2402 /* Write the stack: 'stack[ptr_regno + off] = value_regno'. 'ptr_regno' is
2403  * known to contain a variable offset.
2404  * This function checks whether the write is permitted and conservatively
2405  * tracks the effects of the write, considering that each stack slot in the
2406  * dynamic range is potentially written to.
2407  *
2408  * 'off' includes 'regno->off'.
2409  * 'value_regno' can be -1, meaning that an unknown value is being written to
2410  * the stack.
2411  *
2412  * Spilled pointers in range are not marked as written because we don't know
2413  * what's going to be actually written. This means that read propagation for
2414  * future reads cannot be terminated by this write.
2415  *
2416  * For privileged programs, uninitialized stack slots are considered
2417  * initialized by this write (even though we don't know exactly what offsets
2418  * are going to be written to). The idea is that we don't want the verifier to
2419  * reject future reads that access slots written to through variable offsets.
2420  */
2421 static int check_stack_write_var_off(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2422                                      /* func where register points to */
2423                                      struct bpf_func_state *state,
2424                                      int ptr_regno, int off, int size,
2425                                      int value_regno, int insn_idx)
2426 {
2427         struct bpf_func_state *cur; /* state of the current function */
2428         int min_off, max_off;
2429         int i, err;
2430         struct bpf_reg_state *ptr_reg = NULL, *value_reg = NULL;
2431         bool writing_zero = false;
2432         /* set if the fact that we're writing a zero is used to let any
2433          * stack slots remain STACK_ZERO
2434          */
2435         bool zero_used = false;
2436 
2437         cur = env->cur_state->frame[env->cur_state->curframe];
2438         ptr_reg = &cur->regs[ptr_regno];
2439         min_off = ptr_reg->smin_value + off;
2440         max_off = ptr_reg->smax_value + off + size;
2441         if (value_regno >= 0)
2442                 value_reg = &cur->regs[value_regno];
2443         if (value_reg && register_is_null(value_reg))
2444                 writing_zero = true;
2445 
2446         err = realloc_func_state(state, round_up(-min_off, BPF_REG_SIZE),
2447                                  state->acquired_refs, true);
2448         if (err)
2449                 return err;
2450 
2451 
2452         /* Variable offset writes destroy any spilled pointers in range. */
2453         for (i = min_off; i < max_off; i++) {
2454                 u8 new_type, *stype;
2455                 int slot, spi;
2456 
2457                 slot = -i - 1;
2458                 spi = slot / BPF_REG_SIZE;
2459                 stype = &state->stack[spi].slot_type[slot % BPF_REG_SIZE];
2460 
2461                 if (!env->allow_ptr_leaks
2462                                 && *stype != NOT_INIT
2463                                 && *stype != SCALAR_VALUE) {
2464                         /* Reject the write if there's are spilled pointers in
2465                          * range. If we didn't reject here, the ptr status
2466                          * would be erased below (even though not all slots are
2467                          * actually overwritten), possibly opening the door to
2468                          * leaks.
2469                          */
2470                         verbose(env, "spilled ptr in range of var-offset stack write; insn %d, ptr off: %d",
2471                                 insn_idx, i);
2472                         return -EINVAL;
2473                 }
2474 
2475                 /* Erase all spilled pointers. */
2476                 state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr.type = NOT_INIT;
2477 
2478                 /* Update the slot type. */
2479                 new_type = STACK_MISC;
2480                 if (writing_zero && *stype == STACK_ZERO) {
2481                         new_type = STACK_ZERO;
2482                         zero_used = true;
2483                 }
2484                 /* If the slot is STACK_INVALID, we check whether it's OK to
2485                  * pretend that it will be initialized by this write. The slot
2486                  * might not actually be written to, and so if we mark it as
2487                  * initialized future reads might leak uninitialized memory.
2488                  * For privileged programs, we will accept such reads to slots
2489                  * that may or may not be written because, if we're reject
2490                  * them, the error would be too confusing.
2491                  */
2492                 if (*stype == STACK_INVALID && !env->allow_uninit_stack) {
2493                         verbose(env, "uninit stack in range of var-offset write prohibited for !root; insn %d, off: %d",
2494                                         insn_idx, i);
2495                         return -EINVAL;
2496                 }
2497                 *stype = new_type;
2498         }
2499         if (zero_used) {
2500                 /* backtracking doesn't work for STACK_ZERO yet. */
2501                 err = mark_chain_precision(env, value_regno);
2502                 if (err)
2503                         return err;
2504         }
2505         return 0;
2506 }
2507 
2508 /* When register 'dst_regno' is assigned some values from stack[min_off,
2509  * max_off), we set the register's type according to the types of the
2510  * respective stack slots. If all the stack values are known to be zeros, then
2511  * so is the destination reg. Otherwise, the register is considered to be
2512  * SCALAR. This function does not deal with register filling; the caller must
2513  * ensure that all spilled registers in the stack range have been marked as
2514  * read.
2515  */
2516 static void mark_reg_stack_read(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2517                                 /* func where src register points to */
2518                                 struct bpf_func_state *ptr_state,
2519                                 int min_off, int max_off, int dst_regno)
2520 {
2521         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
2522         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
2523         int i, slot, spi;
2524         u8 *stype;
2525         int zeros = 0;
2526 
2527         for (i = min_off; i < max_off; i++) {
2528                 slot = -i - 1;
2529                 spi = slot / BPF_REG_SIZE;
2530                 stype = ptr_state->stack[spi].slot_type;
2531                 if (stype[slot % BPF_REG_SIZE] != STACK_ZERO)
2532                         break;
2533                 zeros++;
2534         }
2535         if (zeros == max_off - min_off) {
2536                 /* any access_size read into register is zero extended,
2537                  * so the whole register == const_zero
2538                  */
2539                 __mark_reg_const_zero(&state->regs[dst_regno]);
2540                 /* backtracking doesn't support STACK_ZERO yet,
2541                  * so mark it precise here, so that later
2542                  * backtracking can stop here.
2543                  * Backtracking may not need this if this register
2544                  * doesn't participate in pointer adjustment.
2545                  * Forward propagation of precise flag is not
2546                  * necessary either. This mark is only to stop
2547                  * backtracking. Any register that contributed
2548                  * to const 0 was marked precise before spill.
2549                  */
2550                 state->regs[dst_regno].precise = true;
2551         } else {
2552                 /* have read misc data from the stack */
2553                 mark_reg_unknown(env, state->regs, dst_regno);
2554         }
2555         state->regs[dst_regno].live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
2556 }
2557 
2558 /* Read the stack at 'off' and put the results into the register indicated by
2559  * 'dst_regno'. It handles reg filling if the addressed stack slot is a
2560  * spilled reg.
2561  *
2562  * 'dst_regno' can be -1, meaning that the read value is not going to a
2563  * register.
2564  *
2565  * The access is assumed to be within the current stack bounds.
2566  */
2567 static int check_stack_read_fixed_off(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2568                                       /* func where src register points to */
2569                                       struct bpf_func_state *reg_state,
2570                                       int off, int size, int dst_regno)
2571 {
2572         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
2573         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
2574         int i, slot = -off - 1, spi = slot / BPF_REG_SIZE;
2575         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
2576         u8 *stype;
2577 
2578         stype = reg_state->stack[spi].slot_type;
2579         reg = &reg_state->stack[spi].spilled_ptr;
2580 
2581         if (stype[0] == STACK_SPILL) {
2582                 if (size != BPF_REG_SIZE) {
2583                         if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
2584                                 verbose_linfo(env, env->insn_idx, "; ");
2585                                 verbose(env, "invalid size of register fill\n");
2586                                 return -EACCES;
2587                         }
2588                         if (dst_regno >= 0) {
2589                                 mark_reg_unknown(env, state->regs, dst_regno);
2590                                 state->regs[dst_regno].live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
2591                         }
2592                         mark_reg_read(env, reg, reg->parent, REG_LIVE_READ64);
2593                         return 0;
2594                 }
2595                 for (i = 1; i < BPF_REG_SIZE; i++) {
2596                         if (stype[(slot - i) % BPF_REG_SIZE] != STACK_SPILL) {
2597                                 verbose(env, "corrupted spill memory\n");
2598                                 return -EACCES;
2599                         }
2600                 }
2601 
2602                 if (dst_regno >= 0) {
2603                         /* restore register state from stack */
2604                         state->regs[dst_regno] = *reg;
2605                         /* mark reg as written since spilled pointer state likely
2606                          * has its liveness marks cleared by is_state_visited()
2607                          * which resets stack/reg liveness for state transitions
2608                          */
2609                         state->regs[dst_regno].live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
2610                 } else if (__is_pointer_value(env->allow_ptr_leaks, reg)) {
2611                         /* If dst_regno==-1, the caller is asking us whether
2612                          * it is acceptable to use this value as a SCALAR_VALUE
2613                          * (e.g. for XADD).
2614                          * We must not allow unprivileged callers to do that
2615                          * with spilled pointers.
2616                          */
2617                         verbose(env, "leaking pointer from stack off %d\n",
2618                                 off);
2619                         return -EACCES;
2620                 }
2621                 mark_reg_read(env, reg, reg->parent, REG_LIVE_READ64);
2622         } else {
2623                 u8 type;
2624 
2625                 for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
2626                         type = stype[(slot - i) % BPF_REG_SIZE];
2627                         if (type == STACK_MISC)
2628                                 continue;
2629                         if (type == STACK_ZERO)
2630                                 continue;
2631                         verbose(env, "invalid read from stack off %d+%d size %d\n",
2632                                 off, i, size);
2633                         return -EACCES;
2634                 }
2635                 mark_reg_read(env, reg, reg->parent, REG_LIVE_READ64);
2636                 if (dst_regno >= 0)
2637                         mark_reg_stack_read(env, reg_state, off, off + size, dst_regno);
2638         }
2639         return 0;
2640 }
2641 
2642 enum stack_access_src {
2643         ACCESS_DIRECT = 1,  /* the access is performed by an instruction */
2644         ACCESS_HELPER = 2,  /* the access is performed by a helper */
2645 };
2646 
2647 static int check_stack_range_initialized(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2648                                          int regno, int off, int access_size,
2649                                          bool zero_size_allowed,
2650                                          enum stack_access_src type,
2651                                          struct bpf_call_arg_meta *meta);
2652 
2653 static struct bpf_reg_state *reg_state(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
2654 {
2655         return cur_regs(env) + regno;
2656 }
2657 
2658 /* Read the stack at 'ptr_regno + off' and put the result into the register
2659  * 'dst_regno'.
2660  * 'off' includes the pointer register's fixed offset(i.e. 'ptr_regno.off'),
2661  * but not its variable offset.
2662  * 'size' is assumed to be <= reg size and the access is assumed to be aligned.
2663  *
2664  * As opposed to check_stack_read_fixed_off, this function doesn't deal with
2665  * filling registers (i.e. reads of spilled register cannot be detected when
2666  * the offset is not fixed). We conservatively mark 'dst_regno' as containing
2667  * SCALAR_VALUE. That's why we assert that the 'ptr_regno' has a variable
2668  * offset; for a fixed offset check_stack_read_fixed_off should be used
2669  * instead.
2670  */
2671 static int check_stack_read_var_off(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2672                                     int ptr_regno, int off, int size, int dst_regno)
2673 {
2674         /* The state of the source register. */
2675         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, ptr_regno);
2676         struct bpf_func_state *ptr_state = func(env, reg);
2677         int err;
2678         int min_off, max_off;
2679 
2680         /* Note that we pass a NULL meta, so raw access will not be permitted.
2681          */
2682         err = check_stack_range_initialized(env, ptr_regno, off, size,
2683                                             false, ACCESS_DIRECT, NULL);
2684         if (err)
2685                 return err;
2686 
2687         min_off = reg->smin_value + off;
2688         max_off = reg->smax_value + off;
2689         mark_reg_stack_read(env, ptr_state, min_off, max_off + size, dst_regno);
2690         return 0;
2691 }
2692 
2693 /* check_stack_read dispatches to check_stack_read_fixed_off or
2694  * check_stack_read_var_off.
2695  *
2696  * The caller must ensure that the offset falls within the allocated stack
2697  * bounds.
2698  *
2699  * 'dst_regno' is a register which will receive the value from the stack. It
2700  * can be -1, meaning that the read value is not going to a register.
2701  */
2702 static int check_stack_read(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2703                             int ptr_regno, int off, int size,
2704                             int dst_regno)
2705 {
2706         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, ptr_regno);
2707         struct bpf_func_state *state = func(env, reg);
2708         int err;
2709         /* Some accesses are only permitted with a static offset. */
2710         bool var_off = !tnum_is_const(reg->var_off);
2711 
2712         /* The offset is required to be static when reads don't go to a
2713          * register, in order to not leak pointers (see
2714          * check_stack_read_fixed_off).
2715          */
2716         if (dst_regno < 0 && var_off) {
2717                 char tn_buf[48];
2718 
2719                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
2720                 verbose(env, "variable offset stack pointer cannot be passed into helper function; var_off=%s off=%d size=%d\n",
2721                         tn_buf, off, size);
2722                 return -EACCES;
2723         }
2724         /* Variable offset is prohibited for unprivileged mode for simplicity
2725          * since it requires corresponding support in Spectre masking for stack
2726          * ALU. See also retrieve_ptr_limit().
2727          */
2728         if (!env->bypass_spec_v1 && var_off) {
2729                 char tn_buf[48];
2730 
2731                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
2732                 verbose(env, "R%d variable offset stack access prohibited for !root, var_off=%s\n",
2733                                 ptr_regno, tn_buf);
2734                 return -EACCES;
2735         }
2736 
2737         if (!var_off) {
2738                 off += reg->var_off.value;
2739                 err = check_stack_read_fixed_off(env, state, off, size,
2740                                                  dst_regno);
2741         } else {
2742                 /* Variable offset stack reads need more conservative handling
2743                  * than fixed offset ones. Note that dst_regno >= 0 on this
2744                  * branch.
2745                  */
2746                 err = check_stack_read_var_off(env, ptr_regno, off, size,
2747                                                dst_regno);
2748         }
2749         return err;
2750 }
2751 
2752 
2753 /* check_stack_write dispatches to check_stack_write_fixed_off or
2754  * check_stack_write_var_off.
2755  *
2756  * 'ptr_regno' is the register used as a pointer into the stack.
2757  * 'off' includes 'ptr_regno->off', but not its variable offset (if any).
2758  * 'value_regno' is the register whose value we're writing to the stack. It can
2759  * be -1, meaning that we're not writing from a register.
2760  *
2761  * The caller must ensure that the offset falls within the maximum stack size.
2762  */
2763 static int check_stack_write(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2764                              int ptr_regno, int off, int size,
2765                              int value_regno, int insn_idx)
2766 {
2767         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, ptr_regno);
2768         struct bpf_func_state *state = func(env, reg);
2769         int err;
2770 
2771         if (tnum_is_const(reg->var_off)) {
2772                 off += reg->var_off.value;
2773                 err = check_stack_write_fixed_off(env, state, off, size,
2774                                                   value_regno, insn_idx);
2775         } else {
2776                 /* Variable offset stack reads need more conservative handling
2777                  * than fixed offset ones.
2778                  */
2779                 err = check_stack_write_var_off(env, state,
2780                                                 ptr_regno, off, size,
2781                                                 value_regno, insn_idx);
2782         }
2783         return err;
2784 }
2785 
2786 static int check_map_access_type(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, u32 regno,
2787                                  int off, int size, enum bpf_access_type type)
2788 {
2789         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
2790         struct bpf_map *map = regs[regno].map_ptr;
2791         u32 cap = bpf_map_flags_to_cap(map);
2792 
2793         if (type == BPF_WRITE && !(cap & BPF_MAP_CAN_WRITE)) {
2794                 verbose(env, "write into map forbidden, value_size=%d off=%d size=%d\n",
2795                         map->value_size, off, size);
2796                 return -EACCES;
2797         }
2798 
2799         if (type == BPF_READ && !(cap & BPF_MAP_CAN_READ)) {
2800                 verbose(env, "read from map forbidden, value_size=%d off=%d size=%d\n",
2801                         map->value_size, off, size);
2802                 return -EACCES;
2803         }
2804 
2805         return 0;
2806 }
2807 
2808 /* check read/write into memory region (e.g., map value, ringbuf sample, etc) */
2809 static int __check_mem_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno,
2810                               int off, int size, u32 mem_size,
2811                               bool zero_size_allowed)
2812 {
2813         bool size_ok = size > 0 || (size == 0 && zero_size_allowed);
2814         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
2815 
2816         if (off >= 0 && size_ok && (u64)off + size <= mem_size)
2817                 return 0;
2818 
2819         reg = &cur_regs(env)[regno];
2820         switch (reg->type) {
2821         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE:
2822                 verbose(env, "invalid access to map value, value_size=%d off=%d size=%d\n",
2823                         mem_size, off, size);
2824                 break;
2825         case PTR_TO_PACKET:
2826         case PTR_TO_PACKET_META:
2827         case PTR_TO_PACKET_END:
2828                 verbose(env, "invalid access to packet, off=%d size=%d, R%d(id=%d,off=%d,r=%d)\n",
2829                         off, size, regno, reg->id, off, mem_size);
2830                 break;
2831         case PTR_TO_MEM:
2832         default:
2833                 verbose(env, "invalid access to memory, mem_size=%u off=%d size=%d\n",
2834                         mem_size, off, size);
2835         }
2836 
2837         return -EACCES;
2838 }
2839 
2840 /* check read/write into a memory region with possible variable offset */
2841 static int check_mem_region_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, u32 regno,
2842                                    int off, int size, u32 mem_size,
2843                                    bool zero_size_allowed)
2844 {
2845         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
2846         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
2847         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = &state->regs[regno];
2848         int err;
2849 
2850         /* We may have adjusted the register pointing to memory region, so we
2851          * need to try adding each of min_value and max_value to off
2852          * to make sure our theoretical access will be safe.
2853          */
2854         if (env->log.level & BPF_LOG_LEVEL)
2855                 print_verifier_state(env, state);
2856 
2857         /* The minimum value is only important with signed
2858          * comparisons where we can't assume the floor of a
2859          * value is 0.  If we are using signed variables for our
2860          * index'es we need to make sure that whatever we use
2861          * will have a set floor within our range.
2862          */
2863         if (reg->smin_value < 0 &&
2864             (reg->smin_value == S64_MIN ||
2865              (off + reg->smin_value != (s64)(s32)(off + reg->smin_value)) ||
2866               reg->smin_value + off < 0)) {
2867                 verbose(env, "R%d min value is negative, either use unsigned index or do a if (index >=0) check.\n",
2868                         regno);
2869                 return -EACCES;
2870         }
2871         err = __check_mem_access(env, regno, reg->smin_value + off, size,
2872                                  mem_size, zero_size_allowed);
2873         if (err) {
2874                 verbose(env, "R%d min value is outside of the allowed memory range\n",
2875                         regno);
2876                 return err;
2877         }
2878 
2879         /* If we haven't set a max value then we need to bail since we can't be
2880          * sure we won't do bad things.
2881          * If reg->umax_value + off could overflow, treat that as unbounded too.
2882          */
2883         if (reg->umax_value >= BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF) {
2884                 verbose(env, "R%d unbounded memory access, make sure to bounds check any such access\n",
2885                         regno);
2886                 return -EACCES;
2887         }
2888         err = __check_mem_access(env, regno, reg->umax_value + off, size,
2889                                  mem_size, zero_size_allowed);
2890         if (err) {
2891                 verbose(env, "R%d max value is outside of the allowed memory range\n",
2892                         regno);
2893                 return err;
2894         }
2895 
2896         return 0;
2897 }
2898 
2899 /* check read/write into a map element with possible variable offset */
2900 static int check_map_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, u32 regno,
2901                             int off, int size, bool zero_size_allowed)
2902 {
2903         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
2904         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
2905         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = &state->regs[regno];
2906         struct bpf_map *map = reg->map_ptr;
2907         int err;
2908 
2909         err = check_mem_region_access(env, regno, off, size, map->value_size,
2910                                       zero_size_allowed);
2911         if (err)
2912                 return err;
2913 
2914         if (map_value_has_spin_lock(map)) {
2915                 u32 lock = map->spin_lock_off;
2916 
2917                 /* if any part of struct bpf_spin_lock can be touched by
2918                  * load/store reject this program.
2919                  * To check that [x1, x2) overlaps with [y1, y2)
2920                  * it is sufficient to check x1 < y2 && y1 < x2.
2921                  */
2922                 if (reg->smin_value + off < lock + sizeof(struct bpf_spin_lock) &&
2923                      lock < reg->umax_value + off + size) {
2924                         verbose(env, "bpf_spin_lock cannot be accessed directly by load/store\n");
2925                         return -EACCES;
2926                 }
2927         }
2928         return err;
2929 }
2930 
2931 #define MAX_PACKET_OFF 0xffff
2932 
2933 static enum bpf_prog_type resolve_prog_type(struct bpf_prog *prog)
2934 {
2935         return prog->aux->dst_prog ? prog->aux->dst_prog->type : prog->type;
2936 }
2937 
2938 static bool may_access_direct_pkt_data(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
2939                                        const struct bpf_call_arg_meta *meta,
2940                                        enum bpf_access_type t)
2941 {
2942         enum bpf_prog_type prog_type = resolve_prog_type(env->prog);
2943 
2944         switch (prog_type) {
2945         /* Program types only with direct read access go here! */
2946         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_LWT_IN:
2947         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_LWT_OUT:
2948         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_LWT_SEG6LOCAL:
2949         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SK_REUSEPORT:
2950         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_FLOW_DISSECTOR:
2951         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SKB:
2952                 if (t == BPF_WRITE)
2953                         return false;
2954                 fallthrough;
2955 
2956         /* Program types with direct read + write access go here! */
2957         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SCHED_CLS:
2958         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SCHED_ACT:
2959         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_XDP:
2960         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_LWT_XMIT:
2961         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SK_SKB:
2962         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SK_MSG:
2963                 if (meta)
2964                         return meta->pkt_access;
2965 
2966                 env->seen_direct_write = true;
2967                 return true;
2968 
2969         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SOCKOPT:
2970                 if (t == BPF_WRITE)
2971                         env->seen_direct_write = true;
2972 
2973                 return true;
2974 
2975         default:
2976                 return false;
2977         }
2978 }
2979 
2980 static int check_packet_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, u32 regno, int off,
2981                                int size, bool zero_size_allowed)
2982 {
2983         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
2984         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = &regs[regno];
2985         int err;
2986 
2987         /* We may have added a variable offset to the packet pointer; but any
2988          * reg->range we have comes after that.  We are only checking the fixed
2989          * offset.
2990          */
2991 
2992         /* We don't allow negative numbers, because we aren't tracking enough
2993          * detail to prove they're safe.
2994          */
2995         if (reg->smin_value < 0) {
2996                 verbose(env, "R%d min value is negative, either use unsigned index or do a if (index >=0) check.\n",
2997                         regno);
2998                 return -EACCES;
2999         }
3000         err = __check_mem_access(env, regno, off, size, reg->range,
3001                                  zero_size_allowed);
3002         if (err) {
3003                 verbose(env, "R%d offset is outside of the packet\n", regno);
3004                 return err;
3005         }
3006 
3007         /* __check_mem_access has made sure "off + size - 1" is within u16.
3008          * reg->umax_value can't be bigger than MAX_PACKET_OFF which is 0xffff,
3009          * otherwise find_good_pkt_pointers would have refused to set range info
3010          * that __check_mem_access would have rejected this pkt access.
3011          * Therefore, "off + reg->umax_value + size - 1" won't overflow u32.
3012          */
3013         env->prog->aux->max_pkt_offset =
3014                 max_t(u32, env->prog->aux->max_pkt_offset,
3015                       off + reg->umax_value + size - 1);
3016 
3017         return err;
3018 }
3019 
3020 /* check access to 'struct bpf_context' fields.  Supports fixed offsets only */
3021 static int check_ctx_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int insn_idx, int off, int size,
3022                             enum bpf_access_type t, enum bpf_reg_type *reg_type,
3023                             u32 *btf_id)
3024 {
3025         struct bpf_insn_access_aux info = {
3026                 .reg_type = *reg_type,
3027                 .log = &env->log,
3028         };
3029 
3030         if (env->ops->is_valid_access &&
3031             env->ops->is_valid_access(off, size, t, env->prog, &info)) {
3032                 /* A non zero info.ctx_field_size indicates that this field is a
3033                  * candidate for later verifier transformation to load the whole
3034                  * field and then apply a mask when accessed with a narrower
3035                  * access than actual ctx access size. A zero info.ctx_field_size
3036                  * will only allow for whole field access and rejects any other
3037                  * type of narrower access.
3038                  */
3039                 *reg_type = info.reg_type;
3040 
3041                 if (*reg_type == PTR_TO_BTF_ID || *reg_type == PTR_TO_BTF_ID_OR_NULL)
3042                         *btf_id = info.btf_id;
3043                 else
3044                         env->insn_aux_data[insn_idx].ctx_field_size = info.ctx_field_size;
3045                 /* remember the offset of last byte accessed in ctx */
3046                 if (env->prog->aux->max_ctx_offset < off + size)
3047                         env->prog->aux->max_ctx_offset = off + size;
3048                 return 0;
3049         }
3050 
3051         verbose(env, "invalid bpf_context access off=%d size=%d\n", off, size);
3052         return -EACCES;
3053 }
3054 
3055 static int check_flow_keys_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int off,
3056                                   int size)
3057 {
3058         if (size < 0 || off < 0 ||
3059             (u64)off + size > sizeof(struct bpf_flow_keys)) {
3060                 verbose(env, "invalid access to flow keys off=%d size=%d\n",
3061                         off, size);
3062                 return -EACCES;
3063         }
3064         return 0;
3065 }
3066 
3067 static int check_sock_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int insn_idx,
3068                              u32 regno, int off, int size,
3069                              enum bpf_access_type t)
3070 {
3071         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
3072         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = &regs[regno];
3073         struct bpf_insn_access_aux info = {};
3074         bool valid;
3075 
3076         if (reg->smin_value < 0) {
3077                 verbose(env, "R%d min value is negative, either use unsigned index or do a if (index >=0) check.\n",
3078                         regno);
3079                 return -EACCES;
3080         }
3081 
3082         switch (reg->type) {
3083         case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON:
3084                 valid = bpf_sock_common_is_valid_access(off, size, t, &info);
3085                 break;
3086         case PTR_TO_SOCKET:
3087                 valid = bpf_sock_is_valid_access(off, size, t, &info);
3088                 break;
3089         case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK:
3090                 valid = bpf_tcp_sock_is_valid_access(off, size, t, &info);
3091                 break;
3092         case PTR_TO_XDP_SOCK:
3093                 valid = bpf_xdp_sock_is_valid_access(off, size, t, &info);
3094                 break;
3095         default:
3096                 valid = false;
3097         }
3098 
3099 
3100         if (valid) {
3101                 env->insn_aux_data[insn_idx].ctx_field_size =
3102                         info.ctx_field_size;
3103                 return 0;
3104         }
3105 
3106         verbose(env, "R%d invalid %s access off=%d size=%d\n",
3107                 regno, reg_type_str[reg->type], off, size);
3108 
3109         return -EACCES;
3110 }
3111 
3112 static bool is_pointer_value(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
3113 {
3114         return __is_pointer_value(env->allow_ptr_leaks, reg_state(env, regno));
3115 }
3116 
3117 static bool is_ctx_reg(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
3118 {
3119         const struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, regno);
3120 
3121         return reg->type == PTR_TO_CTX;
3122 }
3123 
3124 static bool is_sk_reg(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
3125 {
3126         const struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, regno);
3127 
3128         return type_is_sk_pointer(reg->type);
3129 }
3130 
3131 static bool is_pkt_reg(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
3132 {
3133         const struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, regno);
3134 
3135         return type_is_pkt_pointer(reg->type);
3136 }
3137 
3138 static bool is_flow_key_reg(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int regno)
3139 {
3140         const struct bpf_reg_state *reg = reg_state(env, regno);
3141 
3142         /* Separate to is_ctx_reg() since we still want to allow BPF_ST here. */
3143         return reg->type == PTR_TO_FLOW_KEYS;
3144 }
3145 
3146 static int check_pkt_ptr_alignment(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3147                                    const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
3148                                    int off, int size, bool strict)
3149 {
3150         struct tnum reg_off;
3151         int ip_align;
3152 
3153         /* Byte size accesses are always allowed. */
3154         if (!strict || size == 1)
3155                 return 0;
3156 
3157         /* For platforms that do not have a Kconfig enabling
3158          * CONFIG_HAVE_EFFICIENT_UNALIGNED_ACCESS the value of
3159          * NET_IP_ALIGN is universally set to '2'.  And on platforms
3160          * that do set CONFIG_HAVE_EFFICIENT_UNALIGNED_ACCESS, we get
3161          * to this code only in strict mode where we want to emulate
3162          * the NET_IP_ALIGN==2 checking.  Therefore use an
3163          * unconditional IP align value of '2'.
3164          */
3165         ip_align = 2;
3166 
3167         reg_off = tnum_add(reg->var_off, tnum_const(ip_align + reg->off + off));
3168         if (!tnum_is_aligned(reg_off, size)) {
3169                 char tn_buf[48];
3170 
3171                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
3172                 verbose(env,
3173                         "misaligned packet access off %d+%s+%d+%d size %d\n",
3174                         ip_align, tn_buf, reg->off, off, size);
3175                 return -EACCES;
3176         }
3177 
3178         return 0;
3179 }
3180 
3181 static int check_generic_ptr_alignment(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3182                                        const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
3183                                        const char *pointer_desc,
3184                                        int off, int size, bool strict)
3185 {
3186         struct tnum reg_off;
3187 
3188         /* Byte size accesses are always allowed. */
3189         if (!strict || size == 1)
3190                 return 0;
3191 
3192         reg_off = tnum_add(reg->var_off, tnum_const(reg->off + off));
3193         if (!tnum_is_aligned(reg_off, size)) {
3194                 char tn_buf[48];
3195 
3196                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
3197                 verbose(env, "misaligned %saccess off %s+%d+%d size %d\n",
3198                         pointer_desc, tn_buf, reg->off, off, size);
3199                 return -EACCES;
3200         }
3201 
3202         return 0;
3203 }
3204 
3205 static int check_ptr_alignment(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3206                                const struct bpf_reg_state *reg, int off,
3207                                int size, bool strict_alignment_once)
3208 {
3209         bool strict = env->strict_alignment || strict_alignment_once;
3210         const char *pointer_desc = "";
3211 
3212         switch (reg->type) {
3213         case PTR_TO_PACKET:
3214         case PTR_TO_PACKET_META:
3215                 /* Special case, because of NET_IP_ALIGN. Given metadata sits
3216                  * right in front, treat it the very same way.
3217                  */
3218                 return check_pkt_ptr_alignment(env, reg, off, size, strict);
3219         case PTR_TO_FLOW_KEYS:
3220                 pointer_desc = "flow keys ";
3221                 break;
3222         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE:
3223                 pointer_desc = "value ";
3224                 break;
3225         case PTR_TO_CTX:
3226                 pointer_desc = "context ";
3227                 break;
3228         case PTR_TO_STACK:
3229                 pointer_desc = "stack ";
3230                 /* The stack spill tracking logic in check_stack_write_fixed_off()
3231                  * and check_stack_read_fixed_off() relies on stack accesses being
3232                  * aligned.
3233                  */
3234                 strict = true;
3235                 break;
3236         case PTR_TO_SOCKET:
3237                 pointer_desc = "sock ";
3238                 break;
3239         case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON:
3240                 pointer_desc = "sock_common ";
3241                 break;
3242         case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK:
3243                 pointer_desc = "tcp_sock ";
3244                 break;
3245         case PTR_TO_XDP_SOCK:
3246                 pointer_desc = "xdp_sock ";
3247                 break;
3248         default:
3249                 break;
3250         }
3251         return check_generic_ptr_alignment(env, reg, pointer_desc, off, size,
3252                                            strict);
3253 }
3254 
3255 static int update_stack_depth(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3256                               const struct bpf_func_state *func,
3257                               int off)
3258 {
3259         u16 stack = env->subprog_info[func->subprogno].stack_depth;
3260 
3261         if (stack >= -off)
3262                 return 0;
3263 
3264         /* update known max for given subprogram */
3265         env->subprog_info[func->subprogno].stack_depth = -off;
3266         return 0;
3267 }
3268 
3269 /* starting from main bpf function walk all instructions of the function
3270  * and recursively walk all callees that given function can call.
3271  * Ignore jump and exit insns.
3272  * Since recursion is prevented by check_cfg() this algorithm
3273  * only needs a local stack of MAX_CALL_FRAMES to remember callsites
3274  */
3275 static int check_max_stack_depth(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
3276 {
3277         int depth = 0, frame = 0, idx = 0, i = 0, subprog_end;
3278         struct bpf_subprog_info *subprog = env->subprog_info;
3279         struct bpf_insn *insn = env->prog->insnsi;
3280         bool tail_call_reachable = false;
3281         int ret_insn[MAX_CALL_FRAMES];
3282         int ret_prog[MAX_CALL_FRAMES];
3283         int j;
3284 
3285 process_func:
3286         /* protect against potential stack overflow that might happen when
3287          * bpf2bpf calls get combined with tailcalls. Limit the caller's stack
3288          * depth for such case down to 256 so that the worst case scenario
3289          * would result in 8k stack size (32 which is tailcall limit * 256 =
3290          * 8k).
3291          *
3292          * To get the idea what might happen, see an example:
3293          * func1 -> sub rsp, 128
3294          *  subfunc1 -> sub rsp, 256
3295          *  tailcall1 -> add rsp, 256
3296          *   func2 -> sub rsp, 192 (total stack size = 128 + 192 = 320)
3297          *   subfunc2 -> sub rsp, 64
3298          *   subfunc22 -> sub rsp, 128
3299          *   tailcall2 -> add rsp, 128
3300          *    func3 -> sub rsp, 32 (total stack size 128 + 192 + 64 + 32 = 416)
3301          *
3302          * tailcall will unwind the current stack frame but it will not get rid
3303          * of caller's stack as shown on the example above.
3304          */
3305         if (idx && subprog[idx].has_tail_call && depth >= 256) {
3306                 verbose(env,
3307                         "tail_calls are not allowed when call stack of previous frames is %d bytes. Too large\n",
3308                         depth);
3309                 return -EACCES;
3310         }
3311         /* round up to 32-bytes, since this is granularity
3312          * of interpreter stack size
3313          */
3314         depth += round_up(max_t(u32, subprog[idx].stack_depth, 1), 32);
3315         if (depth > MAX_BPF_STACK) {
3316                 verbose(env, "combined stack size of %d calls is %d. Too large\n",
3317                         frame + 1, depth);
3318                 return -EACCES;
3319         }
3320 continue_func:
3321         subprog_end = subprog[idx + 1].start;
3322         for (; i < subprog_end; i++) {
3323                 if (insn[i].code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL))
3324                         continue;
3325                 if (insn[i].src_reg != BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
3326                         continue;
3327                 /* remember insn and function to return to */
3328                 ret_insn[frame] = i + 1;
3329                 ret_prog[frame] = idx;
3330 
3331                 /* find the callee */
3332                 i = i + insn[i].imm + 1;
3333                 idx = find_subprog(env, i);
3334                 if (idx < 0) {
3335                         WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier bug. No program starts at insn %d\n",
3336                                   i);
3337                         return -EFAULT;
3338                 }
3339 
3340                 if (subprog[idx].has_tail_call)
3341                         tail_call_reachable = true;
3342 
3343                 frame++;
3344                 if (frame >= MAX_CALL_FRAMES) {
3345                         verbose(env, "the call stack of %d frames is too deep !\n",
3346                                 frame);
3347                         return -E2BIG;
3348                 }
3349                 goto process_func;
3350         }
3351         /* if tail call got detected across bpf2bpf calls then mark each of the
3352          * currently present subprog frames as tail call reachable subprogs;
3353          * this info will be utilized by JIT so that we will be preserving the
3354          * tail call counter throughout bpf2bpf calls combined with tailcalls
3355          */
3356         if (tail_call_reachable)
3357                 for (j = 0; j < frame; j++)
3358                         subprog[ret_prog[j]].tail_call_reachable = true;
3359 
3360         /* end of for() loop means the last insn of the 'subprog'
3361          * was reached. Doesn't matter whether it was JA or EXIT
3362          */
3363         if (frame == 0)
3364                 return 0;
3365         depth -= round_up(max_t(u32, subprog[idx].stack_depth, 1), 32);
3366         frame--;
3367         i = ret_insn[frame];
3368         idx = ret_prog[frame];
3369         goto continue_func;
3370 }
3371 
3372 #ifndef CONFIG_BPF_JIT_ALWAYS_ON
3373 static int get_callee_stack_depth(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3374                                   const struct bpf_insn *insn, int idx)
3375 {
3376         int start = idx + insn->imm + 1, subprog;
3377 
3378         subprog = find_subprog(env, start);
3379         if (subprog < 0) {
3380                 WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier bug. No program starts at insn %d\n",
3381                           start);
3382                 return -EFAULT;
3383         }
3384         return env->subprog_info[subprog].stack_depth;
3385 }
3386 #endif
3387 
3388 int check_ctx_reg(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3389                   const struct bpf_reg_state *reg, int regno)
3390 {
3391         /* Access to ctx or passing it to a helper is only allowed in
3392          * its original, unmodified form.
3393          */
3394 
3395         if (reg->off) {
3396                 verbose(env, "dereference of modified ctx ptr R%d off=%d disallowed\n",
3397                         regno, reg->off);
3398                 return -EACCES;
3399         }
3400 
3401         if (!tnum_is_const(reg->var_off) || reg->var_off.value) {
3402                 char tn_buf[48];
3403 
3404                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
3405                 verbose(env, "variable ctx access var_off=%s disallowed\n", tn_buf);
3406                 return -EACCES;
3407         }
3408 
3409         return 0;
3410 }
3411 
3412 static int __check_buffer_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3413                                  const char *buf_info,
3414                                  const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
3415                                  int regno, int off, int size)
3416 {
3417         if (off < 0) {
3418                 verbose(env,
3419                         "R%d invalid %s buffer access: off=%d, size=%d\n",
3420                         regno, buf_info, off, size);
3421                 return -EACCES;
3422         }
3423         if (!tnum_is_const(reg->var_off) || reg->var_off.value) {
3424                 char tn_buf[48];
3425 
3426                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
3427                 verbose(env,
3428                         "R%d invalid variable buffer offset: off=%d, var_off=%s\n",
3429                         regno, off, tn_buf);
3430                 return -EACCES;
3431         }
3432 
3433         return 0;
3434 }
3435 
3436 static int check_tp_buffer_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3437                                   const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
3438                                   int regno, int off, int size)
3439 {
3440         int err;
3441 
3442         err = __check_buffer_access(env, "tracepoint", reg, regno, off, size);
3443         if (err)
3444                 return err;
3445 
3446         if (off + size > env->prog->aux->max_tp_access)
3447                 env->prog->aux->max_tp_access = off + size;
3448 
3449         return 0;
3450 }
3451 
3452 static int check_buffer_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3453                                const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
3454                                int regno, int off, int size,
3455                                bool zero_size_allowed,
3456                                const char *buf_info,
3457                                u32 *max_access)
3458 {
3459         int err;
3460 
3461         err = __check_buffer_access(env, buf_info, reg, regno, off, size);
3462         if (err)
3463                 return err;
3464 
3465         if (off + size > *max_access)
3466                 *max_access = off + size;
3467 
3468         return 0;
3469 }
3470 
3471 /* BPF architecture zero extends alu32 ops into 64-bit registesr */
3472 static void zext_32_to_64(struct bpf_reg_state *reg)
3473 {
3474         reg->var_off = tnum_subreg(reg->var_off);
3475         __reg_assign_32_into_64(reg);
3476 }
3477 
3478 /* truncate register to smaller size (in bytes)
3479  * must be called with size < BPF_REG_SIZE
3480  */
3481 static void coerce_reg_to_size(struct bpf_reg_state *reg, int size)
3482 {
3483         u64 mask;
3484 
3485         /* clear high bits in bit representation */
3486         reg->var_off = tnum_cast(reg->var_off, size);
3487 
3488         /* fix arithmetic bounds */
3489         mask = ((u64)1 << (size * 8)) - 1;
3490         if ((reg->umin_value & ~mask) == (reg->umax_value & ~mask)) {
3491                 reg->umin_value &= mask;
3492                 reg->umax_value &= mask;
3493         } else {
3494                 reg->umin_value = 0;
3495                 reg->umax_value = mask;
3496         }
3497         reg->smin_value = reg->umin_value;
3498         reg->smax_value = reg->umax_value;
3499 
3500         /* If size is smaller than 32bit register the 32bit register
3501          * values are also truncated so we push 64-bit bounds into
3502          * 32-bit bounds. Above were truncated < 32-bits already.
3503          */
3504         if (size >= 4)
3505                 return;
3506         __reg_combine_64_into_32(reg);
3507 }
3508 
3509 static bool bpf_map_is_rdonly(const struct bpf_map *map)
3510 {
3511         return (map->map_flags & BPF_F_RDONLY_PROG) && map->frozen;
3512 }
3513 
3514 static int bpf_map_direct_read(struct bpf_map *map, int off, int size, u64 *val)
3515 {
3516         void *ptr;
3517         u64 addr;
3518         int err;
3519 
3520         err = map->ops->map_direct_value_addr(map, &addr, off);
3521         if (err)
3522                 return err;
3523         ptr = (void *)(long)addr + off;
3524 
3525         switch (size) {
3526         case sizeof(u8):
3527                 *val = (u64)*(u8 *)ptr;
3528                 break;
3529         case sizeof(u16):
3530                 *val = (u64)*(u16 *)ptr;
3531                 break;
3532         case sizeof(u32):
3533                 *val = (u64)*(u32 *)ptr;
3534                 break;
3535         case sizeof(u64):
3536                 *val = *(u64 *)ptr;
3537                 break;
3538         default:
3539                 return -EINVAL;
3540         }
3541         return 0;
3542 }
3543 
3544 static int check_ptr_to_btf_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3545                                    struct bpf_reg_state *regs,
3546                                    int regno, int off, int size,
3547                                    enum bpf_access_type atype,
3548                                    int value_regno)
3549 {
3550         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = regs + regno;
3551         const struct btf_type *t = btf_type_by_id(btf_vmlinux, reg->btf_id);
3552         const char *tname = btf_name_by_offset(btf_vmlinux, t->name_off);
3553         u32 btf_id;
3554         int ret;
3555 
3556         if (off < 0) {
3557                 verbose(env,
3558                         "R%d is ptr_%s invalid negative access: off=%d\n",
3559                         regno, tname, off);
3560                 return -EACCES;
3561         }
3562         if (!tnum_is_const(reg->var_off) || reg->var_off.value) {
3563                 char tn_buf[48];
3564 
3565                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
3566                 verbose(env,
3567                         "R%d is ptr_%s invalid variable offset: off=%d, var_off=%s\n",
3568                         regno, tname, off, tn_buf);
3569                 return -EACCES;
3570         }
3571 
3572         if (env->ops->btf_struct_access) {
3573                 ret = env->ops->btf_struct_access(&env->log, t, off, size,
3574                                                   atype, &btf_id);
3575         } else {
3576                 if (atype != BPF_READ) {
3577                         verbose(env, "only read is supported\n");
3578                         return -EACCES;
3579                 }
3580 
3581                 ret = btf_struct_access(&env->log, t, off, size, atype,
3582                                         &btf_id);
3583         }
3584 
3585         if (ret < 0)
3586                 return ret;
3587 
3588         if (atype == BPF_READ && value_regno >= 0)
3589                 mark_btf_ld_reg(env, regs, value_regno, ret, btf_id);
3590 
3591         return 0;
3592 }
3593 
3594 static int check_ptr_to_map_access(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
3595                                    struct bpf_reg_state *regs,
3596                                    int regno, int off, int size,
3597                                    enum bpf_access_type atype,
3598                                    int value_regno)
3599 {
3600         struct bpf_reg_state *reg = regs + regno;
3601         struct bpf_map *map = reg->map_ptr;
3602         const struct btf_type *t;
3603         const char *tname;
3604         u32 btf_id;
3605         int ret;
3606 
3607         if (!btf_vmlinux) {
3608                 verbose(env, "map_ptr access not supported without CONFIG_DEBUG_INFO_BTF\n");
3609                 return -ENOTSUPP;
3610         }
3611
