5386                         return err;
5387         }
5388 
5389         err = record_func_map(env, &meta, func_id, insn_idx);
5390         if (err)
5391                 return err;
5392 
5393         err = record_func_key(env, &meta, func_id, insn_idx);
5394         if (err)
5395                 return err;
5396 
5397         /* Mark slots with STACK_MISC in case of raw mode, stack offset
5398          * is inferred from register state.
5399          */
5400         for (i = 0; i < meta.access_size; i++) {
5401                 err = check_mem_access(env, insn_idx, meta.regno, i, BPF_B,
5402                                        BPF_WRITE, -1, false);
5403                 if (err)
5404                         return err;
5405         }
5406 
5407         if (func_id == BPF_FUNC_tail_call) {
5408                 err = check_reference_leak(env);
5409                 if (err) {
5410                         verbose(env, "tail_call would lead to reference leak\n");
5411                         return err;
5412                 }
5413         } else if (is_release_function(func_id)) {
5414                 err = release_reference(env, meta.ref_obj_id);
5415                 if (err) {
5416                         verbose(env, "func %s#%d reference has not been acquired before\n",
5417                                 func_id_name(func_id), func_id);
5418                         return err;
5419                 }
5420         }
5421 
5422         regs = cur_regs(env);
5423 
5424         /* check that flags argument in get_local_storage(map, flags) is 0,
5425          * this is required because get_local_storage() can't return an error.
5426          */
5427         if (func_id == BPF_FUNC_get_local_storage &&
5428             !register_is_null(&regs[BPF_REG_2])) {
5429                 verbose(env, "get_local_storage() doesn't support non-zero flags\n");
5430                 return -EINVAL;
5431         }
5432 
5433         /* reset caller saved regs */
5434         for (i = 0; i < CALLER_SAVED_REGS; i++) {
5435                 mark_reg_not_init(env, regs, caller_saved[i]);
5436                 check_reg_arg(env, caller_saved[i], DST_OP_NO_MARK);
5437         }
5438 
5439         /* helper call returns 64-bit value. */
5440         regs[BPF_REG_0].subreg_def = DEF_NOT_SUBREG;
5441 
5442         /* update return register (already marked as written above) */
5443         if (fn->ret_type == RET_INTEGER) {
5444                 /* sets type to SCALAR_VALUE */
5445                 mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5446         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_VOID) {
5447                 regs[BPF_REG_0].type = NOT_INIT;
5448         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE_OR_NULL ||
5449                    fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE) {
5450                 /* There is no offset yet applied, variable or fixed */
5451                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5452                 /* remember map_ptr, so that check_map_access()
5453                  * can check 'value_size' boundary of memory access
5454                  * to map element returned from bpf_map_lookup_elem()
5455                  */
5456                 if (meta.map_ptr == NULL) {
5457                         verbose(env,
5458                                 "kernel subsystem misconfigured verifier\n");
5459                         return -EINVAL;
5460                 }
5461                 regs[BPF_REG_0].map_ptr = meta.map_ptr;
5462                 if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE) {
5463                         regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE;
5464                         if (map_value_has_spin_lock(meta.map_ptr))
5465                                 regs[BPF_REG_0].id = ++env->id_gen;
5466                 } else {
5467                         regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE_OR_NULL;
5468                 }
5469         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_SOCKET_OR_NULL) {
5470                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5471                 regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_SOCKET_OR_NULL;
5472         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON_OR_NULL) {
5473                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5474                 regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON_OR_NULL;
5475         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK_OR_NULL) {
5476                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5477                 regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK_OR_NULL;
5478         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_ALLOC_MEM_OR_NULL) {
5479                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5480                 regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_MEM_OR_NULL;
5481                 regs[BPF_REG_0].mem_size = meta.mem_size;
5482         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MEM_OR_BTF_ID_OR_NULL ||
5483                    fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MEM_OR_BTF_ID) {
5484                 const struct btf_type *t;
5485 
5486                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5487                 t = btf_type_skip_modifiers(btf_vmlinux, meta.ret_btf_id, NULL);
5488                 if (!btf_type_is_struct(t)) {
5489                         u32 tsize;
5490                         const struct btf_type *ret;
5491                         const char *tname;
5492 
5493                         /* resolve the type size of ksym. */
5494                         ret = btf_resolve_size(btf_vmlinux, t, &tsize);
5495                         if (IS_ERR(ret)) {
5496                                 tname = btf_name_by_offset(btf_vmlinux, t->name_off);
5497                                 verbose(env, "unable to resolve the size of type '%s': %ld\n",
5498                                         tname, PTR_ERR(ret));
5499                                 return -EINVAL;
5500                         }
5501                         regs[BPF_REG_0].type =
5502                                 fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MEM_OR_BTF_ID ?
5503                                 PTR_TO_MEM : PTR_TO_MEM_OR_NULL;
5504                         regs[BPF_REG_0].mem_size = tsize;
5505                 } else {
5506                         regs[BPF_REG_0].type =
5507                                 fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_MEM_OR_BTF_ID ?
5508                                 PTR_TO_BTF_ID : PTR_TO_BTF_ID_OR_NULL;
5509                         regs[BPF_REG_0].btf_id = meta.ret_btf_id;
5510                 }
5511         } else if (fn->ret_type == RET_PTR_TO_BTF_ID_OR_NULL) {
5512                 int ret_btf_id;
5513 
5514                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
5515                 regs[BPF_REG_0].type = PTR_TO_BTF_ID_OR_NULL;
5516                 ret_btf_id = *fn->ret_btf_id;
5517                 if (ret_btf_id == 0) {
5518                         verbose(env, "invalid return type %d of func %s#%d\n",
5519                                 fn->ret_type, func_id_name(func_id), func_id);
5520                         return -EINVAL;
5521                 }
5522                 regs[BPF_REG_0].btf_id = ret_btf_id;
5523         } else {
5524                 verbose(env, "unknown return type %d of func %s#%d\n",
5525                         fn->ret_type, func_id_name(func_id), func_id);
5526                 return -EINVAL;
5527         }
5528 
5529         if (reg_type_may_be_null(regs[BPF_REG_0].type))
5530                 regs[BPF_REG_0].id = ++env->id_gen;
5531 
5532         if (is_ptr_cast_function(func_id)) {
5533                 /* For release_reference() */
5534                 regs[BPF_REG_0].ref_obj_id = meta.ref_obj_id;
5535         } else if (is_acquire_function(func_id, meta.map_ptr)) {
5536                 int id = acquire_reference_state(env, insn_idx);
5537 
5538                 if (id < 0)
5539                         return id;
5540                 /* For mark_ptr_or_null_reg() */
5541                 regs[BPF_REG_0].id = id;
5542                 /* For release_reference() */
5543                 regs[BPF_REG_0].ref_obj_id = id;
5544         }
5545 
5546         do_refine_retval_range(regs, fn->ret_type, func_id, &meta);
5547 
5548         err = check_map_func_compatibility(env, meta.map_ptr, func_id);
5549         if (err)
5550                 return err;
5551 
5552         if ((func_id == BPF_FUNC_get_stack ||
5553              func_id == BPF_FUNC_get_task_stack) &&
5554             !env->prog->has_callchain_buf) {
5555                 const char *err_str;
5556 
5557 #ifdef CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS
5558                 err = get_callchain_buffers(sysctl_perf_event_max_stack);
5559                 err_str = "cannot get callchain buffer for func %s#%d\n";
5560 #else
5561                 err = -ENOTSUPP;
5562                 err_str = "func %s#%d not supported without CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS\n";
5563 #endif
5564                 if (err) {
5565                         verbose(env, err_str, func_id_name(func_id), func_id);
5566                         return err;
5567                 }
5568 
5569                 env->prog->has_callchain_buf = true;
5570         }
5571 
5572         if (func_id == BPF_FUNC_get_stackid || func_id == BPF_FUNC_get_stack)
5573                 env->prog->call_get_stack = true;
5574 
5575         if (changes_data)
5576                 clear_all_pkt_pointers(env);
5577         return 0;
5578 }
5579 
5580 static bool signed_add_overflows(s64 a, s64 b)
5581 {
5582         /* Do the add in u64, where overflow is well-defined */
5583         s64 res = (s64)((u64)a + (u64)b);
5584 
5585         if (b < 0)
5586                 return res > a;
5587         return res < a;
5588 }
5589 
5590 static bool signed_add32_overflows(s32 a, s32 b)
5591 {
5592         /* Do the add in u32, where overflow is well-defined */
5593         s32 res = (s32)((u32)a + (u32)b);
5594 
5595         if (b < 0)
5596                 return res > a;
5597         return res < a;
5598 }
5599 
5600 static bool signed_sub_overflows(s64 a, s64 b)
5601 {
5602         /* Do the sub in u64, where overflow is well-defined */
5603         s64 res = (s64)((u64)a - (u64)b);
5604 
5605         if (b < 0)
5606                 return res < a;
5607         return res > a;
5608 }
5609 
5610 static bool signed_sub32_overflows(s32 a, s32 b)
5611 {
5612         /* Do the sub in u32, where overflow is well-defined */
5613         s32 res = (s32)((u32)a - (u32)b);
5614 
5615         if (b < 0)
5616                 return res < a;
5617         return res > a;
5618 }
5619 
5620 static bool check_reg_sane_offset(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5621                                   const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
5622                                   enum bpf_reg_type type)
5623 {
5624         bool known = tnum_is_const(reg->var_off);
5625         s64 val = reg->var_off.value;
5626         s64 smin = reg->smin_value;
5627 
5628         if (known && (val >= BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF || val <= -BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF)) {
5629                 verbose(env, "math between %s pointer and %lld is not allowed\n",
5630                         reg_type_str[type], val);
5631                 return false;
5632         }
5633 
5634         if (reg->off >= BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF || reg->off <= -BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF) {
5635                 verbose(env, "%s pointer offset %d is not allowed\n",
5636                         reg_type_str[type], reg->off);
5637                 return false;
5638         }
5639 
5640         if (smin == S64_MIN) {
5641                 verbose(env, "math between %s pointer and register with unbounded min value is not allowed\n",
5642                         reg_type_str[type]);
5643                 return false;
5644         }
5645 
5646         if (smin >= BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF || smin <= -BPF_MAX_VAR_OFF) {
5647                 verbose(env, "value %lld makes %s pointer be out of bounds\n",
5648                         smin, reg_type_str[type]);
5649                 return false;
5650         }
5651 
5652         return true;
5653 }
5654 
5655 static struct bpf_insn_aux_data *cur_aux(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
5656 {
5657         return &env->insn_aux_data[env->insn_idx];
5658 }
5659 
5660 enum {
5661         REASON_BOUNDS   = -1,
5662         REASON_TYPE     = -2,
5663         REASON_PATHS    = -3,
5664         REASON_LIMIT    = -4,
5665         REASON_STACK    = -5,
5666 };
5667 
5668 static int retrieve_ptr_limit(const struct bpf_reg_state *ptr_reg,
5669                               u32 *alu_limit, bool mask_to_left)
5670 {
5671         u32 max = 0, ptr_limit = 0;
5672 
5673         switch (ptr_reg->type) {
5674         case PTR_TO_STACK:
5675                 /* Offset 0 is out-of-bounds, but acceptable start for the
5676                  * left direction, see BPF_REG_FP. Also, unknown scalar
5677                  * offset where we would need to deal with min/max bounds is
5678                  * currently prohibited for unprivileged.
5679                  */
5680                 max = MAX_BPF_STACK + mask_to_left;
5681                 ptr_limit = -(ptr_reg->var_off.value + ptr_reg->off);
5682                 break;
5683         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE:
5684                 max = ptr_reg->map_ptr->value_size;
5685                 ptr_limit = (mask_to_left ?
5686                              ptr_reg->smin_value :
5687                              ptr_reg->umax_value) + ptr_reg->off;
5688                 break;
5689         default:
5690                 return REASON_TYPE;
5691         }
5692 
5693         if (ptr_limit >= max)
5694                 return REASON_LIMIT;
5695         *alu_limit = ptr_limit;
5696         return 0;
5697 }
5698 
5699 static bool can_skip_alu_sanitation(const struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5700                                     const struct bpf_insn *insn)
5701 {
5702         return env->bypass_spec_v1 || BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_K;
5703 }
5704 
5705 static int update_alu_sanitation_state(struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux,
5706                                        u32 alu_state, u32 alu_limit)
5707 {
5708         /* If we arrived here from different branches with different
5709          * state or limits to sanitize, then this won't work.
5710          */
5711         if (aux->alu_state &&
5712             (aux->alu_state != alu_state ||
5713              aux->alu_limit != alu_limit))
5714                 return REASON_PATHS;
5715 
5716         /* Corresponding fixup done in fixup_bpf_calls(). */
5717         aux->alu_state = alu_state;
5718         aux->alu_limit = alu_limit;
5719         return 0;
5720 }
5721 
5722 static int sanitize_val_alu(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5723                             struct bpf_insn *insn)
5724 {
5725         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux = cur_aux(env);
5726 
5727         if (can_skip_alu_sanitation(env, insn))
5728                 return 0;
5729 
5730         return update_alu_sanitation_state(aux, BPF_ALU_NON_POINTER, 0);
5731 }
5732 
5733 static bool sanitize_needed(u8 opcode)
5734 {
5735         return opcode == BPF_ADD || opcode == BPF_SUB;
5736 }
5737 
5738 struct bpf_sanitize_info {
5739         struct bpf_insn_aux_data aux;
5740         bool mask_to_left;
5741 };
5742 
5743 static int sanitize_ptr_alu(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5744                             struct bpf_insn *insn,
5745                             const struct bpf_reg_state *ptr_reg,
5746                             const struct bpf_reg_state *off_reg,
5747                             struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
5748                             struct bpf_sanitize_info *info,
5749                             const bool commit_window)
5750 {
5751         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux = commit_window ? cur_aux(env) : &info->aux;
5752         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
5753         bool off_is_imm = tnum_is_const(off_reg->var_off);
5754         bool off_is_neg = off_reg->smin_value < 0;
5755         bool ptr_is_dst_reg = ptr_reg == dst_reg;
5756         u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insn->code);
5757         u32 alu_state, alu_limit;
5758         struct bpf_reg_state tmp;
5759         bool ret;
5760         int err;
5761 
5762         if (can_skip_alu_sanitation(env, insn))
5763                 return 0;
5764 
5765         /* We already marked aux for masking from non-speculative
5766          * paths, thus we got here in the first place. We only care
5767          * to explore bad access from here.
5768          */
5769         if (vstate->speculative)
5770                 goto do_sim;
5771 
5772         if (!commit_window) {
5773                 if (!tnum_is_const(off_reg->var_off) &&
5774                     (off_reg->smin_value < 0) != (off_reg->smax_value < 0))
5775                         return REASON_BOUNDS;
5776 
5777                 info->mask_to_left = (opcode == BPF_ADD &&  off_is_neg) ||
5778                                      (opcode == BPF_SUB && !off_is_neg);
5779         }
5780 
5781         err = retrieve_ptr_limit(ptr_reg, &alu_limit, info->mask_to_left);
5782         if (err < 0)
5783                 return err;
5784 
5785         if (commit_window) {
5786                 /* In commit phase we narrow the masking window based on
5787                  * the observed pointer move after the simulated operation.
5788                  */
5789                 alu_state = info->aux.alu_state;
5790                 alu_limit = abs(info->aux.alu_limit - alu_limit);
5791         } else {
5792                 alu_state  = off_is_neg ? BPF_ALU_NEG_VALUE : 0;
5793                 alu_state |= off_is_imm ? BPF_ALU_IMMEDIATE : 0;
5794                 alu_state |= ptr_is_dst_reg ?
5795                              BPF_ALU_SANITIZE_SRC : BPF_ALU_SANITIZE_DST;
5796         }
5797 
5798         err = update_alu_sanitation_state(aux, alu_state, alu_limit);
5799         if (err < 0)
5800                 return err;
5801 do_sim:
5802         /* If we're in commit phase, we're done here given we already
5803          * pushed the truncated dst_reg into the speculative verification
5804          * stack.
5805          *
5806          * Also, when register is a known constant, we rewrite register-based
5807          * operation to immediate-based, and thus do not need masking (and as
5808          * a consequence, do not need to simulate the zero-truncation either).
5809          */
5810         if (commit_window || off_is_imm)
5811                 return 0;
5812 
5813         /* Simulate and find potential out-of-bounds access under
5814          * speculative execution from truncation as a result of
5815          * masking when off was not within expected range. If off
5816          * sits in dst, then we temporarily need to move ptr there
5817          * to simulate dst (== 0) +/-= ptr. Needed, for example,
5818          * for cases where we use K-based arithmetic in one direction
5819          * and truncated reg-based in the other in order to explore
5820          * bad access.
5821          */
5822         if (!ptr_is_dst_reg) {
5823                 tmp = *dst_reg;
5824                 *dst_reg = *ptr_reg;
5825         }
5826         ret = push_stack(env, env->insn_idx + 1, env->insn_idx, true);
5827         if (!ptr_is_dst_reg && ret)
5828                 *dst_reg = tmp;
5829         return !ret ? REASON_STACK : 0;
5830 }
5831 
5832 static int sanitize_err(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5833                         const struct bpf_insn *insn, int reason,
5834                         const struct bpf_reg_state *off_reg,
5835                         const struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg)
5836 {
5837         static const char *err = "pointer arithmetic with it prohibited for !root";
5838         const char *op = BPF_OP(insn->code) == BPF_ADD ? "add" : "sub";
5839         u32 dst = insn->dst_reg, src = insn->src_reg;
5840 
5841         switch (reason) {
5842         case REASON_BOUNDS:
5843                 verbose(env, "R%d has unknown scalar with mixed signed bounds, %s\n",
5844                         off_reg == dst_reg ? dst : src, err);
5845                 break;
5846         case REASON_TYPE:
5847                 verbose(env, "R%d has pointer with unsupported alu operation, %s\n",
5848                         off_reg == dst_reg ? src : dst, err);
5849                 break;
5850         case REASON_PATHS:
5851                 verbose(env, "R%d tried to %s from different maps, paths or scalars, %s\n",
5852                         dst, op, err);
5853                 break;
5854         case REASON_LIMIT:
5855                 verbose(env, "R%d tried to %s beyond pointer bounds, %s\n",
5856                         dst, op, err);
5857                 break;
5858         case REASON_STACK:
5859                 verbose(env, "R%d could not be pushed for speculative verification, %s\n",
5860                         dst, err);
5861                 break;
5862         default:
5863                 verbose(env, "verifier internal error: unknown reason (%d)\n",
5864                         reason);
5865                 break;
5866         }
5867 
5868         return -EACCES;
5869 }
5870 
5871 /* check that stack access falls within stack limits and that 'reg' doesn't
5872  * have a variable offset.
5873  *
5874  * Variable offset is prohibited for unprivileged mode for simplicity since it
5875  * requires corresponding support in Spectre masking for stack ALU.  See also
5876  * retrieve_ptr_limit().
5877  *
5878  *
5879  * 'off' includes 'reg->off'.
5880  */
5881 static int check_stack_access_for_ptr_arithmetic(
5882                                 struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5883                                 int regno,
5884                                 const struct bpf_reg_state *reg,
5885                                 int off)
5886 {
5887         if (!tnum_is_const(reg->var_off)) {
5888                 char tn_buf[48];
5889 
5890                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
5891                 verbose(env, "R%d variable stack access prohibited for !root, var_off=%s off=%d\n",
5892                         regno, tn_buf, off);
5893                 return -EACCES;
5894         }
5895 
5896         if (off >= 0 || off < -MAX_BPF_STACK) {
5897                 verbose(env, "R%d stack pointer arithmetic goes out of range, "
5898                         "prohibited for !root; off=%d\n", regno, off);
5899                 return -EACCES;
5900         }
5901 
5902         return 0;
5903 }
5904 
5905 static int sanitize_check_bounds(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5906                                  const struct bpf_insn *insn,
5907                                  const struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg)
5908 {
5909         u32 dst = insn->dst_reg;
5910 
5911         /* For unprivileged we require that resulting offset must be in bounds
5912          * in order to be able to sanitize access later on.
5913          */
5914         if (env->bypass_spec_v1)
5915                 return 0;
5916 
5917         switch (dst_reg->type) {
5918         case PTR_TO_STACK:
5919                 if (check_stack_access_for_ptr_arithmetic(env, dst, dst_reg,
5920                                         dst_reg->off + dst_reg->var_off.value))
5921                         return -EACCES;
5922                 break;
5923         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE:
5924                 if (check_map_access(env, dst, dst_reg->off, 1, false)) {
5925                         verbose(env, "R%d pointer arithmetic of map value goes out of range, "
5926                                 "prohibited for !root\n", dst);
5927                         return -EACCES;
5928                 }
5929                 break;
5930         default:
5931                 break;
5932         }
5933 
5934         return 0;
5935 }
5936 
5937 /* Handles arithmetic on a pointer and a scalar: computes new min/max and var_off.
5938  * Caller should also handle BPF_MOV case separately.
5939  * If we return -EACCES, caller may want to try again treating pointer as a
5940  * scalar.  So we only emit a diagnostic if !env->allow_ptr_leaks.
5941  */
5942 static int adjust_ptr_min_max_vals(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
5943                                    struct bpf_insn *insn,
5944                                    const struct bpf_reg_state *ptr_reg,
5945                                    const struct bpf_reg_state *off_reg)
5946 {
5947         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
5948         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
5949         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = state->regs, *dst_reg;
5950         bool known = tnum_is_const(off_reg->var_off);
5951         s64 smin_val = off_reg->smin_value, smax_val = off_reg->smax_value,
5952             smin_ptr = ptr_reg->smin_value, smax_ptr = ptr_reg->smax_value;
5953         u64 umin_val = off_reg->umin_value, umax_val = off_reg->umax_value,
5954             umin_ptr = ptr_reg->umin_value, umax_ptr = ptr_reg->umax_value;
5955         struct bpf_sanitize_info info = {};
5956         u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insn->code);
5957         u32 dst = insn->dst_reg;
5958         int ret;
5959 
5960         dst_reg = &regs[dst];
5961 
5962         if ((known && (smin_val != smax_val || umin_val != umax_val)) ||
5963             smin_val > smax_val || umin_val > umax_val) {
5964                 /* Taint dst register if offset had invalid bounds derived from
5965                  * e.g. dead branches.
5966                  */
5967                 __mark_reg_unknown(env, dst_reg);
5968                 return 0;
5969         }
5970 
5971         if (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) != BPF_ALU64) {
5972                 /* 32-bit ALU ops on pointers produce (meaningless) scalars */
5973                 if (opcode == BPF_SUB && env->allow_ptr_leaks) {
5974                         __mark_reg_unknown(env, dst_reg);
5975                         return 0;
5976                 }
5977 
5978                 verbose(env,
5979                         "R%d 32-bit pointer arithmetic prohibited\n",
5980                         dst);
5981                 return -EACCES;
5982         }
5983 
5984         switch (ptr_reg->type) {
5985         case PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE_OR_NULL:
5986                 verbose(env, "R%d pointer arithmetic on %s prohibited, null-check it first\n",
5987                         dst, reg_type_str[ptr_reg->type]);
5988                 return -EACCES;
5989         case CONST_PTR_TO_MAP:
5990                 /* smin_val represents the known value */
5991                 if (known && smin_val == 0 && opcode == BPF_ADD)
5992                         break;
5993                 fallthrough;
5994         case PTR_TO_PACKET_END:
5995         case PTR_TO_SOCKET:
5996         case PTR_TO_SOCKET_OR_NULL:
5997         case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON:
5998         case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON_OR_NULL:
5999         case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK:
6000         case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK_OR_NULL:
6001         case PTR_TO_XDP_SOCK:
6002                 verbose(env, "R%d pointer arithmetic on %s prohibited\n",
6003                         dst, reg_type_str[ptr_reg->type]);
6004                 return -EACCES;
6005         default:
6006                 break;
6007         }
6008 
6009         /* In case of 'scalar += pointer', dst_reg inherits pointer type and id.
6010          * The id may be overwritten later if we create a new variable offset.
6011          */
6012         dst_reg->type = ptr_reg->type;
6013         dst_reg->id = ptr_reg->id;
6014 
6015         if (!check_reg_sane_offset(env, off_reg, ptr_reg->type) ||
6016             !check_reg_sane_offset(env, ptr_reg, ptr_reg->type))
6017                 return -EINVAL;
6018 
6019         /* pointer types do not carry 32-bit bounds at the moment. */
6020         __mark_reg32_unbounded(dst_reg);
6021 
6022         if (sanitize_needed(opcode)) {
6023                 ret = sanitize_ptr_alu(env, insn, ptr_reg, off_reg, dst_reg,
6024                                        &info, false);
6025                 if (ret < 0)
6026                         return sanitize_err(env, insn, ret, off_reg, dst_reg);
6027         }
6028 
6029         switch (opcode) {
6030         case BPF_ADD:
6031                 /* We can take a fixed offset as long as it doesn't overflow
6032                  * the s32 'off' field
6033                  */
6034                 if (known && (ptr_reg->off + smin_val ==
6035                               (s64)(s32)(ptr_reg->off + smin_val))) {
6036                         /* pointer += K.  Accumulate it into fixed offset */
6037                         dst_reg->smin_value = smin_ptr;
6038                         dst_reg->smax_value = smax_ptr;
6039                         dst_reg->umin_value = umin_ptr;
6040                         dst_reg->umax_value = umax_ptr;
6041                         dst_reg->var_off = ptr_reg->var_off;
6042                         dst_reg->off = ptr_reg->off + smin_val;
6043                         dst_reg->raw = ptr_reg->raw;
6044                         break;
6045                 }
6046                 /* A new variable offset is created.  Note that off_reg->off
6047                  * == 0, since it's a scalar.
6048                  * dst_reg gets the pointer type and since some positive
6049                  * integer value was added to the pointer, give it a new 'id'
6050                  * if it's a PTR_TO_PACKET.
6051                  * this creates a new 'base' pointer, off_reg (variable) gets
6052                  * added into the variable offset, and we copy the fixed offset
6053                  * from ptr_reg.
6054                  */
6055                 if (signed_add_overflows(smin_ptr, smin_val) ||
6056                     signed_add_overflows(smax_ptr, smax_val)) {
6057                         dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6058                         dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6059                 } else {
6060                         dst_reg->smin_value = smin_ptr + smin_val;
6061                         dst_reg->smax_value = smax_ptr + smax_val;
6062                 }
6063                 if (umin_ptr + umin_val < umin_ptr ||
6064                     umax_ptr + umax_val < umax_ptr) {
6065                         dst_reg->umin_value = 0;
6066                         dst_reg->umax_value = U64_MAX;
6067                 } else {
6068                         dst_reg->umin_value = umin_ptr + umin_val;
6069                         dst_reg->umax_value = umax_ptr + umax_val;
6070                 }
6071                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_add(ptr_reg->var_off, off_reg->var_off);
6072                 dst_reg->off = ptr_reg->off;
6073                 dst_reg->raw = ptr_reg->raw;
6074                 if (reg_is_pkt_pointer(ptr_reg)) {
6075                         dst_reg->id = ++env->id_gen;
6076                         /* something was added to pkt_ptr, set range to zero */
6077                         dst_reg->raw = 0;
6078                 }
6079                 break;
6080         case BPF_SUB:
6081                 if (dst_reg == off_reg) {
6082                         /* scalar -= pointer.  Creates an unknown scalar */
6083                         verbose(env, "R%d tried to subtract pointer from scalar\n",
6084                                 dst);
6085                         return -EACCES;
6086                 }
6087                 /* We don't allow subtraction from FP, because (according to
6088                  * test_verifier.c test "invalid fp arithmetic", JITs might not
6089                  * be able to deal with it.
6090                  */
6091                 if (ptr_reg->type == PTR_TO_STACK) {
6092                         verbose(env, "R%d subtraction from stack pointer prohibited\n",
6093                                 dst);
6094                         return -EACCES;
6095                 }
6096                 if (known && (ptr_reg->off - smin_val ==
6097                               (s64)(s32)(ptr_reg->off - smin_val))) {
6098                         /* pointer -= K.  Subtract it from fixed offset */
6099                         dst_reg->smin_value = smin_ptr;
6100                         dst_reg->smax_value = smax_ptr;
6101                         dst_reg->umin_value = umin_ptr;
6102                         dst_reg->umax_value = umax_ptr;
6103                         dst_reg->var_off = ptr_reg->var_off;
6104                         dst_reg->id = ptr_reg->id;
6105                         dst_reg->off = ptr_reg->off - smin_val;
6106                         dst_reg->raw = ptr_reg->raw;
6107                         break;
6108                 }
6109                 /* A new variable offset is created.  If the subtrahend is known
6110                  * nonnegative, then any reg->range we had before is still good.
6111                  */
6112                 if (signed_sub_overflows(smin_ptr, smax_val) ||
6113                     signed_sub_overflows(smax_ptr, smin_val)) {
6114                         /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6115                         dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6116                         dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6117                 } else {
6118                         dst_reg->smin_value = smin_ptr - smax_val;
6119                         dst_reg->smax_value = smax_ptr - smin_val;
6120                 }
6121                 if (umin_ptr < umax_val) {
6122                         /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6123                         dst_reg->umin_value = 0;
6124                         dst_reg->umax_value = U64_MAX;
6125                 } else {
6126                         /* Cannot overflow (as long as bounds are consistent) */
6127                         dst_reg->umin_value = umin_ptr - umax_val;
6128                         dst_reg->umax_value = umax_ptr - umin_val;
6129                 }
6130                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_sub(ptr_reg->var_off, off_reg->var_off);
6131                 dst_reg->off = ptr_reg->off;
6132                 dst_reg->raw = ptr_reg->raw;
6133                 if (reg_is_pkt_pointer(ptr_reg)) {
6134                         dst_reg->id = ++env->id_gen;
6135                         /* something was added to pkt_ptr, set range to zero */
6136                         if (smin_val < 0)
6137                                 dst_reg->raw = 0;
6138                 }
6139                 break;
6140         case BPF_AND:
6141         case BPF_OR:
6142         case BPF_XOR:
6143                 /* bitwise ops on pointers are troublesome, prohibit. */
6144                 verbose(env, "R%d bitwise operator %s on pointer prohibited\n",
6145                         dst, bpf_alu_string[opcode >> 4]);
6146                 return -EACCES;
6147         default:
6148                 /* other operators (e.g. MUL,LSH) produce non-pointer results */
6149                 verbose(env, "R%d pointer arithmetic with %s operator prohibited\n",
6150                         dst, bpf_alu_string[opcode >> 4]);
6151                 return -EACCES;
6152         }
6153 
6154         if (!check_reg_sane_offset(env, dst_reg, ptr_reg->type))
6155                 return -EINVAL;
6156 
6157         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6158         __reg_deduce_bounds(dst_reg);
6159         __reg_bound_offset(dst_reg);
6160 
6161         if (sanitize_check_bounds(env, insn, dst_reg) < 0)
6162                 return -EACCES;
6163         if (sanitize_needed(opcode)) {
6164                 ret = sanitize_ptr_alu(env, insn, dst_reg, off_reg, dst_reg,
6165                                        &info, true);
6166                 if (ret < 0)
6167                         return sanitize_err(env, insn, ret, off_reg, dst_reg);
6168         }
6169 
6170         return 0;
6171 }
6172 
6173 static void scalar32_min_max_add(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6174                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6175 {
6176         s32 smin_val = src_reg->s32_min_value;
6177         s32 smax_val = src_reg->s32_max_value;
6178         u32 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6179         u32 umax_val = src_reg->u32_max_value;
6180 
6181         if (signed_add32_overflows(dst_reg->s32_min_value, smin_val) ||
6182             signed_add32_overflows(dst_reg->s32_max_value, smax_val)) {
6183                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6184                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6185         } else {
6186                 dst_reg->s32_min_value += smin_val;
6187                 dst_reg->s32_max_value += smax_val;
6188         }
6189         if (dst_reg->u32_min_value + umin_val < umin_val ||
6190             dst_reg->u32_max_value + umax_val < umax_val) {
6191                 dst_reg->u32_min_value = 0;
6192                 dst_reg->u32_max_value = U32_MAX;
6193         } else {
6194                 dst_reg->u32_min_value += umin_val;
6195                 dst_reg->u32_max_value += umax_val;
6196         }
6197 }
6198 
6199 static void scalar_min_max_add(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6200                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6201 {
6202         s64 smin_val = src_reg->smin_value;
6203         s64 smax_val = src_reg->smax_value;
6204         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6205         u64 umax_val = src_reg->umax_value;
6206 
6207         if (signed_add_overflows(dst_reg->smin_value, smin_val) ||
6208             signed_add_overflows(dst_reg->smax_value, smax_val)) {
6209                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6210                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6211         } else {
6212                 dst_reg->smin_value += smin_val;
6213                 dst_reg->smax_value += smax_val;
6214         }
6215         if (dst_reg->umin_value + umin_val < umin_val ||
6216             dst_reg->umax_value + umax_val < umax_val) {
6217                 dst_reg->umin_value = 0;
6218                 dst_reg->umax_value = U64_MAX;
6219         } else {
6220                 dst_reg->umin_value += umin_val;
6221                 dst_reg->umax_value += umax_val;
6222         }
6223 }
6224 
6225 static void scalar32_min_max_sub(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6226                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6227 {
6228         s32 smin_val = src_reg->s32_min_value;
6229         s32 smax_val = src_reg->s32_max_value;
6230         u32 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6231         u32 umax_val = src_reg->u32_max_value;
6232 
6233         if (signed_sub32_overflows(dst_reg->s32_min_value, smax_val) ||
6234             signed_sub32_overflows(dst_reg->s32_max_value, smin_val)) {
6235                 /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6236                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6237                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6238         } else {
6239                 dst_reg->s32_min_value -= smax_val;
6240                 dst_reg->s32_max_value -= smin_val;
6241         }
6242         if (dst_reg->u32_min_value < umax_val) {
6243                 /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6244                 dst_reg->u32_min_value = 0;
6245                 dst_reg->u32_max_value = U32_MAX;
6246         } else {
6247                 /* Cannot overflow (as long as bounds are consistent) */
6248                 dst_reg->u32_min_value -= umax_val;
6249                 dst_reg->u32_max_value -= umin_val;
6250         }
6251 }
6252 
6253 static void scalar_min_max_sub(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6254                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6255 {
6256         s64 smin_val = src_reg->smin_value;
6257         s64 smax_val = src_reg->smax_value;
6258         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6259         u64 umax_val = src_reg->umax_value;
6260 
6261         if (signed_sub_overflows(dst_reg->smin_value, smax_val) ||
6262             signed_sub_overflows(dst_reg->smax_value, smin_val)) {
6263                 /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6264                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6265                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6266         } else {
6267                 dst_reg->smin_value -= smax_val;
6268                 dst_reg->smax_value -= smin_val;
6269         }
6270         if (dst_reg->umin_value < umax_val) {
6271                 /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6272                 dst_reg->umin_value = 0;
6273                 dst_reg->umax_value = U64_MAX;
6274         } else {
6275                 /* Cannot overflow (as long as bounds are consistent) */
6276                 dst_reg->umin_value -= umax_val;
6277                 dst_reg->umax_value -= umin_val;
6278         }
6279 }
6280 
6281 static void scalar32_min_max_mul(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6282                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6283 {
6284         s32 smin_val = src_reg->s32_min_value;
6285         u32 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6286         u32 umax_val = src_reg->u32_max_value;
6287 
6288         if (smin_val < 0 || dst_reg->s32_min_value < 0) {
6289                 /* Ain't nobody got time to multiply that sign */
6290                 __mark_reg32_unbounded(dst_reg);
6291                 return;
6292         }
6293         /* Both values are positive, so we can work with unsigned and
6294          * copy the result to signed (unless it exceeds S32_MAX).
6295          */
6296         if (umax_val > U16_MAX || dst_reg->u32_max_value > U16_MAX) {
6297                 /* Potential overflow, we know nothing */
6298                 __mark_reg32_unbounded(dst_reg);
6299                 return;
6300         }
6301         dst_reg->u32_min_value *= umin_val;
6302         dst_reg->u32_max_value *= umax_val;
6303         if (dst_reg->u32_max_value > S32_MAX) {
6304                 /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6305                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6306                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6307         } else {
6308                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = dst_reg->u32_min_value;
6309                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = dst_reg->u32_max_value;
6310         }
6311 }
6312 
6313 static void scalar_min_max_mul(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6314                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6315 {
6316         s64 smin_val = src_reg->smin_value;
6317         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6318         u64 umax_val = src_reg->umax_value;
6319 
6320         if (smin_val < 0 || dst_reg->smin_value < 0) {
6321                 /* Ain't nobody got time to multiply that sign */
6322                 __mark_reg64_unbounded(dst_reg);
6323                 return;
6324         }
6325         /* Both values are positive, so we can work with unsigned and
6326          * copy the result to signed (unless it exceeds S64_MAX).
6327          */
6328         if (umax_val > U32_MAX || dst_reg->umax_value > U32_MAX) {
6329                 /* Potential overflow, we know nothing */
6330                 __mark_reg64_unbounded(dst_reg);
6331                 return;
6332         }
6333         dst_reg->umin_value *= umin_val;
6334         dst_reg->umax_value *= umax_val;
6335         if (dst_reg->umax_value > S64_MAX) {
6336                 /* Overflow possible, we know nothing */
6337                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6338                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6339         } else {
6340                 dst_reg->smin_value = dst_reg->umin_value;
6341                 dst_reg->smax_value = dst_reg->umax_value;
6342         }
6343 }
6344 
6345 static void scalar32_min_max_and(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6346                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6347 {
6348         bool src_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(src_reg->var_off);
6349         bool dst_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(dst_reg->var_off);
6350         struct tnum var32_off = tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off);
6351         s32 smin_val = src_reg->s32_min_value;
6352         u32 umax_val = src_reg->u32_max_value;
6353 
6354         if (src_known && dst_known) {
6355                 __mark_reg32_known(dst_reg, var32_off.value);
6356                 return;
6357         }
6358 
6359         /* We get our minimum from the var_off, since that's inherently
6360          * bitwise.  Our maximum is the minimum of the operands' maxima.
6361          */
6362         dst_reg->u32_min_value = var32_off.value;
6363         dst_reg->u32_max_value = min(dst_reg->u32_max_value, umax_val);
6364         if (dst_reg->s32_min_value < 0 || smin_val < 0) {
6365                 /* Lose signed bounds when ANDing negative numbers,
6366                  * ain't nobody got time for that.
6367                  */
6368                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6369                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6370         } else {
6371                 /* ANDing two positives gives a positive, so safe to
6372                  * cast result into s64.
6373                  */
6374                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = dst_reg->u32_min_value;
6375                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = dst_reg->u32_max_value;
6376         }
6377 }
6378 
6379 static void scalar_min_max_and(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6380                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6381 {
6382         bool src_known = tnum_is_const(src_reg->var_off);
6383         bool dst_known = tnum_is_const(dst_reg->var_off);
6384         s64 smin_val = src_reg->smin_value;
6385         u64 umax_val = src_reg->umax_value;
6386 
6387         if (src_known && dst_known) {
6388                 __mark_reg_known(dst_reg, dst_reg->var_off.value);
6389                 return;
6390         }
6391 
6392         /* We get our minimum from the var_off, since that's inherently
6393          * bitwise.  Our maximum is the minimum of the operands' maxima.
6394          */
6395         dst_reg->umin_value = dst_reg->var_off.value;
6396         dst_reg->umax_value = min(dst_reg->umax_value, umax_val);
6397         if (dst_reg->smin_value < 0 || smin_val < 0) {
6398                 /* Lose signed bounds when ANDing negative numbers,
6399                  * ain't nobody got time for that.
6400                  */
6401                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6402                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6403         } else {
6404                 /* ANDing two positives gives a positive, so safe to
6405                  * cast result into s64.
6406                  */
6407                 dst_reg->smin_value = dst_reg->umin_value;
6408                 dst_reg->smax_value = dst_reg->umax_value;
6409         }
6410         /* We may learn something more from the var_off */
6411         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6412 }
6413 
6414 static void scalar32_min_max_or(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6415                                 struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6416 {
6417         bool src_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(src_reg->var_off);
6418         bool dst_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(dst_reg->var_off);
6419         struct tnum var32_off = tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off);
6420         s32 smin_val = src_reg->s32_min_value;
6421         u32 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6422 
6423         if (src_known && dst_known) {
6424                 __mark_reg32_known(dst_reg, var32_off.value);
6425                 return;
6426         }
6427 
6428         /* We get our maximum from the var_off, and our minimum is the
6429          * maximum of the operands' minima
6430          */
6431         dst_reg->u32_min_value = max(dst_reg->u32_min_value, umin_val);
6432         dst_reg->u32_max_value = var32_off.value | var32_off.mask;
6433         if (dst_reg->s32_min_value < 0 || smin_val < 0) {
6434                 /* Lose signed bounds when ORing negative numbers,
6435                  * ain't nobody got time for that.
6436                  */
6437                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6438                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6439         } else {
6440                 /* ORing two positives gives a positive, so safe to
6441                  * cast result into s64.
6442                  */
6443                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = dst_reg->u32_min_value;
6444                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = dst_reg->u32_max_value;
6445         }
6446 }
6447 
6448 static void scalar_min_max_or(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6449                               struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6450 {
6451         bool src_known = tnum_is_const(src_reg->var_off);
6452         bool dst_known = tnum_is_const(dst_reg->var_off);
6453         s64 smin_val = src_reg->smin_value;
6454         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6455 
6456         if (src_known && dst_known) {
6457                 __mark_reg_known(dst_reg, dst_reg->var_off.value);
6458                 return;
6459         }
6460 
6461         /* We get our maximum from the var_off, and our minimum is the
6462          * maximum of the operands' minima
6463          */
6464         dst_reg->umin_value = max(dst_reg->umin_value, umin_val);
6465         dst_reg->umax_value = dst_reg->var_off.value | dst_reg->var_off.mask;
6466         if (dst_reg->smin_value < 0 || smin_val < 0) {
6467                 /* Lose signed bounds when ORing negative numbers,
6468                  * ain't nobody got time for that.
6469                  */
6470                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6471                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6472         } else {
6473                 /* ORing two positives gives a positive, so safe to
6474                  * cast result into s64.
6475                  */
6476                 dst_reg->smin_value = dst_reg->umin_value;
6477                 dst_reg->smax_value = dst_reg->umax_value;
6478         }
6479         /* We may learn something more from the var_off */
6480         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6481 }
6482 
6483 static void scalar32_min_max_xor(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6484                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6485 {
6486         bool src_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(src_reg->var_off);
6487         bool dst_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(dst_reg->var_off);
6488         struct tnum var32_off = tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off);
6489         s32 smin_val = src_reg->s32_min_value;
6490 
6491         if (src_known && dst_known) {
6492                 __mark_reg32_known(dst_reg, var32_off.value);
6493                 return;
6494         }
6495 
6496         /* We get both minimum and maximum from the var32_off. */
6497         dst_reg->u32_min_value = var32_off.value;
6498         dst_reg->u32_max_value = var32_off.value | var32_off.mask;
6499 
6500         if (dst_reg->s32_min_value >= 0 && smin_val >= 0) {
6501                 /* XORing two positive sign numbers gives a positive,
6502                  * so safe to cast u32 result into s32.
6503                  */
6504                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = dst_reg->u32_min_value;
6505                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = dst_reg->u32_max_value;
6506         } else {
6507                 dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6508                 dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6509         }
6510 }
6511 
6512 static void scalar_min_max_xor(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6513                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6514 {
6515         bool src_known = tnum_is_const(src_reg->var_off);
6516         bool dst_known = tnum_is_const(dst_reg->var_off);
6517         s64 smin_val = src_reg->smin_value;
6518 
6519         if (src_known && dst_known) {
6520                 /* dst_reg->var_off.value has been updated earlier */
6521                 __mark_reg_known(dst_reg, dst_reg->var_off.value);
6522                 return;
6523         }
6524 
6525         /* We get both minimum and maximum from the var_off. */
6526         dst_reg->umin_value = dst_reg->var_off.value;
6527         dst_reg->umax_value = dst_reg->var_off.value | dst_reg->var_off.mask;
6528 
6529         if (dst_reg->smin_value >= 0 && smin_val >= 0) {
6530                 /* XORing two positive sign numbers gives a positive,
6531                  * so safe to cast u64 result into s64.
6532                  */
6533                 dst_reg->smin_value = dst_reg->umin_value;
6534                 dst_reg->smax_value = dst_reg->umax_value;
6535         } else {
6536                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6537                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6538         }
6539 
6540         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6541 }
6542 
6543 static void __scalar32_min_max_lsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6544                                    u64 umin_val, u64 umax_val)
6545 {
6546         /* We lose all sign bit information (except what we can pick
6547          * up from var_off)
6548          */
6549         dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6550         dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6551         /* If we might shift our top bit out, then we know nothing */
6552         if (umax_val > 31 || dst_reg->u32_max_value > 1ULL << (31 - umax_val)) {
6553                 dst_reg->u32_min_value = 0;
6554                 dst_reg->u32_max_value = U32_MAX;
6555         } else {
6556                 dst_reg->u32_min_value <<= umin_val;
6557                 dst_reg->u32_max_value <<= umax_val;
6558         }
6559 }
6560 
6561 static void scalar32_min_max_lsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6562                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6563 {
6564         u32 umax_val = src_reg->u32_max_value;
6565         u32 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6566         /* u32 alu operation will zext upper bits */
6567         struct tnum subreg = tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off);
6568 
6569         __scalar32_min_max_lsh(dst_reg, umin_val, umax_val);
6570         dst_reg->var_off = tnum_subreg(tnum_lshift(subreg, umin_val));
6571         /* Not required but being careful mark reg64 bounds as unknown so
6572          * that we are forced to pick them up from tnum and zext later and
6573          * if some path skips this step we are still safe.
6574          */
6575         __mark_reg64_unbounded(dst_reg);
6576         __update_reg32_bounds(dst_reg);
6577 }
6578 
6579 static void __scalar64_min_max_lsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6580                                    u64 umin_val, u64 umax_val)
6581 {
6582         /* Special case <<32 because it is a common compiler pattern to sign
6583          * extend subreg by doing <<32 s>>32. In this case if 32bit bounds are
6584          * positive we know this shift will also be positive so we can track
6585          * bounds correctly. Otherwise we lose all sign bit information except
6586          * what we can pick up from var_off. Perhaps we can generalize this
6587          * later to shifts of any length.
6588          */
6589         if (umin_val == 32 && umax_val == 32 && dst_reg->s32_max_value >= 0)
6590                 dst_reg->smax_value = (s64)dst_reg->s32_max_value << 32;
6591         else
6592                 dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6593 
6594         if (umin_val == 32 && umax_val == 32 && dst_reg->s32_min_value >= 0)
6595                 dst_reg->smin_value = (s64)dst_reg->s32_min_value << 32;
6596         else
6597                 dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6598 
6599         /* If we might shift our top bit out, then we know nothing */
6600         if (dst_reg->umax_value > 1ULL << (63 - umax_val)) {
6601                 dst_reg->umin_value = 0;
6602                 dst_reg->umax_value = U64_MAX;
6603         } else {
6604                 dst_reg->umin_value <<= umin_val;
6605                 dst_reg->umax_value <<= umax_val;
6606         }
6607 }
6608 
6609 static void scalar_min_max_lsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6610                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6611 {
6612         u64 umax_val = src_reg->umax_value;
6613         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6614 
6615         /* scalar64 calc uses 32bit unshifted bounds so must be called first */
6616         __scalar64_min_max_lsh(dst_reg, umin_val, umax_val);
6617         __scalar32_min_max_lsh(dst_reg, umin_val, umax_val);
6618 
6619         dst_reg->var_off = tnum_lshift(dst_reg->var_off, umin_val);
6620         /* We may learn something more from the var_off */
6621         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6622 }
6623 
6624 static void scalar32_min_max_rsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6625                                  struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6626 {
6627         struct tnum subreg = tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off);
6628         u32 umax_val = src_reg->u32_max_value;
6629         u32 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6630 
6631         /* BPF_RSH is an unsigned shift.  If the value in dst_reg might
6632          * be negative, then either:
6633          * 1) src_reg might be zero, so the sign bit of the result is
6634          *    unknown, so we lose our signed bounds
6635          * 2) it's known negative, thus the unsigned bounds capture the
6636          *    signed bounds
6637          * 3) the signed bounds cross zero, so they tell us nothing
6638          *    about the result
6639          * If the value in dst_reg is known nonnegative, then again the
6640          * unsigned bounts capture the signed bounds.
6641          * Thus, in all cases it suffices to blow away our signed bounds
6642          * and rely on inferring new ones from the unsigned bounds and
6643          * var_off of the result.
6644          */
6645         dst_reg->s32_min_value = S32_MIN;
6646         dst_reg->s32_max_value = S32_MAX;
6647 
6648         dst_reg->var_off = tnum_rshift(subreg, umin_val);
6649         dst_reg->u32_min_value >>= umax_val;
6650         dst_reg->u32_max_value >>= umin_val;
6651 
6652         __mark_reg64_unbounded(dst_reg);
6653         __update_reg32_bounds(dst_reg);
6654 }
6655 
6656 static void scalar_min_max_rsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6657                                struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6658 {
6659         u64 umax_val = src_reg->umax_value;
6660         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6661 
6662         /* BPF_RSH is an unsigned shift.  If the value in dst_reg might
6663          * be negative, then either:
6664          * 1) src_reg might be zero, so the sign bit of the result is
6665          *    unknown, so we lose our signed bounds
6666          * 2) it's known negative, thus the unsigned bounds capture the
6667          *    signed bounds
6668          * 3) the signed bounds cross zero, so they tell us nothing
6669          *    about the result
6670          * If the value in dst_reg is known nonnegative, then again the
6671          * unsigned bounts capture the signed bounds.
6672          * Thus, in all cases it suffices to blow away our signed bounds
6673          * and rely on inferring new ones from the unsigned bounds and
6674          * var_off of the result.
6675          */
6676         dst_reg->smin_value = S64_MIN;
6677         dst_reg->smax_value = S64_MAX;
6678         dst_reg->var_off = tnum_rshift(dst_reg->var_off, umin_val);
6679         dst_reg->umin_value >>= umax_val;
6680         dst_reg->umax_value >>= umin_val;
6681 
6682         /* Its not easy to operate on alu32 bounds here because it depends
6683          * on bits being shifted in. Take easy way out and mark unbounded
6684          * so we can recalculate later from tnum.
6685          */
6686         __mark_reg32_unbounded(dst_reg);
6687         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6688 }
6689 
6690 static void scalar32_min_max_arsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6691                                   struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6692 {
6693         u64 umin_val = src_reg->u32_min_value;
6694 
6695         /* Upon reaching here, src_known is true and
6696          * umax_val is equal to umin_val.
6697          */
6698         dst_reg->s32_min_value = (u32)(((s32)dst_reg->s32_min_value) >> umin_val);
6699         dst_reg->s32_max_value = (u32)(((s32)dst_reg->s32_max_value) >> umin_val);
6700 
6701         dst_reg->var_off = tnum_arshift(tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off), umin_val, 32);
6702 
6703         /* blow away the dst_reg umin_value/umax_value and rely on
6704          * dst_reg var_off to refine the result.
6705          */
6706         dst_reg->u32_min_value = 0;
6707         dst_reg->u32_max_value = U32_MAX;
6708 
6709         __mark_reg64_unbounded(dst_reg);
6710         __update_reg32_bounds(dst_reg);
6711 }
6712 
6713 static void scalar_min_max_arsh(struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6714                                 struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg)
6715 {
6716         u64 umin_val = src_reg->umin_value;
6717 
6718         /* Upon reaching here, src_known is true and umax_val is equal
6719          * to umin_val.
6720          */
6721         dst_reg->smin_value >>= umin_val;
6722         dst_reg->smax_value >>= umin_val;
6723 
6724         dst_reg->var_off = tnum_arshift(dst_reg->var_off, umin_val, 64);
6725 
6726         /* blow away the dst_reg umin_value/umax_value and rely on
6727          * dst_reg var_off to refine the result.
6728          */
6729         dst_reg->umin_value = 0;
6730         dst_reg->umax_value = U64_MAX;
6731 
6732         /* Its not easy to operate on alu32 bounds here because it depends
6733          * on bits being shifted in from upper 32-bits. Take easy way out
6734          * and mark unbounded so we can recalculate later from tnum.
6735          */
6736         __mark_reg32_unbounded(dst_reg);
6737         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6738 }
6739 
6740 /* WARNING: This function does calculations on 64-bit values, but the actual
6741  * execution may occur on 32-bit values. Therefore, things like bitshifts
6742  * need extra checks in the 32-bit case.
6743  */
6744 static int adjust_scalar_min_max_vals(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
6745                                       struct bpf_insn *insn,
6746                                       struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
6747                                       struct bpf_reg_state src_reg)
6748 {
6749         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
6750         u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insn->code);
6751         bool src_known;
6752         s64 smin_val, smax_val;
6753         u64 umin_val, umax_val;
6754         s32 s32_min_val, s32_max_val;
6755         u32 u32_min_val, u32_max_val;
6756         u64 insn_bitness = (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_ALU64) ? 64 : 32;
6757         bool alu32 = (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) != BPF_ALU64);
6758         int ret;
6759 
6760         smin_val = src_reg.smin_value;
6761         smax_val = src_reg.smax_value;
6762         umin_val = src_reg.umin_value;
6763         umax_val = src_reg.umax_value;
6764 
6765         s32_min_val = src_reg.s32_min_value;
6766         s32_max_val = src_reg.s32_max_value;
6767         u32_min_val = src_reg.u32_min_value;
6768         u32_max_val = src_reg.u32_max_value;
6769 
6770         if (alu32) {
6771                 src_known = tnum_subreg_is_const(src_reg.var_off);
6772                 if ((src_known &&
6773                      (s32_min_val != s32_max_val || u32_min_val != u32_max_val)) ||
6774                     s32_min_val > s32_max_val || u32_min_val > u32_max_val) {
6775                         /* Taint dst register if offset had invalid bounds
6776                          * derived from e.g. dead branches.
6777                          */
6778                         __mark_reg_unknown(env, dst_reg);
6779                         return 0;
6780                 }
6781         } else {
6782                 src_known = tnum_is_const(src_reg.var_off);
6783                 if ((src_known &&
6784                      (smin_val != smax_val || umin_val != umax_val)) ||
6785                     smin_val > smax_val || umin_val > umax_val) {
6786                         /* Taint dst register if offset had invalid bounds
6787                          * derived from e.g. dead branches.
6788                          */
6789                         __mark_reg_unknown(env, dst_reg);
6790                         return 0;
6791                 }
6792         }
6793 
6794         if (!src_known &&
6795             opcode != BPF_ADD && opcode != BPF_SUB && opcode != BPF_AND) {
6796                 __mark_reg_unknown(env, dst_reg);
6797                 return 0;
6798         }
6799 
6800         if (sanitize_needed(opcode)) {
6801                 ret = sanitize_val_alu(env, insn);
6802                 if (ret < 0)
6803                         return sanitize_err(env, insn, ret, NULL, NULL);
6804         }
6805 
6806         /* Calculate sign/unsigned bounds and tnum for alu32 and alu64 bit ops.
6807          * There are two classes of instructions: The first class we track both
6808          * alu32 and alu64 sign/unsigned bounds independently this provides the
6809          * greatest amount of precision when alu operations are mixed with jmp32
6810          * operations. These operations are BPF_ADD, BPF_SUB, BPF_MUL, BPF_ADD,
6811          * and BPF_OR. This is possible because these ops have fairly easy to
6812          * understand and calculate behavior in both 32-bit and 64-bit alu ops.
6813          * See alu32 verifier tests for examples. The second class of
6814          * operations, BPF_LSH, BPF_RSH, and BPF_ARSH, however are not so easy
6815          * with regards to tracking sign/unsigned bounds because the bits may
6816          * cross subreg boundaries in the alu64 case. When this happens we mark
6817          * the reg unbounded in the subreg bound space and use the resulting
6818          * tnum to calculate an approximation of the sign/unsigned bounds.
6819          */
6820         switch (opcode) {
6821         case BPF_ADD:
6822                 scalar32_min_max_add(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6823                 scalar_min_max_add(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6824                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_add(dst_reg->var_off, src_reg.var_off);
6825                 break;
6826         case BPF_SUB:
6827                 scalar32_min_max_sub(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6828                 scalar_min_max_sub(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6829                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_sub(dst_reg->var_off, src_reg.var_off);
6830                 break;
6831         case BPF_MUL:
6832                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_mul(dst_reg->var_off, src_reg.var_off);
6833                 scalar32_min_max_mul(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6834                 scalar_min_max_mul(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6835                 break;
6836         case BPF_AND:
6837                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_and(dst_reg->var_off, src_reg.var_off);
6838                 scalar32_min_max_and(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6839                 scalar_min_max_and(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6840                 break;
6841         case BPF_OR:
6842                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_or(dst_reg->var_off, src_reg.var_off);
6843                 scalar32_min_max_or(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6844                 scalar_min_max_or(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6845                 break;
6846         case BPF_XOR:
6847                 dst_reg->var_off = tnum_xor(dst_reg->var_off, src_reg.var_off);
6848                 scalar32_min_max_xor(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6849                 scalar_min_max_xor(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6850                 break;
6851         case BPF_LSH:
6852                 if (umax_val >= insn_bitness) {
6853                         /* Shifts greater than 31 or 63 are undefined.
6854                          * This includes shifts by a negative number.
6855                          */
6856                         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
6857                         break;
6858                 }
6859                 if (alu32)
6860                         scalar32_min_max_lsh(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6861                 else
6862                         scalar_min_max_lsh(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6863                 break;
6864         case BPF_RSH:
6865                 if (umax_val >= insn_bitness) {
6866                         /* Shifts greater than 31 or 63 are undefined.
6867                          * This includes shifts by a negative number.
6868                          */
6869                         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
6870                         break;
6871                 }
6872                 if (alu32)
6873                         scalar32_min_max_rsh(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6874                 else
6875                         scalar_min_max_rsh(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6876                 break;
6877         case BPF_ARSH:
6878                 if (umax_val >= insn_bitness) {
6879                         /* Shifts greater than 31 or 63 are undefined.
6880                          * This includes shifts by a negative number.
6881                          */
6882                         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
6883                         break;
6884                 }
6885                 if (alu32)
6886                         scalar32_min_max_arsh(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6887                 else
6888                         scalar_min_max_arsh(dst_reg, &src_reg);
6889                 break;
6890         default:
6891                 mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
6892                 break;
6893         }
6894 
6895         /* ALU32 ops are zero extended into 64bit register */
6896         if (alu32)
6897                 zext_32_to_64(dst_reg);
6898 
6899         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
6900         __reg_deduce_bounds(dst_reg);
6901         __reg_bound_offset(dst_reg);
6902         return 0;
6903 }
6904 
6905 /* Handles ALU ops other than BPF_END, BPF_NEG and BPF_MOV: computes new min/max
6906  * and var_off.
6907  */
6908 static int adjust_reg_min_max_vals(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
6909                                    struct bpf_insn *insn)
6910 {
6911         struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate = env->cur_state;
6912         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
6913         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = state->regs, *dst_reg, *src_reg;
6914         struct bpf_reg_state *ptr_reg = NULL, off_reg = {0};
6915         u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insn->code);
6916         int err;
6917 
6918         dst_reg = &regs[insn->dst_reg];
6919         src_reg = NULL;
6920         if (dst_reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE)
6921                 ptr_reg = dst_reg;
6922         else
6923                 /* Make sure ID is cleared otherwise dst_reg min/max could be
6924                  * incorrectly propagated into other registers by find_equal_scalars()
6925                  */
6926                 dst_reg->id = 0;
6927         if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X) {
6928                 src_reg = &regs[insn->src_reg];
6929                 if (src_reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
6930                         if (dst_reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
6931                                 /* Combining two pointers by any ALU op yields
6932                                  * an arbitrary scalar. Disallow all math except
6933                                  * pointer subtraction
6934                                  */
6935                                 if (opcode == BPF_SUB && env->allow_ptr_leaks) {
6936                                         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
6937                                         return 0;
6938                                 }
6939                                 verbose(env, "R%d pointer %s pointer prohibited\n",
6940                                         insn->dst_reg,
6941                                         bpf_alu_string[opcode >> 4]);
6942                                 return -EACCES;
6943                         } else {
6944                                 /* scalar += pointer
6945                                  * This is legal, but we have to reverse our
6946                                  * src/dest handling in computing the range
6947                                  */
6948                                 err = mark_chain_precision(env, insn->dst_reg);
6949                                 if (err)
6950                                         return err;
6951                                 return adjust_ptr_min_max_vals(env, insn,
6952                                                                src_reg, dst_reg);
6953                         }
6954                 } else if (ptr_reg) {
6955                         /* pointer += scalar */
6956                         err = mark_chain_precision(env, insn->src_reg);
6957                         if (err)
6958                                 return err;
6959                         return adjust_ptr_min_max_vals(env, insn,
6960                                                        dst_reg, src_reg);
6961                 }
6962         } else {
6963                 /* Pretend the src is a reg with a known value, since we only
6964                  * need to be able to read from this state.
6965                  */
6966                 off_reg.type = SCALAR_VALUE;
6967                 __mark_reg_known(&off_reg, insn->imm);
6968                 src_reg = &off_reg;
6969                 if (ptr_reg) /* pointer += K */
6970                         return adjust_ptr_min_max_vals(env, insn,
6971                                                        ptr_reg, src_reg);
6972         }
6973 
6974         /* Got here implies adding two SCALAR_VALUEs */
6975         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(ptr_reg)) {
6976                 print_verifier_state(env, state);
6977                 verbose(env, "verifier internal error: unexpected ptr_reg\n");
6978                 return -EINVAL;
6979         }
6980         if (WARN_ON(!src_reg)) {
6981                 print_verifier_state(env, state);
6982                 verbose(env, "verifier internal error: no src_reg\n");
6983                 return -EINVAL;
6984         }
6985         return adjust_scalar_min_max_vals(env, insn, dst_reg, *src_reg);
6986 }
6987 
6988 /* check validity of 32-bit and 64-bit arithmetic operations */
6989 static int check_alu_op(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, struct bpf_insn *insn)
6990 {
6991         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
6992         u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insn->code);
6993         int err;
6994 
6995         if (opcode == BPF_END || opcode == BPF_NEG) {
6996                 if (opcode == BPF_NEG) {
6997                         if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) != 0 ||
6998                             insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_0 ||
6999                             insn->off != 0 || insn->imm != 0) {
7000                                 verbose(env, "BPF_NEG uses reserved fields\n");
7001                                 return -EINVAL;
7002                         }
7003                 } else {
7004                         if (insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_0 || insn->off != 0 ||
7005                             (insn->imm != 16 && insn->imm != 32 && insn->imm != 64) ||
7006                             BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_ALU64) {
7007                                 verbose(env, "BPF_END uses reserved fields\n");
7008                                 return -EINVAL;
7009                         }
7010                 }
7011 
7012                 /* check src operand */
7013                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, SRC_OP);
7014                 if (err)
7015                         return err;
7016 
7017                 if (is_pointer_value(env, insn->dst_reg)) {
7018                         verbose(env, "R%d pointer arithmetic prohibited\n",
7019                                 insn->dst_reg);
7020                         return -EACCES;
7021                 }
7022 
7023                 /* check dest operand */
7024                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, DST_OP);
7025                 if (err)
7026                         return err;
7027 
7028         } else if (opcode == BPF_MOV) {
7029 
7030                 if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X) {
7031                         if (insn->imm != 0 || insn->off != 0) {
7032                                 verbose(env, "BPF_MOV uses reserved fields\n");
7033                                 return -EINVAL;
7034                         }
7035 
7036                         /* check src operand */
7037                         err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->src_reg, SRC_OP);
7038                         if (err)
7039                                 return err;
7040                 } else {
7041                         if (insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_0 || insn->off != 0) {
7042                                 verbose(env, "BPF_MOV uses reserved fields\n");
7043                                 return -EINVAL;
7044                         }
7045                 }
7046 
7047                 /* check dest operand, mark as required later */
7048                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, DST_OP_NO_MARK);
7049                 if (err)
7050                         return err;
7051 
7052                 if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X) {
7053                         struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg = regs + insn->src_reg;
7054                         struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg = regs + insn->dst_reg;
7055 
7056                         if (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_ALU64) {
7057                                 /* case: R1 = R2
7058                                  * copy register state to dest reg
7059                                  */
7060                                 if (src_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && !src_reg->id)
7061                                         /* Assign src and dst registers the same ID
7062                                          * that will be used by find_equal_scalars()
7063                                          * to propagate min/max range.
7064                                          */
7065                                         src_reg->id = ++env->id_gen;
7066                                 *dst_reg = *src_reg;
7067                                 dst_reg->live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
7068                                 dst_reg->subreg_def = DEF_NOT_SUBREG;
7069                         } else {
7070                                 /* R1 = (u32) R2 */
7071                                 if (is_pointer_value(env, insn->src_reg)) {
7072                                         verbose(env,
7073                                                 "R%d partial copy of pointer\n",
7074                                                 insn->src_reg);
7075                                         return -EACCES;
7076                                 } else if (src_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE) {
7077                                         *dst_reg = *src_reg;
7078                                         /* Make sure ID is cleared otherwise
7079                                          * dst_reg min/max could be incorrectly
7080                                          * propagated into src_reg by find_equal_scalars()
7081                                          */
7082                                         dst_reg->id = 0;
7083                                         dst_reg->live |= REG_LIVE_WRITTEN;
7084                                         dst_reg->subreg_def = env->insn_idx + 1;
7085                                 } else {
7086                                         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs,
7087                                                          insn->dst_reg);
7088                                 }
7089                                 zext_32_to_64(dst_reg);
7090                         }
7091                 } else {
7092                         /* case: R = imm
7093                          * remember the value we stored into this reg
7094                          */
7095                         /* clear any state __mark_reg_known doesn't set */
7096                         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
7097                         regs[insn->dst_reg].type = SCALAR_VALUE;
7098                         if (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_ALU64) {
7099                                 __mark_reg_known(regs + insn->dst_reg,
7100                                                  insn->imm);
7101                         } else {
