7102                                 __mark_reg_known(regs + insn->dst_reg,
7103                                                  (u32)insn->imm);
7104                         }
7105                 }
7106 
7107         } else if (opcode > BPF_END) {
7108                 verbose(env, "invalid BPF_ALU opcode %x\n", opcode);
7109                 return -EINVAL;
7110 
7111         } else {        /* all other ALU ops: and, sub, xor, add, ... */
7112 
7113                 if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X) {
7114                         if (insn->imm != 0 || insn->off != 0) {
7115                                 verbose(env, "BPF_ALU uses reserved fields\n");
7116                                 return -EINVAL;
7117                         }
7118                         /* check src1 operand */
7119                         err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->src_reg, SRC_OP);
7120                         if (err)
7121                                 return err;
7122                 } else {
7123                         if (insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_0 || insn->off != 0) {
7124                                 verbose(env, "BPF_ALU uses reserved fields\n");
7125                                 return -EINVAL;
7126                         }
7127                 }
7128 
7129                 /* check src2 operand */
7130                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, SRC_OP);
7131                 if (err)
7132                         return err;
7133 
7134                 if ((opcode == BPF_MOD || opcode == BPF_DIV) &&
7135                     BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_K && insn->imm == 0) {
7136                         verbose(env, "div by zero\n");
7137                         return -EINVAL;
7138                 }
7139 
7140                 if ((opcode == BPF_LSH || opcode == BPF_RSH ||
7141                      opcode == BPF_ARSH) && BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_K) {
7142                         int size = BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_ALU64 ? 64 : 32;
7143 
7144                         if (insn->imm < 0 || insn->imm >= size) {
7145                                 verbose(env, "invalid shift %d\n", insn->imm);
7146                                 return -EINVAL;
7147                         }
7148                 }
7149 
7150                 /* check dest operand */
7151                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, DST_OP_NO_MARK);
7152                 if (err)
7153                         return err;
7154 
7155                 return adjust_reg_min_max_vals(env, insn);
7156         }
7157 
7158         return 0;
7159 }
7160 
7161 static void __find_good_pkt_pointers(struct bpf_func_state *state,
7162                                      struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
7163                                      enum bpf_reg_type type, u16 new_range)
7164 {
7165         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
7166         int i;
7167 
7168         for (i = 0; i < MAX_BPF_REG; i++) {
7169                 reg = &state->regs[i];
7170                 if (reg->type == type && reg->id == dst_reg->id)
7171                         /* keep the maximum range already checked */
7172                         reg->range = max(reg->range, new_range);
7173         }
7174 
7175         bpf_for_each_spilled_reg(i, state, reg) {
7176                 if (!reg)
7177                         continue;
7178                 if (reg->type == type && reg->id == dst_reg->id)
7179                         reg->range = max(reg->range, new_range);
7180         }
7181 }
7182 
7183 static void find_good_pkt_pointers(struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate,
7184                                    struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
7185                                    enum bpf_reg_type type,
7186                                    bool range_right_open)
7187 {
7188         u16 new_range;
7189         int i;
7190 
7191         if (dst_reg->off < 0 ||
7192             (dst_reg->off == 0 && range_right_open))
7193                 /* This doesn't give us any range */
7194                 return;
7195 
7196         if (dst_reg->umax_value > MAX_PACKET_OFF ||
7197             dst_reg->umax_value + dst_reg->off > MAX_PACKET_OFF)
7198                 /* Risk of overflow.  For instance, ptr + (1<<63) may be less
7199                  * than pkt_end, but that's because it's also less than pkt.
7200                  */
7201                 return;
7202 
7203         new_range = dst_reg->off;
7204         if (range_right_open)
7205                 new_range--;
7206 
7207         /* Examples for register markings:
7208          *
7209          * pkt_data in dst register:
7210          *
7211          *   r2 = r3;
7212          *   r2 += 8;
7213          *   if (r2 > pkt_end) goto <handle exception>
7214          *   <access okay>
7215          *
7216          *   r2 = r3;
7217          *   r2 += 8;
7218          *   if (r2 < pkt_end) goto <access okay>
7219          *   <handle exception>
7220          *
7221          *   Where:
7222          *     r2 == dst_reg, pkt_end == src_reg
7223          *     r2=pkt(id=n,off=8,r=0)
7224          *     r3=pkt(id=n,off=0,r=0)
7225          *
7226          * pkt_data in src register:
7227          *
7228          *   r2 = r3;
7229          *   r2 += 8;
7230          *   if (pkt_end >= r2) goto <access okay>
7231          *   <handle exception>
7232          *
7233          *   r2 = r3;
7234          *   r2 += 8;
7235          *   if (pkt_end <= r2) goto <handle exception>
7236          *   <access okay>
7237          *
7238          *   Where:
7239          *     pkt_end == dst_reg, r2 == src_reg
7240          *     r2=pkt(id=n,off=8,r=0)
7241          *     r3=pkt(id=n,off=0,r=0)
7242          *
7243          * Find register r3 and mark its range as r3=pkt(id=n,off=0,r=8)
7244          * or r3=pkt(id=n,off=0,r=8-1), so that range of bytes [r3, r3 + 8)
7245          * and [r3, r3 + 8-1) respectively is safe to access depending on
7246          * the check.
7247          */
7248 
7249         /* If our ids match, then we must have the same max_value.  And we
7250          * don't care about the other reg's fixed offset, since if it's too big
7251          * the range won't allow anything.
7252          * dst_reg->off is known < MAX_PACKET_OFF, therefore it fits in a u16.
7253          */
7254         for (i = 0; i <= vstate->curframe; i++)
7255                 __find_good_pkt_pointers(vstate->frame[i], dst_reg, type,
7256                                          new_range);
7257 }
7258 
7259 static int is_branch32_taken(struct bpf_reg_state *reg, u32 val, u8 opcode)
7260 {
7261         struct tnum subreg = tnum_subreg(reg->var_off);
7262         s32 sval = (s32)val;
7263 
7264         switch (opcode) {
7265         case BPF_JEQ:
7266                 if (tnum_is_const(subreg))
7267                         return !!tnum_equals_const(subreg, val);
7268                 break;
7269         case BPF_JNE:
7270                 if (tnum_is_const(subreg))
7271                         return !tnum_equals_const(subreg, val);
7272                 break;
7273         case BPF_JSET:
7274                 if ((~subreg.mask & subreg.value) & val)
7275                         return 1;
7276                 if (!((subreg.mask | subreg.value) & val))
7277                         return 0;
7278                 break;
7279         case BPF_JGT:
7280                 if (reg->u32_min_value > val)
7281                         return 1;
7282                 else if (reg->u32_max_value <= val)
7283                         return 0;
7284                 break;
7285         case BPF_JSGT:
7286                 if (reg->s32_min_value > sval)
7287                         return 1;
7288                 else if (reg->s32_max_value <= sval)
7289                         return 0;
7290                 break;
7291         case BPF_JLT:
7292                 if (reg->u32_max_value < val)
7293                         return 1;
7294                 else if (reg->u32_min_value >= val)
7295                         return 0;
7296                 break;
7297         case BPF_JSLT:
7298                 if (reg->s32_max_value < sval)
7299                         return 1;
7300                 else if (reg->s32_min_value >= sval)
7301                         return 0;
7302                 break;
7303         case BPF_JGE:
7304                 if (reg->u32_min_value >= val)
7305                         return 1;
7306                 else if (reg->u32_max_value < val)
7307                         return 0;
7308                 break;
7309         case BPF_JSGE:
7310                 if (reg->s32_min_value >= sval)
7311                         return 1;
7312                 else if (reg->s32_max_value < sval)
7313                         return 0;
7314                 break;
7315         case BPF_JLE:
7316                 if (reg->u32_max_value <= val)
7317                         return 1;
7318                 else if (reg->u32_min_value > val)
7319                         return 0;
7320                 break;
7321         case BPF_JSLE:
7322                 if (reg->s32_max_value <= sval)
7323                         return 1;
7324                 else if (reg->s32_min_value > sval)
7325                         return 0;
7326                 break;
7327         }
7328 
7329         return -1;
7330 }
7331 
7332 
7333 static int is_branch64_taken(struct bpf_reg_state *reg, u64 val, u8 opcode)
7334 {
7335         s64 sval = (s64)val;
7336 
7337         switch (opcode) {
7338         case BPF_JEQ:
7339                 if (tnum_is_const(reg->var_off))
7340                         return !!tnum_equals_const(reg->var_off, val);
7341                 break;
7342         case BPF_JNE:
7343                 if (tnum_is_const(reg->var_off))
7344                         return !tnum_equals_const(reg->var_off, val);
7345                 break;
7346         case BPF_JSET:
7347                 if ((~reg->var_off.mask & reg->var_off.value) & val)
7348                         return 1;
7349                 if (!((reg->var_off.mask | reg->var_off.value) & val))
7350                         return 0;
7351                 break;
7352         case BPF_JGT:
7353                 if (reg->umin_value > val)
7354                         return 1;
7355                 else if (reg->umax_value <= val)
7356                         return 0;
7357                 break;
7358         case BPF_JSGT:
7359                 if (reg->smin_value > sval)
7360                         return 1;
7361                 else if (reg->smax_value <= sval)
7362                         return 0;
7363                 break;
7364         case BPF_JLT:
7365                 if (reg->umax_value < val)
7366                         return 1;
7367                 else if (reg->umin_value >= val)
7368                         return 0;
7369                 break;
7370         case BPF_JSLT:
7371                 if (reg->smax_value < sval)
7372                         return 1;
7373                 else if (reg->smin_value >= sval)
7374                         return 0;
7375                 break;
7376         case BPF_JGE:
7377                 if (reg->umin_value >= val)
7378                         return 1;
7379                 else if (reg->umax_value < val)
7380                         return 0;
7381                 break;
7382         case BPF_JSGE:
7383                 if (reg->smin_value >= sval)
7384                         return 1;
7385                 else if (reg->smax_value < sval)
7386                         return 0;
7387                 break;
7388         case BPF_JLE:
7389                 if (reg->umax_value <= val)
7390                         return 1;
7391                 else if (reg->umin_value > val)
7392                         return 0;
7393                 break;
7394         case BPF_JSLE:
7395                 if (reg->smax_value <= sval)
7396                         return 1;
7397                 else if (reg->smin_value > sval)
7398                         return 0;
7399                 break;
7400         }
7401 
7402         return -1;
7403 }
7404 
7405 /* compute branch direction of the expression "if (reg opcode val) goto target;"
7406  * and return:
7407  *  1 - branch will be taken and "goto target" will be executed
7408  *  0 - branch will not be taken and fall-through to next insn
7409  * -1 - unknown. Example: "if (reg < 5)" is unknown when register value
7410  *      range [0,10]
7411  */
7412 static int is_branch_taken(struct bpf_reg_state *reg, u64 val, u8 opcode,
7413                            bool is_jmp32)
7414 {
7415         if (__is_pointer_value(false, reg)) {
7416                 if (!reg_type_not_null(reg->type))
7417                         return -1;
7418 
7419                 /* If pointer is valid tests against zero will fail so we can
7420                  * use this to direct branch taken.
7421                  */
7422                 if (val != 0)
7423                         return -1;
7424 
7425                 switch (opcode) {
7426                 case BPF_JEQ:
7427                         return 0;
7428                 case BPF_JNE:
7429                         return 1;
7430                 default:
7431                         return -1;
7432                 }
7433         }
7434 
7435         if (is_jmp32)
7436                 return is_branch32_taken(reg, val, opcode);
7437         return is_branch64_taken(reg, val, opcode);
7438 }
7439 
7440 /* Adjusts the register min/max values in the case that the dst_reg is the
7441  * variable register that we are working on, and src_reg is a constant or we're
7442  * simply doing a BPF_K check.
7443  * In JEQ/JNE cases we also adjust the var_off values.
7444  */
7445 static void reg_set_min_max(struct bpf_reg_state *true_reg,
7446                             struct bpf_reg_state *false_reg,
7447                             u64 val, u32 val32,
7448                             u8 opcode, bool is_jmp32)
7449 {
7450         struct tnum false_32off = tnum_subreg(false_reg->var_off);
7451         struct tnum false_64off = false_reg->var_off;
7452         struct tnum true_32off = tnum_subreg(true_reg->var_off);
7453         struct tnum true_64off = true_reg->var_off;
7454         s64 sval = (s64)val;
7455         s32 sval32 = (s32)val32;
7456 
7457         /* If the dst_reg is a pointer, we can't learn anything about its
7458          * variable offset from the compare (unless src_reg were a pointer into
7459          * the same object, but we don't bother with that.
7460          * Since false_reg and true_reg have the same type by construction, we
7461          * only need to check one of them for pointerness.
7462          */
7463         if (__is_pointer_value(false, false_reg))
7464                 return;
7465 
7466         switch (opcode) {
7467         case BPF_JEQ:
7468         case BPF_JNE:
7469         {
7470                 struct bpf_reg_state *reg =
7471                         opcode == BPF_JEQ ? true_reg : false_reg;
7472 
7473                 /* JEQ/JNE comparison doesn't change the register equivalence.
7474                  * r1 = r2;
7475                  * if (r1 == 42) goto label;
7476                  * ...
7477                  * label: // here both r1 and r2 are known to be 42.
7478                  *
7479                  * Hence when marking register as known preserve it's ID.
7480                  */
7481                 if (is_jmp32)
7482                         __mark_reg32_known(reg, val32);
7483                 else
7484                         ___mark_reg_known(reg, val);
7485                 break;
7486         }
7487         case BPF_JSET:
7488                 if (is_jmp32) {
7489                         false_32off = tnum_and(false_32off, tnum_const(~val32));
7490                         if (is_power_of_2(val32))
7491                                 true_32off = tnum_or(true_32off,
7492                                                      tnum_const(val32));
7493                 } else {
7494                         false_64off = tnum_and(false_64off, tnum_const(~val));
7495                         if (is_power_of_2(val))
7496                                 true_64off = tnum_or(true_64off,
7497                                                      tnum_const(val));
7498                 }
7499                 break;
7500         case BPF_JGE:
7501         case BPF_JGT:
7502         {
7503                 if (is_jmp32) {
7504                         u32 false_umax = opcode == BPF_JGT ? val32  : val32 - 1;
7505                         u32 true_umin = opcode == BPF_JGT ? val32 + 1 : val32;
7506 
7507                         false_reg->u32_max_value = min(false_reg->u32_max_value,
7508                                                        false_umax);
7509                         true_reg->u32_min_value = max(true_reg->u32_min_value,
7510                                                       true_umin);
7511                 } else {
7512                         u64 false_umax = opcode == BPF_JGT ? val    : val - 1;
7513                         u64 true_umin = opcode == BPF_JGT ? val + 1 : val;
7514 
7515                         false_reg->umax_value = min(false_reg->umax_value, false_umax);
7516                         true_reg->umin_value = max(true_reg->umin_value, true_umin);
7517                 }
7518                 break;
7519         }
7520         case BPF_JSGE:
7521         case BPF_JSGT:
7522         {
7523                 if (is_jmp32) {
7524                         s32 false_smax = opcode == BPF_JSGT ? sval32    : sval32 - 1;
7525                         s32 true_smin = opcode == BPF_JSGT ? sval32 + 1 : sval32;
7526 
7527                         false_reg->s32_max_value = min(false_reg->s32_max_value, false_smax);
7528                         true_reg->s32_min_value = max(true_reg->s32_min_value, true_smin);
7529                 } else {
7530                         s64 false_smax = opcode == BPF_JSGT ? sval    : sval - 1;
7531                         s64 true_smin = opcode == BPF_JSGT ? sval + 1 : sval;
7532 
7533                         false_reg->smax_value = min(false_reg->smax_value, false_smax);
7534                         true_reg->smin_value = max(true_reg->smin_value, true_smin);
7535                 }
7536                 break;
7537         }
7538         case BPF_JLE:
7539         case BPF_JLT:
7540         {
7541                 if (is_jmp32) {
7542                         u32 false_umin = opcode == BPF_JLT ? val32  : val32 + 1;
7543                         u32 true_umax = opcode == BPF_JLT ? val32 - 1 : val32;
7544 
7545                         false_reg->u32_min_value = max(false_reg->u32_min_value,
7546                                                        false_umin);
7547                         true_reg->u32_max_value = min(true_reg->u32_max_value,
7548                                                       true_umax);
7549                 } else {
7550                         u64 false_umin = opcode == BPF_JLT ? val    : val + 1;
7551                         u64 true_umax = opcode == BPF_JLT ? val - 1 : val;
7552 
7553                         false_reg->umin_value = max(false_reg->umin_value, false_umin);
7554                         true_reg->umax_value = min(true_reg->umax_value, true_umax);
7555                 }
7556                 break;
7557         }
7558         case BPF_JSLE:
7559         case BPF_JSLT:
7560         {
7561                 if (is_jmp32) {
7562                         s32 false_smin = opcode == BPF_JSLT ? sval32    : sval32 + 1;
7563                         s32 true_smax = opcode == BPF_JSLT ? sval32 - 1 : sval32;
7564 
7565                         false_reg->s32_min_value = max(false_reg->s32_min_value, false_smin);
7566                         true_reg->s32_max_value = min(true_reg->s32_max_value, true_smax);
7567                 } else {
7568                         s64 false_smin = opcode == BPF_JSLT ? sval    : sval + 1;
7569                         s64 true_smax = opcode == BPF_JSLT ? sval - 1 : sval;
7570 
7571                         false_reg->smin_value = max(false_reg->smin_value, false_smin);
7572                         true_reg->smax_value = min(true_reg->smax_value, true_smax);
7573                 }
7574                 break;
7575         }
7576         default:
7577                 return;
7578         }
7579 
7580         if (is_jmp32) {
7581                 false_reg->var_off = tnum_or(tnum_clear_subreg(false_64off),
7582                                              tnum_subreg(false_32off));
7583                 true_reg->var_off = tnum_or(tnum_clear_subreg(true_64off),
7584                                             tnum_subreg(true_32off));
7585                 __reg_combine_32_into_64(false_reg);
7586                 __reg_combine_32_into_64(true_reg);
7587         } else {
7588                 false_reg->var_off = false_64off;
7589                 true_reg->var_off = true_64off;
7590                 __reg_combine_64_into_32(false_reg);
7591                 __reg_combine_64_into_32(true_reg);
7592         }
7593 }
7594 
7595 /* Same as above, but for the case that dst_reg holds a constant and src_reg is
7596  * the variable reg.
7597  */
7598 static void reg_set_min_max_inv(struct bpf_reg_state *true_reg,
7599                                 struct bpf_reg_state *false_reg,
7600                                 u64 val, u32 val32,
7601                                 u8 opcode, bool is_jmp32)
7602 {
7603         /* How can we transform "a <op> b" into "b <op> a"? */
7604         static const u8 opcode_flip[16] = {
7605                 /* these stay the same */
7606                 [BPF_JEQ  >> 4] = BPF_JEQ,
7607                 [BPF_JNE  >> 4] = BPF_JNE,
7608                 [BPF_JSET >> 4] = BPF_JSET,
7609                 /* these swap "lesser" and "greater" (L and G in the opcodes) */
7610                 [BPF_JGE  >> 4] = BPF_JLE,
7611                 [BPF_JGT  >> 4] = BPF_JLT,
7612                 [BPF_JLE  >> 4] = BPF_JGE,
7613                 [BPF_JLT  >> 4] = BPF_JGT,
7614                 [BPF_JSGE >> 4] = BPF_JSLE,
7615                 [BPF_JSGT >> 4] = BPF_JSLT,
7616                 [BPF_JSLE >> 4] = BPF_JSGE,
7617                 [BPF_JSLT >> 4] = BPF_JSGT
7618         };
7619         opcode = opcode_flip[opcode >> 4];
7620         /* This uses zero as "not present in table"; luckily the zero opcode,
7621          * BPF_JA, can't get here.
7622          */
7623         if (opcode)
7624                 reg_set_min_max(true_reg, false_reg, val, val32, opcode, is_jmp32);
7625 }
7626 
7627 /* Regs are known to be equal, so intersect their min/max/var_off */
7628 static void __reg_combine_min_max(struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg,
7629                                   struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg)
7630 {
7631         src_reg->umin_value = dst_reg->umin_value = max(src_reg->umin_value,
7632                                                         dst_reg->umin_value);
7633         src_reg->umax_value = dst_reg->umax_value = min(src_reg->umax_value,
7634                                                         dst_reg->umax_value);
7635         src_reg->smin_value = dst_reg->smin_value = max(src_reg->smin_value,
7636                                                         dst_reg->smin_value);
7637         src_reg->smax_value = dst_reg->smax_value = min(src_reg->smax_value,
7638                                                         dst_reg->smax_value);
7639         src_reg->var_off = dst_reg->var_off = tnum_intersect(src_reg->var_off,
7640                                                              dst_reg->var_off);
7641         /* We might have learned new bounds from the var_off. */
7642         __update_reg_bounds(src_reg);
7643         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
7644         /* We might have learned something about the sign bit. */
7645         __reg_deduce_bounds(src_reg);
7646         __reg_deduce_bounds(dst_reg);
7647         /* We might have learned some bits from the bounds. */
7648         __reg_bound_offset(src_reg);
7649         __reg_bound_offset(dst_reg);
7650         /* Intersecting with the old var_off might have improved our bounds
7651          * slightly.  e.g. if umax was 0x7f...f and var_off was (0; 0xf...fc),
7652          * then new var_off is (0; 0x7f...fc) which improves our umax.
7653          */
7654         __update_reg_bounds(src_reg);
7655         __update_reg_bounds(dst_reg);
7656 }
7657 
7658 static void reg_combine_min_max(struct bpf_reg_state *true_src,
7659                                 struct bpf_reg_state *true_dst,
7660                                 struct bpf_reg_state *false_src,
7661                                 struct bpf_reg_state *false_dst,
7662                                 u8 opcode)
7663 {
7664         switch (opcode) {
7665         case BPF_JEQ:
7666                 __reg_combine_min_max(true_src, true_dst);
7667                 break;
7668         case BPF_JNE:
7669                 __reg_combine_min_max(false_src, false_dst);
7670                 break;
7671         }
7672 }
7673 
7674 static void mark_ptr_or_null_reg(struct bpf_func_state *state,
7675                                  struct bpf_reg_state *reg, u32 id,
7676                                  bool is_null)
7677 {
7678         if (reg_type_may_be_null(reg->type) && reg->id == id &&
7679             !WARN_ON_ONCE(!reg->id)) {
7680                 /* Old offset (both fixed and variable parts) should
7681                  * have been known-zero, because we don't allow pointer
7682                  * arithmetic on pointers that might be NULL.
7683                  */
7684                 if (WARN_ON_ONCE(reg->smin_value || reg->smax_value ||
7685                                  !tnum_equals_const(reg->var_off, 0) ||
7686                                  reg->off)) {
7687                         __mark_reg_known_zero(reg);
7688                         reg->off = 0;
7689                 }
7690                 if (is_null) {
7691                         reg->type = SCALAR_VALUE;
7692                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE_OR_NULL) {
7693                         const struct bpf_map *map = reg->map_ptr;
7694 
7695                         if (map->inner_map_meta) {
7696                                 reg->type = CONST_PTR_TO_MAP;
7697                                 reg->map_ptr = map->inner_map_meta;
7698                         } else if (map->map_type == BPF_MAP_TYPE_XSKMAP) {
7699                                 reg->type = PTR_TO_XDP_SOCK;
7700                         } else if (map->map_type == BPF_MAP_TYPE_SOCKMAP ||
7701                                    map->map_type == BPF_MAP_TYPE_SOCKHASH) {
7702                                 reg->type = PTR_TO_SOCKET;
7703                         } else {
7704                                 reg->type = PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE;
7705                         }
7706                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_SOCKET_OR_NULL) {
7707                         reg->type = PTR_TO_SOCKET;
7708                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON_OR_NULL) {
7709                         reg->type = PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON;
7710                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK_OR_NULL) {
7711                         reg->type = PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK;
7712                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_BTF_ID_OR_NULL) {
7713                         reg->type = PTR_TO_BTF_ID;
7714                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_MEM_OR_NULL) {
7715                         reg->type = PTR_TO_MEM;
7716                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_RDONLY_BUF_OR_NULL) {
7717                         reg->type = PTR_TO_RDONLY_BUF;
7718                 } else if (reg->type == PTR_TO_RDWR_BUF_OR_NULL) {
7719                         reg->type = PTR_TO_RDWR_BUF;
7720                 }
7721                 if (is_null) {
7722                         /* We don't need id and ref_obj_id from this point
7723                          * onwards anymore, thus we should better reset it,
7724                          * so that state pruning has chances to take effect.
7725                          */
7726                         reg->id = 0;
7727                         reg->ref_obj_id = 0;
7728                 } else if (!reg_may_point_to_spin_lock(reg)) {
7729                         /* For not-NULL ptr, reg->ref_obj_id will be reset
7730                          * in release_reg_references().
7731                          *
7732                          * reg->id is still used by spin_lock ptr. Other
7733                          * than spin_lock ptr type, reg->id can be reset.
7734                          */
7735                         reg->id = 0;
7736                 }
7737         }
7738 }
7739 
7740 static void __mark_ptr_or_null_regs(struct bpf_func_state *state, u32 id,
7741                                     bool is_null)
7742 {
7743         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
7744         int i;
7745 
7746         for (i = 0; i < MAX_BPF_REG; i++)
7747                 mark_ptr_or_null_reg(state, &state->regs[i], id, is_null);
7748 
7749         bpf_for_each_spilled_reg(i, state, reg) {
7750                 if (!reg)
7751                         continue;
7752                 mark_ptr_or_null_reg(state, reg, id, is_null);
7753         }
7754 }
7755 
7756 /* The logic is similar to find_good_pkt_pointers(), both could eventually
7757  * be folded together at some point.
7758  */
7759 static void mark_ptr_or_null_regs(struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate, u32 regno,
7760                                   bool is_null)
7761 {
7762         struct bpf_func_state *state = vstate->frame[vstate->curframe];
7763         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = state->regs;
7764         u32 ref_obj_id = regs[regno].ref_obj_id;
7765         u32 id = regs[regno].id;
7766         int i;
7767 
7768         if (ref_obj_id && ref_obj_id == id && is_null)
7769                 /* regs[regno] is in the " == NULL" branch.
7770                  * No one could have freed the reference state before
7771                  * doing the NULL check.
7772                  */
7773                 WARN_ON_ONCE(release_reference_state(state, id));
7774 
7775         for (i = 0; i <= vstate->curframe; i++)
7776                 __mark_ptr_or_null_regs(vstate->frame[i], id, is_null);
7777 }
7778 
7779 static bool try_match_pkt_pointers(const struct bpf_insn *insn,
7780                                    struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg,
7781                                    struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg,
7782                                    struct bpf_verifier_state *this_branch,
7783                                    struct bpf_verifier_state *other_branch)
7784 {
7785         if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) != BPF_X)
7786                 return false;
7787 
7788         /* Pointers are always 64-bit. */
7789         if (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_JMP32)
7790                 return false;
7791 
7792         switch (BPF_OP(insn->code)) {
7793         case BPF_JGT:
7794                 if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET &&
7795                      src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END) ||
7796                     (dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META &&
7797                      reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(src_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET))) {
7798                         /* pkt_data' > pkt_end, pkt_meta' > pkt_data */
7799                         find_good_pkt_pointers(this_branch, dst_reg,
7800                                                dst_reg->type, false);
7801                 } else if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END &&
7802                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET) ||
7803                            (reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(dst_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET) &&
7804                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META)) {
7805                         /* pkt_end > pkt_data', pkt_data > pkt_meta' */
7806                         find_good_pkt_pointers(other_branch, src_reg,
7807                                                src_reg->type, true);
7808                 } else {
7809                         return false;
7810                 }
7811                 break;
7812         case BPF_JLT:
7813                 if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET &&
7814                      src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END) ||
7815                     (dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META &&
7816                      reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(src_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET))) {
7817                         /* pkt_data' < pkt_end, pkt_meta' < pkt_data */
7818                         find_good_pkt_pointers(other_branch, dst_reg,
7819                                                dst_reg->type, true);
7820                 } else if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END &&
7821                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET) ||
7822                            (reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(dst_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET) &&
7823                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META)) {
7824                         /* pkt_end < pkt_data', pkt_data > pkt_meta' */
7825                         find_good_pkt_pointers(this_branch, src_reg,
7826                                                src_reg->type, false);
7827                 } else {
7828                         return false;
7829                 }
7830                 break;
7831         case BPF_JGE:
7832                 if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET &&
7833                      src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END) ||
7834                     (dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META &&
7835                      reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(src_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET))) {
7836                         /* pkt_data' >= pkt_end, pkt_meta' >= pkt_data */
7837                         find_good_pkt_pointers(this_branch, dst_reg,
7838                                                dst_reg->type, true);
7839                 } else if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END &&
7840                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET) ||
7841                            (reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(dst_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET) &&
7842                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META)) {
7843                         /* pkt_end >= pkt_data', pkt_data >= pkt_meta' */
7844                         find_good_pkt_pointers(other_branch, src_reg,
7845                                                src_reg->type, false);
7846                 } else {
7847                         return false;
7848                 }
7849                 break;
7850         case BPF_JLE:
7851                 if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET &&
7852                      src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END) ||
7853                     (dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META &&
7854                      reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(src_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET))) {
7855                         /* pkt_data' <= pkt_end, pkt_meta' <= pkt_data */
7856                         find_good_pkt_pointers(other_branch, dst_reg,
7857                                                dst_reg->type, false);
7858                 } else if ((dst_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_END &&
7859                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET) ||
7860                            (reg_is_init_pkt_pointer(dst_reg, PTR_TO_PACKET) &&
7861                             src_reg->type == PTR_TO_PACKET_META)) {
7862                         /* pkt_end <= pkt_data', pkt_data <= pkt_meta' */
7863                         find_good_pkt_pointers(this_branch, src_reg,
7864                                                src_reg->type, true);
7865                 } else {
7866                         return false;
7867                 }
7868                 break;
7869         default:
7870                 return false;
7871         }
7872 
7873         return true;
7874 }
7875 
7876 static void find_equal_scalars(struct bpf_verifier_state *vstate,
7877                                struct bpf_reg_state *known_reg)
7878 {
7879         struct bpf_func_state *state;
7880         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
7881         int i, j;
7882 
7883         for (i = 0; i <= vstate->curframe; i++) {
7884                 state = vstate->frame[i];
7885                 for (j = 0; j < MAX_BPF_REG; j++) {
7886                         reg = &state->regs[j];
7887                         if (reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && reg->id == known_reg->id)
7888                                 *reg = *known_reg;
7889                 }
7890 
7891                 bpf_for_each_spilled_reg(j, state, reg) {
7892                         if (!reg)
7893                                 continue;
7894                         if (reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && reg->id == known_reg->id)
7895                                 *reg = *known_reg;
7896                 }
7897         }
7898 }
7899 
7900 static int check_cond_jmp_op(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
7901                              struct bpf_insn *insn, int *insn_idx)
7902 {
7903         struct bpf_verifier_state *this_branch = env->cur_state;
7904         struct bpf_verifier_state *other_branch;
7905         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = this_branch->frame[this_branch->curframe]->regs;
7906         struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg, *other_branch_regs, *src_reg = NULL;
7907         u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insn->code);
7908         bool is_jmp32;
7909         int pred = -1;
7910         int err;
7911 
7912         /* Only conditional jumps are expected to reach here. */
7913         if (opcode == BPF_JA || opcode > BPF_JSLE) {
7914                 verbose(env, "invalid BPF_JMP/JMP32 opcode %x\n", opcode);
7915                 return -EINVAL;
7916         }
7917 
7918         if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X) {
7919                 if (insn->imm != 0) {
7920                         verbose(env, "BPF_JMP/JMP32 uses reserved fields\n");
7921                         return -EINVAL;
7922                 }
7923 
7924                 /* check src1 operand */
7925                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->src_reg, SRC_OP);
7926                 if (err)
7927                         return err;
7928 
7929                 if (is_pointer_value(env, insn->src_reg)) {
7930                         verbose(env, "R%d pointer comparison prohibited\n",
7931                                 insn->src_reg);
7932                         return -EACCES;
7933                 }
7934                 src_reg = &regs[insn->src_reg];
7935         } else {
7936                 if (insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_0) {
7937                         verbose(env, "BPF_JMP/JMP32 uses reserved fields\n");
7938                         return -EINVAL;
7939                 }
7940         }
7941 
7942         /* check src2 operand */
7943         err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, SRC_OP);
7944         if (err)
7945                 return err;
7946 
7947         dst_reg = &regs[insn->dst_reg];
7948         is_jmp32 = BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_JMP32;
7949 
7950         if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_K) {
7951                 pred = is_branch_taken(dst_reg, insn->imm, opcode, is_jmp32);
7952         } else if (src_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE &&
7953                    is_jmp32 && tnum_is_const(tnum_subreg(src_reg->var_off))) {
7954                 pred = is_branch_taken(dst_reg,
7955                                        tnum_subreg(src_reg->var_off).value,
7956                                        opcode,
7957                                        is_jmp32);
7958         } else if (src_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE &&
7959                    !is_jmp32 && tnum_is_const(src_reg->var_off)) {
7960                 pred = is_branch_taken(dst_reg,
7961                                        src_reg->var_off.value,
7962                                        opcode,
7963                                        is_jmp32);
7964         }
7965 
7966         if (pred >= 0) {
7967                 /* If we get here with a dst_reg pointer type it is because
7968                  * above is_branch_taken() special cased the 0 comparison.
7969                  */
7970                 if (!__is_pointer_value(false, dst_reg))
7971                         err = mark_chain_precision(env, insn->dst_reg);
7972                 if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X && !err)
7973                         err = mark_chain_precision(env, insn->src_reg);
7974                 if (err)
7975                         return err;
7976         }
7977         if (pred == 1) {
7978                 /* only follow the goto, ignore fall-through */
7979                 *insn_idx += insn->off;
7980                 return 0;
7981         } else if (pred == 0) {
7982                 /* only follow fall-through branch, since
7983                  * that's where the program will go
7984                  */
7985                 return 0;
7986         }
7987 
7988         other_branch = push_stack(env, *insn_idx + insn->off + 1, *insn_idx,
7989                                   false);
7990         if (!other_branch)
7991                 return -EFAULT;
7992         other_branch_regs = other_branch->frame[other_branch->curframe]->regs;
7993 
7994         /* detect if we are comparing against a constant value so we can adjust
7995          * our min/max values for our dst register.
7996          * this is only legit if both are scalars (or pointers to the same
7997          * object, I suppose, but we don't support that right now), because
7998          * otherwise the different base pointers mean the offsets aren't
7999          * comparable.
8000          */
8001         if (BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_X) {
8002                 struct bpf_reg_state *src_reg = &regs[insn->src_reg];
8003 
8004                 if (dst_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE &&
8005                     src_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE) {
8006                         if (tnum_is_const(src_reg->var_off) ||
8007                             (is_jmp32 &&
8008                              tnum_is_const(tnum_subreg(src_reg->var_off))))
8009                                 reg_set_min_max(&other_branch_regs[insn->dst_reg],
8010                                                 dst_reg,
8011                                                 src_reg->var_off.value,
8012                                                 tnum_subreg(src_reg->var_off).value,
8013                                                 opcode, is_jmp32);
8014                         else if (tnum_is_const(dst_reg->var_off) ||
8015                                  (is_jmp32 &&
8016                                   tnum_is_const(tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off))))
8017                                 reg_set_min_max_inv(&other_branch_regs[insn->src_reg],
8018                                                     src_reg,
8019                                                     dst_reg->var_off.value,
8020                                                     tnum_subreg(dst_reg->var_off).value,
8021                                                     opcode, is_jmp32);
8022                         else if (!is_jmp32 &&
8023                                  (opcode == BPF_JEQ || opcode == BPF_JNE))
8024                                 /* Comparing for equality, we can combine knowledge */
8025                                 reg_combine_min_max(&other_branch_regs[insn->src_reg],
8026                                                     &other_branch_regs[insn->dst_reg],
8027                                                     src_reg, dst_reg, opcode);
8028                         if (src_reg->id &&
8029                             !WARN_ON_ONCE(src_reg->id != other_branch_regs[insn->src_reg].id)) {
8030                                 find_equal_scalars(this_branch, src_reg);
8031                                 find_equal_scalars(other_branch, &other_branch_regs[insn->src_reg]);
8032                         }
8033 
8034                 }
8035         } else if (dst_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE) {
8036                 reg_set_min_max(&other_branch_regs[insn->dst_reg],
8037                                         dst_reg, insn->imm, (u32)insn->imm,
8038                                         opcode, is_jmp32);
8039         }
8040 
8041         if (dst_reg->type == SCALAR_VALUE && dst_reg->id &&
8042             !WARN_ON_ONCE(dst_reg->id != other_branch_regs[insn->dst_reg].id)) {
8043                 find_equal_scalars(this_branch, dst_reg);
8044                 find_equal_scalars(other_branch, &other_branch_regs[insn->dst_reg]);
8045         }
8046 
8047         /* detect if R == 0 where R is returned from bpf_map_lookup_elem().
8048          * NOTE: these optimizations below are related with pointer comparison
8049          *       which will never be JMP32.
8050          */
8051         if (!is_jmp32 && BPF_SRC(insn->code) == BPF_K &&
8052             insn->imm == 0 && (opcode == BPF_JEQ || opcode == BPF_JNE) &&
8053             reg_type_may_be_null(dst_reg->type)) {
8054                 /* Mark all identical registers in each branch as either
8055                  * safe or unknown depending R == 0 or R != 0 conditional.
8056                  */
8057                 mark_ptr_or_null_regs(this_branch, insn->dst_reg,
8058                                       opcode == BPF_JNE);
8059                 mark_ptr_or_null_regs(other_branch, insn->dst_reg,
8060                                       opcode == BPF_JEQ);
8061         } else if (!try_match_pkt_pointers(insn, dst_reg, &regs[insn->src_reg],
8062                                            this_branch, other_branch) &&
8063                    is_pointer_value(env, insn->dst_reg)) {
8064                 verbose(env, "R%d pointer comparison prohibited\n",
8065                         insn->dst_reg);
8066                 return -EACCES;
8067         }
8068         if (env->log.level & BPF_LOG_LEVEL)
8069                 print_verifier_state(env, this_branch->frame[this_branch->curframe]);
8070         return 0;
8071 }
8072 
8073 /* verify BPF_LD_IMM64 instruction */
8074 static int check_ld_imm(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, struct bpf_insn *insn)
8075 {
8076         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux = cur_aux(env);
8077         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
8078         struct bpf_reg_state *dst_reg;
8079         struct bpf_map *map;
8080         int err;
8081 
8082         if (BPF_SIZE(insn->code) != BPF_DW) {
8083                 verbose(env, "invalid BPF_LD_IMM insn\n");
8084                 return -EINVAL;
8085         }
8086         if (insn->off != 0) {
8087                 verbose(env, "BPF_LD_IMM64 uses reserved fields\n");
8088                 return -EINVAL;
8089         }
8090 
8091         err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->dst_reg, DST_OP);
8092         if (err)
8093                 return err;
8094 
8095         dst_reg = &regs[insn->dst_reg];
8096         if (insn->src_reg == 0) {
8097                 u64 imm = ((u64)(insn + 1)->imm << 32) | (u32)insn->imm;
8098 
8099                 dst_reg->type = SCALAR_VALUE;
8100                 __mark_reg_known(&regs[insn->dst_reg], imm);
8101                 return 0;
8102         }
8103 
8104         if (insn->src_reg == BPF_PSEUDO_BTF_ID) {
8105                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
8106 
8107                 dst_reg->type = aux->btf_var.reg_type;
8108                 switch (dst_reg->type) {
8109                 case PTR_TO_MEM:
8110                         dst_reg->mem_size = aux->btf_var.mem_size;
8111                         break;
8112                 case PTR_TO_BTF_ID:
8113                 case PTR_TO_PERCPU_BTF_ID:
8114                         dst_reg->btf_id = aux->btf_var.btf_id;
8115                         break;
8116                 default:
8117                         verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
8118                         return -EFAULT;
8119                 }
8120                 return 0;
8121         }
8122 
8123         map = env->used_maps[aux->map_index];
8124         mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, insn->dst_reg);
8125         dst_reg->map_ptr = map;
8126 
8127         if (insn->src_reg == BPF_PSEUDO_MAP_VALUE) {
8128                 dst_reg->type = PTR_TO_MAP_VALUE;
8129                 dst_reg->off = aux->map_off;
8130                 if (map_value_has_spin_lock(map))
8131                         dst_reg->id = ++env->id_gen;
8132         } else if (insn->src_reg == BPF_PSEUDO_MAP_FD) {
8133                 dst_reg->type = CONST_PTR_TO_MAP;
8134         } else {
8135                 verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
8136                 return -EINVAL;
8137         }
8138 
8139         return 0;
8140 }
8141 
8142 static bool may_access_skb(enum bpf_prog_type type)
8143 {
8144         switch (type) {
8145         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SOCKET_FILTER:
8146         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SCHED_CLS:
8147         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SCHED_ACT:
8148                 return true;
8149         default:
8150                 return false;
8151         }
8152 }
8153 
8154 /* verify safety of LD_ABS|LD_IND instructions:
8155  * - they can only appear in the programs where ctx == skb
8156  * - since they are wrappers of function calls, they scratch R1-R5 registers,
8157  *   preserve R6-R9, and store return value into R0
8158  *
8159  * Implicit input:
8160  *   ctx == skb == R6 == CTX
8161  *
8162  * Explicit input:
8163  *   SRC == any register
8164  *   IMM == 32-bit immediate
8165  *
8166  * Output:
8167  *   R0 - 8/16/32-bit skb data converted to cpu endianness
8168  */
8169 static int check_ld_abs(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, struct bpf_insn *insn)
8170 {
8171         struct bpf_reg_state *regs = cur_regs(env);
8172         static const int ctx_reg = BPF_REG_6;
8173         u8 mode = BPF_MODE(insn->code);
8174         int i, err;
8175 
8176         if (!may_access_skb(resolve_prog_type(env->prog))) {
8177                 verbose(env, "BPF_LD_[ABS|IND] instructions not allowed for this program type\n");
8178                 return -EINVAL;
8179         }
8180 
8181         if (!env->ops->gen_ld_abs) {
8182                 verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
8183                 return -EINVAL;
8184         }
8185 
8186         if (insn->dst_reg != BPF_REG_0 || insn->off != 0 ||
8187             BPF_SIZE(insn->code) == BPF_DW ||
8188             (mode == BPF_ABS && insn->src_reg != BPF_REG_0)) {
8189                 verbose(env, "BPF_LD_[ABS|IND] uses reserved fields\n");
8190                 return -EINVAL;
8191         }
8192 
8193         /* check whether implicit source operand (register R6) is readable */
8194         err = check_reg_arg(env, ctx_reg, SRC_OP);
8195         if (err)
8196                 return err;
8197 
8198         /* Disallow usage of BPF_LD_[ABS|IND] with reference tracking, as
8199          * gen_ld_abs() may terminate the program at runtime, leading to
8200          * reference leak.
8201          */
8202         err = check_reference_leak(env);
8203         if (err) {
8204                 verbose(env, "BPF_LD_[ABS|IND] cannot be mixed with socket references\n");
8205                 return err;
8206         }
8207 
8208         if (env->cur_state->active_spin_lock) {
8209                 verbose(env, "BPF_LD_[ABS|IND] cannot be used inside bpf_spin_lock-ed region\n");
8210                 return -EINVAL;
8211         }
8212 
8213         if (regs[ctx_reg].type != PTR_TO_CTX) {
8214                 verbose(env,
8215                         "at the time of BPF_LD_ABS|IND R6 != pointer to skb\n");
8216                 return -EINVAL;
8217         }
8218 
8219         if (mode == BPF_IND) {
8220                 /* check explicit source operand */
8221                 err = check_reg_arg(env, insn->src_reg, SRC_OP);
8222                 if (err)
8223                         return err;
8224         }
8225 
8226         err = check_ctx_reg(env, &regs[ctx_reg], ctx_reg);
8227         if (err < 0)
8228                 return err;
8229 
8230         /* reset caller saved regs to unreadable */
8231         for (i = 0; i < CALLER_SAVED_REGS; i++) {
8232                 mark_reg_not_init(env, regs, caller_saved[i]);
8233                 check_reg_arg(env, caller_saved[i], DST_OP_NO_MARK);
8234         }
8235 
8236         /* mark destination R0 register as readable, since it contains
8237          * the value fetched from the packet.
8238          * Already marked as written above.
8239          */
8240         mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, BPF_REG_0);
8241         /* ld_abs load up to 32-bit skb data. */
8242         regs[BPF_REG_0].subreg_def = env->insn_idx + 1;
8243         return 0;
8244 }
8245 
8246 static int check_return_code(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
8247 {
8248         struct tnum enforce_attach_type_range = tnum_unknown;
8249         const struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog;
8250         struct bpf_reg_state *reg;
8251         struct tnum range = tnum_range(0, 1);
8252         enum bpf_prog_type prog_type = resolve_prog_type(env->prog);
8253         int err;
8254         const bool is_subprog = env->cur_state->frame[0]->subprogno;
8255 
8256         /* LSM and struct_ops func-ptr's return type could be "void" */
8257         if (!is_subprog &&
8258             (prog_type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_STRUCT_OPS ||
8259              prog_type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_LSM) &&
8260             !prog->aux->attach_func_proto->type)
8261                 return 0;
8262 
8263         /* eBPF calling convetion is such that R0 is used
8264          * to return the value from eBPF program.
8265          * Make sure that it's readable at this time
8266          * of bpf_exit, which means that program wrote
8267          * something into it earlier
8268          */
8269         err = check_reg_arg(env, BPF_REG_0, SRC_OP);
8270         if (err)
8271                 return err;
8272 
8273         if (is_pointer_value(env, BPF_REG_0)) {
8274                 verbose(env, "R0 leaks addr as return value\n");
8275                 return -EACCES;
8276         }
8277 
8278         reg = cur_regs(env) + BPF_REG_0;
8279         if (is_subprog) {
8280                 if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
8281                         verbose(env, "At subprogram exit the register R0 is not a scalar value (%s)\n",
8282                                 reg_type_str[reg->type]);
8283                         return -EINVAL;
8284                 }
8285                 return 0;
8286         }
8287 
8288         switch (prog_type) {
8289         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SOCK_ADDR:
8290                 if (env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_UDP4_RECVMSG ||
8291                     env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_UDP6_RECVMSG ||
8292                     env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_INET4_GETPEERNAME ||
8293                     env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_INET6_GETPEERNAME ||
8294                     env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_INET4_GETSOCKNAME ||
8295                     env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_INET6_GETSOCKNAME)
8296                         range = tnum_range(1, 1);
8297                 break;
8298         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SKB:
8299                 if (env->prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_CGROUP_INET_EGRESS) {
8300                         range = tnum_range(0, 3);
8301                         enforce_attach_type_range = tnum_range(2, 3);
8302                 }
8303                 break;
8304         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SOCK:
8305         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SOCK_OPS:
8306         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_DEVICE:
8307         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SYSCTL:
8308         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_CGROUP_SOCKOPT:
8309                 break;
8310         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_RAW_TRACEPOINT:
8311                 if (!env->prog->aux->attach_btf_id)
8312                         return 0;
8313                 range = tnum_const(0);
8314                 break;
8315         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_TRACING:
8316                 switch (env->prog->expected_attach_type) {
8317                 case BPF_TRACE_FENTRY:
8318                 case BPF_TRACE_FEXIT:
8319                         range = tnum_const(0);
8320                         break;
8321                 case BPF_TRACE_RAW_TP:
8322                 case BPF_MODIFY_RETURN:
8323                         return 0;
8324                 case BPF_TRACE_ITER:
8325                         break;
8326                 default:
8327                         return -ENOTSUPP;
8328                 }
8329                 break;
8330         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_SK_LOOKUP:
8331                 range = tnum_range(SK_DROP, SK_PASS);
8332                 break;
8333         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT:
8334                 /* freplace program can return anything as its return value
8335                  * depends on the to-be-replaced kernel func or bpf program.
8336                  */
8337         default:
8338                 return 0;
8339         }
8340 
8341         if (reg->type != SCALAR_VALUE) {
8342                 verbose(env, "At program exit the register R0 is not a known value (%s)\n",
8343                         reg_type_str[reg->type]);
8344                 return -EINVAL;
8345         }
8346 
8347         if (!tnum_in(range, reg->var_off)) {
8348                 char tn_buf[48];
8349 
8350                 verbose(env, "At program exit the register R0 ");
8351                 if (!tnum_is_unknown(reg->var_off)) {
8352                         tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), reg->var_off);
8353                         verbose(env, "has value %s", tn_buf);
8354                 } else {
8355                         verbose(env, "has unknown scalar value");
8356                 }
8357                 tnum_strn(tn_buf, sizeof(tn_buf), range);
8358                 verbose(env, " should have been in %s\n", tn_buf);
8359                 return -EINVAL;
8360         }
8361 
8362         if (!tnum_is_unknown(enforce_attach_type_range) &&
8363             tnum_in(enforce_attach_type_range, reg->var_off))
8364                 env->prog->enforce_expected_attach_type = 1;
8365         return 0;
8366 }
8367 
8368 /* non-recursive DFS pseudo code
8369  * 1  procedure DFS-iterative(G,v):
8370  * 2      label v as discovered
8371  * 3      let S be a stack
8372  * 4      S.push(v)
8373  * 5      while S is not empty
8374  * 6            t <- S.pop()
8375  * 7            if t is what we're looking for:
8376  * 8                return t
8377  * 9            for all edges e in G.adjacentEdges(t) do
8378  * 10               if edge e is already labelled
8379  * 11                   continue with the next edge
8380  * 12               w <- G.adjacentVertex(t,e)
8381  * 13               if vertex w is not discovered and not explored
8382  * 14                   label e as tree-edge
8383  * 15                   label w as discovered
8384  * 16                   S.push(w)
8385  * 17                   continue at 5
8386  * 18               else if vertex w is discovered
8387  * 19                   label e as back-edge
8388  * 20               else
8389  * 21                   // vertex w is explored
8390  * 22                   label e as forward- or cross-edge
8391  * 23           label t as explored
8392  * 24           S.pop()
8393  *
8394  * convention:
8395  * 0x10 - discovered
8396  * 0x11 - discovered and fall-through edge labelled
8397  * 0x12 - discovered and fall-through and branch edges labelled
8398  * 0x20 - explored
8399  */
8400 
8401 enum {
8402         DISCOVERED = 0x10,
8403         EXPLORED = 0x20,
8404         FALLTHROUGH = 1,
8405         BRANCH = 2,
8406 };
8407 
8408 static u32 state_htab_size(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
8409 {
8410         return env->prog->len;
8411 }
8412 
8413 static struct bpf_verifier_state_list **explored_state(
8414                                         struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
8415                                         int idx)
8416 {
8417         struct bpf_verifier_state *cur = env->cur_state;
8418         struct bpf_func_state *state = cur->frame[cur->curframe];
8419 
8420         return &env->explored_states[(idx ^ state->callsite) % state_htab_size(env)];
8421 }
8422 
8423 static void init_explored_state(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int idx)
8424 {
8425         env->insn_aux_data[idx].prune_point = true;
8426 }
8427 
8428 /* t, w, e - match pseudo-code above:
8429  * t - index of current instruction
8430  * w - next instruction
8431  * e - edge
8432  */
8433 static int push_insn(int t, int w, int e, struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
8434                      bool loop_ok)
8435 {
8436         int *insn_stack = env->cfg.insn_stack;
8437         int *insn_state = env->cfg.insn_state;
8438 
8439         if (e == FALLTHROUGH && insn_state[t] >= (DISCOVERED | FALLTHROUGH))
8440                 return 0;
8441 
8442         if (e == BRANCH && insn_state[t] >= (DISCOVERED | BRANCH))
8443                 return 0;
8444 
8445         if (w < 0 || w >= env->prog->len) {
8446                 verbose_linfo(env, t, "%d: ", t);
8447                 verbose(env, "jump out of range from insn %d to %d\n", t, w);
8448                 return -EINVAL;
8449         }
8450 
8451         if (e == BRANCH)
8452                 /* mark branch target for state pruning */
8453                 init_explored_state(env, w);
8454 
8455         if (insn_state[w] == 0) {
8456                 /* tree-edge */
8457                 insn_state[t] = DISCOVERED | e;
8458                 insn_state[w] = DISCOVERED;
8459                 if (env->cfg.cur_stack >= env->prog->len)
8460                         return -E2BIG;
8461                 insn_stack[env->cfg.cur_stack++] = w;
8462                 return 1;
8463         } else if ((insn_state[w] & 0xF0) == DISCOVERED) {
8464                 if (loop_ok && env->bpf_capable)
8465                         return 0;
8466                 verbose_linfo(env, t, "%d: ", t);
8467                 verbose_linfo(env, w, "%d: ", w);
8468                 verbose(env, "back-edge from insn %d to %d\n", t, w);
8469                 return -EINVAL;
8470         } else if (insn_state[w] == EXPLORED) {
8471                 /* forward- or cross-edge */
8472                 insn_state[t] = DISCOVERED | e;
8473         } else {
8474                 verbose(env, "insn state internal bug\n");
8475                 return -EFAULT;
8476         }
8477         return 0;
8478 }
8479 
8480 /* non-recursive depth-first-search to detect loops in BPF program
8481  * loop == back-edge in directed graph
8482  */
8483 static int check_cfg(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
8484 {
8485         struct bpf_insn *insns = env->prog->insnsi;
8486         int insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
8487         int *insn_stack, *insn_state;
8488         int ret = 0;
8489         int i, t;
8490 
8491         insn_state = env->cfg.insn_state = kvcalloc(insn_cnt, sizeof(int), GFP_KERNEL);
8492         if (!insn_state)
8493                 return -ENOMEM;
8494 
8495         insn_stack = env->cfg.insn_stack = kvcalloc(insn_cnt, sizeof(int), GFP_KERNEL);
8496         if (!insn_stack) {
8497                 kvfree(insn_state);
8498                 return -ENOMEM;
8499         }
8500 
8501         insn_state[0] = DISCOVERED; /* mark 1st insn as discovered */
8502         insn_stack[0] = 0; /* 0 is the first instruction */
8503         env->cfg.cur_stack = 1;
8504 
8505 peek_stack:
8506         if (env->cfg.cur_stack == 0)
8507                 goto check_state;
8508         t = insn_stack[env->cfg.cur_stack - 1];
8509 
8510         if (BPF_CLASS(insns[t].code) == BPF_JMP ||
8511             BPF_CLASS(insns[t].code) == BPF_JMP32) {
8512                 u8 opcode = BPF_OP(insns[t].code);
8513 
8514                 if (opcode == BPF_EXIT) {
8515                         goto mark_explored;
8516                 } else if (opcode == BPF_CALL) {
8517                         ret = push_insn(t, t + 1, FALLTHROUGH, env, false);
8518                         if (ret == 1)
8519                                 goto peek_stack;
8520                         else if (ret < 0)
8521                                 goto err_free;
8522                         if (t + 1 < insn_cnt)
8523                                 init_explored_state(env, t + 1);
8524                         if (insns[t].src_reg == BPF_PSEUDO_CALL) {
8525                                 init_explored_state(env, t);
8526                                 ret = push_insn(t, t + insns[t].imm + 1, BRANCH,
8527                                                 env, false);
8528                                 if (ret == 1)
8529                                         goto peek_stack;
8530                                 else if (ret < 0)
8531                                         goto err_free;
8532                         }
8533                 } else if (opcode == BPF_JA) {
8534                         if (BPF_SRC(insns[t].code) != BPF_K) {
8535                                 ret = -EINVAL;
8536                                 goto err_free;
8537                         }
8538                         /* unconditional jump with single edge */
8539                         ret = push_insn(t, t + insns[t].off + 1,
8540                                         FALLTHROUGH, env, true);
8541                         if (ret == 1)
8542                                 goto peek_stack;
8543                         else if (ret < 0)
8544                                 goto err_free;
8545                         /* unconditional jmp is not a good pruning point,
8546                          * but it's marked, since backtracking needs
8547                          * to record jmp history in is_state_visited().
8548                          */
8549                         init_explored_state(env, t + insns[t].off + 1);
8550                         /* tell verifier to check for equivalent states
8551                          * after every call and jump
8552                          */
8553                         if (t + 1 < insn_cnt)
8554                                 init_explored_state(env, t + 1);
8555                 } else {
8556                         /* conditional jump with two edges */
8557                         init_explored_state(env, t);
8558                         ret = push_insn(t, t + 1, FALLTHROUGH, env, true);
8559                         if (ret == 1)
8560                                 goto peek_stack;
8561                         else if (ret < 0)
8562                                 goto err_free;
8563 
8564                         ret = push_insn(t, t + insns[t].off + 1, BRANCH, env, true);
8565                         if (ret == 1)
8566                                 goto peek_stack;
8567                         else if (ret < 0)
8568                                 goto err_free;
8569                 }
8570         } else {
8571                 /* all other non-branch instructions with single
8572                  * fall-through edge
8573                  */
8574                 ret = push_insn(t, t + 1, FALLTHROUGH, env, false);
8575                 if (ret == 1)
8576                         goto peek_stack;
8577                 else if (ret < 0)
8578                         goto err_free;
8579         }
8580 
8581 mark_explored:
8582         insn_state[t] = EXPLORED;
8583         if (env->cfg.cur_stack-- <= 0) {
8584                 verbose(env, "pop stack internal bug\n");
8585                 ret = -EFAULT;
8586                 goto err_free;
8587         }
8588         goto peek_stack;
8589 
8590 check_state:
8591         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++) {
8592                 if (insn_state[i] != EXPLORED) {
8593                         verbose(env, "unreachable insn %d\n", i);
8594                         ret = -EINVAL;
8595                         goto err_free;
8596                 }
8597         }
8598         ret = 0; /* cfg looks good */
8599 
8600 err_free:
8601         kvfree(insn_state);
8602         kvfree(insn_stack);
8603         env->cfg.insn_state = env->cfg.insn_stack = NULL;
8604         return ret;
8605 }
8606 
8607 static int check_abnormal_return(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
8608 {
8609         int i;
8610 
8611         for (i = 1; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
8612                 if (env->subprog_info[i].has_ld_abs) {
8613                         verbose(env, "LD_ABS is not allowed in subprogs without BTF\n");
8614                         return -EINVAL;
8615                 }
8616                 if (env->subprog_info[i].has_tail_call) {
8617                         verbose(env, "tail_call is not allowed in subprogs without BTF\n");
8618                         return -EINVAL;
8619                 }
8620         }
8621         return 0;
8622 }
8623 
8624 /* The minimum supported BTF func info size */
8625 #define MIN_BPF_FUNCINFO_SIZE   8
8626 #define MAX_FUNCINFO_REC_SIZE   252
8627 
8628 static int check_btf_func(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
8629                           const union bpf_attr *attr,
8630                           union bpf_attr __user *uattr)
8631 {
8632         const struct btf_type *type, *func_proto, *ret_type;
8633         u32 i, nfuncs, urec_size, min_size;
8634         u32 krec_size = sizeof(struct bpf_func_info);
8635         struct bpf_func_info *krecord;
8636         struct bpf_func_info_aux *info_aux = NULL;
8637         struct bpf_prog *prog;
8638         const struct btf *btf;
8639         void __user *urecord;
8640         u32 prev_offset = 0;
8641         bool scalar_return;
8642         int ret = -ENOMEM;
8643 
8644         nfuncs = attr->func_info_cnt;
8645         if (!nfuncs) {
8646                 if (check_abnormal_return(env))
8647                         return -EINVAL;
8648                 return 0;
8649         }
8650 
8651         if (nfuncs != env->subprog_cnt) {
8652                 verbose(env, "number of funcs in func_info doesn't match number of subprogs\n");
8653                 return -EINVAL;
8654         }
8655 
8656         urec_size = attr->func_info_rec_size;
8657         if (urec_size < MIN_BPF_FUNCINFO_SIZE ||
8658             urec_size > MAX_FUNCINFO_REC_SIZE ||
8659             urec_size % sizeof(u32)) {
8660                 verbose(env, "invalid func info rec size %u\n", urec_size);
8661                 return -EINVAL;
8662         }
8663 
8664         prog = env->prog;
8665         btf = prog->aux->btf;
8666 
8667         urecord = u64_to_user_ptr(attr->func_info);
8668         min_size = min_t(u32, krec_size, urec_size);
8669 
8670         krecord = kvcalloc(nfuncs, krec_size, GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NOWARN);
8671         if (!krecord)
8672                 return -ENOMEM;
8673         info_aux = kcalloc(nfuncs, sizeof(*info_aux), GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NOWARN);
8674         if (!info_aux)
8675                 goto err_free;
8676 
8677         for (i = 0; i < nfuncs; i++) {
8678                 ret = bpf_check_uarg_tail_zero(urecord, krec_size, urec_size);
8679                 if (ret) {
8680                         if (ret == -E2BIG) {
8681                                 verbose(env, "nonzero tailing record in func info");
8682                                 /* set the size kernel expects so loader can zero
8683                                  * out the rest of the record.
8684                                  */
8685                                 if (put_user(min_size, &uattr->func_info_rec_size))
8686                                         ret = -EFAULT;
8687                         }
8688                         goto err_free;
8689                 }
8690 
8691                 if (copy_from_user(&krecord[i], urecord, min_size)) {
8692                         ret = -EFAULT;
8693                         goto err_free;
8694                 }
8695 
8696                 /* check insn_off */
8697                 ret = -EINVAL;
8698                 if (i == 0) {
8699                         if (krecord[i].insn_off) {
8700                                 verbose(env,
8701                                         "nonzero insn_off %u for the first func info record",
8702                                         krecord[i].insn_off);
8703                                 goto err_free;
8704                         }
8705                 } else if (krecord[i].insn_off <= prev_offset) {
8706                         verbose(env,
8707                                 "same or smaller insn offset (%u) than previous func info record (%u)",
8708                                 krecord[i].insn_off, prev_offset);
8709                         goto err_free;
8710                 }
8711 
8712                 if (env->subprog_info[i].start != krecord[i].insn_off) {
8713                         verbose(env, "func_info BTF section doesn't match subprog layout in BPF program\n");
8714                         goto err_free;
8715                 }
8716 
8717                 /* check type_id */
8718                 type = btf_type_by_id(btf, krecord[i].type_id);
8719                 if (!type || !btf_type_is_func(type)) {
8720                         verbose(env, "invalid type id %d in func info",
8721                                 krecord[i].type_id);
8722                         goto err_free;
8723                 }
8724                 info_aux[i].linkage = BTF_INFO_VLEN(type->info);
8725 
8726                 func_proto = btf_type_by_id(btf, type->type);
8727                 if (unlikely(!func_proto || !btf_type_is_func_proto(func_proto)))
8728                         /* btf_func_check() already verified it during BTF load */
8729                         goto err_free;
8730                 ret_type = btf_type_skip_modifiers(btf, func_proto->type, NULL);
8731                 scalar_return =
8732                         btf_type_is_small_int(ret_type) || btf_type_is_enum(ret_type);
8733                 if (i && !scalar_return && env->subprog_info[i].has_ld_abs) {
8734                         verbose(env, "LD_ABS is only allowed in functions that return 'int'.\n");
8735                         goto err_free;
8736                 }
8737                 if (i && !scalar_return && env->subprog_info[i].has_tail_call) {
8738                         verbose(env, "tail_call is only allowed in functions that return 'int'.\n");
8739                         goto err_free;
8740                 }
8741 
8742                 prev_offset = krecord[i].insn_off;
8743                 urecord += urec_size;
8744         }
8745 
8746         prog->aux->func_info = krecord;
8747         prog->aux->func_info_cnt = nfuncs;
8748         prog->aux->func_info_aux = info_aux;
8749         return 0;
8750 
8751 err_free:
8752         kvfree(krecord);
8753         kfree(info_aux);
8754         return ret;
8755 }
8756 
8757 static void adjust_btf_func(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
8758 {
8759         struct bpf_prog_aux *aux = env->prog->aux;
8760         int i;
8761 
8762         if (!aux->func_info)
8763                 return;
8764 
8765         for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++)
8766                 aux->func_info[i].insn_off = env->subprog_info[i].start;
8767 }
8768 
8769 #define MIN_BPF_LINEINFO_SIZE   (offsetof(struct bpf_line_info, line_col) + \
8770                 sizeof(((struct bpf_line_info *)(0))->line_col))
8771 #define MAX_LINEINFO_REC_SIZE   MAX_FUNCINFO_REC_SIZE
8772 
8773 static int check_btf_line(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
8774                           const union bpf_attr *attr,
8775                           union bpf_attr __user *uattr)
8776 {
8777         u32 i, s, nr_linfo, ncopy, expected_size, rec_size, prev_offset = 0;
8778         struct bpf_subprog_info *sub;
8779         struct bpf_line_info *linfo;
8780         struct bpf_prog *prog;
8781         const struct btf *btf;
8782         void __user *ulinfo;
8783         int err;
8784 
8785         nr_linfo = attr->line_info_cnt;
8786         if (!nr_linfo)
8787                 return 0;
8788 
8789         rec_size = attr->line_info_rec_size;
8790         if (rec_size < MIN_BPF_LINEINFO_SIZE ||
8791             rec_size > MAX_LINEINFO_REC_SIZE ||
8792             rec_size & (sizeof(u32) - 1))
8793                 return -EINVAL;
8794 
8795         /* Need to zero it in case the userspace may
8796          * pass in a smaller bpf_line_info object.
8797          */
8798         linfo = kvcalloc(nr_linfo, sizeof(struct bpf_line_info),
8799                          GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NOWARN);
8800         if (!linfo)
8801                 return -ENOMEM;
8802 
8803         prog = env->prog;
8804         btf = prog->aux->btf;
8805 
8806         s = 0;
8807         sub = env->subprog_info;
8808         ulinfo = u64_to_user_ptr(attr->line_info);
8809         expected_size = sizeof(struct bpf_line_info);
8810         ncopy = min_t(u32, expected_size, rec_size);
8811         for (i = 0; i < nr_linfo; i++) {
8812                 err = bpf_check_uarg_tail_zero(ulinfo, expected_size, rec_size);
8813                 if (err) {
8814                         if (err == -E2BIG) {
8815                                 verbose(env, "nonzero tailing record in line_info");
8816                                 if (put_user(expected_size,
8817                                              &uattr->line_info_rec_size))
8818                                         err = -EFAULT;
8819                         }
8820                         goto err_free;
8821                 }
8822 
8823                 if (copy_from_user(&linfo[i], ulinfo, ncopy)) {
8824                         err = -EFAULT;
8825                         goto err_free;
8826                 }
8827 
8828                 /*
8829                  * Check insn_off to ensure
8830                  * 1) strictly increasing AND
8831                  * 2) bounded by prog->len
8832                  *
8833                  * The linfo[0].insn_off == 0 check logically falls into
8834                  * the later "missing bpf_line_info for func..." case
8835                  * because the first linfo[0].insn_off must be the
8836                  * first sub also and the first sub must have
8837                  * subprog_info[0].start == 0.
8838                  */
8839                 if ((i && linfo[i].insn_off <= prev_offset) ||
8840                     linfo[i].insn_off >= prog->len) {
8841                         verbose(env, "Invalid line_info[%u].insn_off:%u (prev_offset:%u prog->len:%u)\n",
8842                                 i, linfo[i].insn_off, prev_offset,
8843                                 prog->len);
8844                         err = -EINVAL;
8845                         goto err_free;
8846                 }
8847 
8848                 if (!prog->insnsi[linfo[i].insn_off].code) {
8849                         verbose(env,
8850                                 "Invalid insn code at line_info[%u].insn_off\n",
8851                                 i);
8852                         err = -EINVAL;
8853                         goto err_free;
8854                 }
8855 
8856                 if (!btf_name_by_offset(btf, linfo[i].line_off) ||
8857                     !btf_name_by_offset(btf, linfo[i].file_name_off)) {
8858                         verbose(env, "Invalid line_info[%u].line_off or .file_name_off\n", i);
8859                         err = -EINVAL;
8860                         goto err_free;
8861                 }
8862 
8863                 if (s != env->subprog_cnt) {
8864                         if (linfo[i].insn_off == sub[s].start) {
8865                                 sub[s].linfo_idx = i;
8866                                 s++;
8867                         } else if (sub[s].start < linfo[i].insn_off) {
8868                                 verbose(env, "missing bpf_line_info for func#%u\n", s);
8869                                 err = -EINVAL;
8870                                 goto err_free;
8871                         }
8872                 }
8873 
8874                 prev_offset = linfo[i].insn_off;
8875                 ulinfo += rec_size;
8876         }
8877
