10555                         /* func_info->insn_off is set after all code rewrites,
10556                          * in adjust_btf_func() - no need to adjust
10557                          */
10558                 }
10559         } else {
10560                 /* convert i from "first prog to remove" to "first to adjust" */
10561                 if (env->subprog_info[i].start == off)
10562                         i++;
10563         }
10564 
10565         /* update fake 'exit' subprog as well */
10566         for (; i <= env->subprog_cnt; i++)
10567                 env->subprog_info[i].start -= cnt;
10568 
10569         return 0;
10570 }
10571 
10572 static int bpf_adj_linfo_after_remove(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, u32 off,
10573                                       u32 cnt)
10574 {
10575         struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog;
10576         u32 i, l_off, l_cnt, nr_linfo;
10577         struct bpf_line_info *linfo;
10578 
10579         nr_linfo = prog->aux->nr_linfo;
10580         if (!nr_linfo)
10581                 return 0;
10582 
10583         linfo = prog->aux->linfo;
10584 
10585         /* find first line info to remove, count lines to be removed */
10586         for (i = 0; i < nr_linfo; i++)
10587                 if (linfo[i].insn_off >= off)
10588                         break;
10589 
10590         l_off = i;
10591         l_cnt = 0;
10592         for (; i < nr_linfo; i++)
10593                 if (linfo[i].insn_off < off + cnt)
10594                         l_cnt++;
10595                 else
10596                         break;
10597 
10598         /* First live insn doesn't match first live linfo, it needs to "inherit"
10599          * last removed linfo.  prog is already modified, so prog->len == off
10600          * means no live instructions after (tail of the program was removed).
10601          */
10602         if (prog->len != off && l_cnt &&
10603             (i == nr_linfo || linfo[i].insn_off != off + cnt)) {
10604                 l_cnt--;
10605                 linfo[--i].insn_off = off + cnt;
10606         }
10607 
10608         /* remove the line info which refer to the removed instructions */
10609         if (l_cnt) {
10610                 memmove(linfo + l_off, linfo + i,
10611                         sizeof(*linfo) * (nr_linfo - i));
10612 
10613                 prog->aux->nr_linfo -= l_cnt;
10614                 nr_linfo = prog->aux->nr_linfo;
10615         }
10616 
10617         /* pull all linfo[i].insn_off >= off + cnt in by cnt */
10618         for (i = l_off; i < nr_linfo; i++)
10619                 linfo[i].insn_off -= cnt;
10620 
10621         /* fix up all subprogs (incl. 'exit') which start >= off */
10622         for (i = 0; i <= env->subprog_cnt; i++)
10623                 if (env->subprog_info[i].linfo_idx > l_off) {
10624                         /* program may have started in the removed region but
10625                          * may not be fully removed
10626                          */
10627                         if (env->subprog_info[i].linfo_idx >= l_off + l_cnt)
10628                                 env->subprog_info[i].linfo_idx -= l_cnt;
10629                         else
10630                                 env->subprog_info[i].linfo_idx = l_off;
10631                 }
10632 
10633         return 0;
10634 }
10635 
10636 static int verifier_remove_insns(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, u32 off, u32 cnt)
10637 {
10638         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux_data = env->insn_aux_data;
10639         unsigned int orig_prog_len = env->prog->len;
10640         int err;
10641 
10642         if (bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux))
10643                 bpf_prog_offload_remove_insns(env, off, cnt);
10644 
10645         err = bpf_remove_insns(env->prog, off, cnt);
10646         if (err)
10647                 return err;
10648 
10649         err = adjust_subprog_starts_after_remove(env, off, cnt);
10650         if (err)
10651                 return err;
10652 
10653         err = bpf_adj_linfo_after_remove(env, off, cnt);
10654         if (err)
10655                 return err;
10656 
10657         memmove(aux_data + off, aux_data + off + cnt,
10658                 sizeof(*aux_data) * (orig_prog_len - off - cnt));
10659 
10660         return 0;
10661 }
10662 
10663 /* The verifier does more data flow analysis than llvm and will not
10664  * explore branches that are dead at run time. Malicious programs can
10665  * have dead code too. Therefore replace all dead at-run-time code
10666  * with 'ja -1'.
10667  *
10668  * Just nops are not optimal, e.g. if they would sit at the end of the
10669  * program and through another bug we would manage to jump there, then
10670  * we'd execute beyond program memory otherwise. Returning exception
10671  * code also wouldn't work since we can have subprogs where the dead
10672  * code could be located.
10673  */
10674 static void sanitize_dead_code(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
10675 {
10676         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux_data = env->insn_aux_data;
10677         struct bpf_insn trap = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JA, 0, 0, -1);
10678         struct bpf_insn *insn = env->prog->insnsi;
10679         const int insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
10680         int i;
10681 
10682         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++) {
10683                 if (aux_data[i].seen)
10684                         continue;
10685                 memcpy(insn + i, &trap, sizeof(trap));
10686         }
10687 }
10688 
10689 static bool insn_is_cond_jump(u8 code)
10690 {
10691         u8 op;
10692 
10693         if (BPF_CLASS(code) == BPF_JMP32)
10694                 return true;
10695 
10696         if (BPF_CLASS(code) != BPF_JMP)
10697                 return false;
10698 
10699         op = BPF_OP(code);
10700         return op != BPF_JA && op != BPF_EXIT && op != BPF_CALL;
10701 }
10702 
10703 static void opt_hard_wire_dead_code_branches(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
10704 {
10705         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux_data = env->insn_aux_data;
10706         struct bpf_insn ja = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JA, 0, 0, 0);
10707         struct bpf_insn *insn = env->prog->insnsi;
10708         const int insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
10709         int i;
10710 
10711         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++, insn++) {
10712                 if (!insn_is_cond_jump(insn->code))
10713                         continue;
10714 
10715                 if (!aux_data[i + 1].seen)
10716                         ja.off = insn->off;
10717                 else if (!aux_data[i + 1 + insn->off].seen)
10718                         ja.off = 0;
10719                 else
10720                         continue;
10721 
10722                 if (bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux))
10723                         bpf_prog_offload_replace_insn(env, i, &ja);
10724 
10725                 memcpy(insn, &ja, sizeof(ja));
10726         }
10727 }
10728 
10729 static int opt_remove_dead_code(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
10730 {
10731         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux_data = env->insn_aux_data;
10732         int insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
10733         int i, err;
10734 
10735         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++) {
10736                 int j;
10737 
10738                 j = 0;
10739                 while (i + j < insn_cnt && !aux_data[i + j].seen)
10740                         j++;
10741                 if (!j)
10742                         continue;
10743 
10744                 err = verifier_remove_insns(env, i, j);
10745                 if (err)
10746                         return err;
10747                 insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
10748         }
10749 
10750         return 0;
10751 }
10752 
10753 static int opt_remove_nops(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
10754 {
10755         const struct bpf_insn ja = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JA, 0, 0, 0);
10756         struct bpf_insn *insn = env->prog->insnsi;
10757         int insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
10758         int i, err;
10759 
10760         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++) {
10761                 if (memcmp(&insn[i], &ja, sizeof(ja)))
10762                         continue;
10763 
10764                 err = verifier_remove_insns(env, i, 1);
10765                 if (err)
10766                         return err;
10767                 insn_cnt--;
10768                 i--;
10769         }
10770 
10771         return 0;
10772 }
10773 
10774 static int opt_subreg_zext_lo32_rnd_hi32(struct bpf_verifier_env *env,
10775                                          const union bpf_attr *attr)
10776 {
10777         struct bpf_insn *patch, zext_patch[2], rnd_hi32_patch[4];
10778         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux = env->insn_aux_data;
10779         int i, patch_len, delta = 0, len = env->prog->len;
10780         struct bpf_insn *insns = env->prog->insnsi;
10781         struct bpf_prog *new_prog;
10782         bool rnd_hi32;
10783 
10784         rnd_hi32 = attr->prog_flags & BPF_F_TEST_RND_HI32;
10785         zext_patch[1] = BPF_ZEXT_REG(0);
10786         rnd_hi32_patch[1] = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_MOV, BPF_REG_AX, 0);
10787         rnd_hi32_patch[2] = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_LSH, BPF_REG_AX, 32);
10788         rnd_hi32_patch[3] = BPF_ALU64_REG(BPF_OR, 0, BPF_REG_AX);
10789         for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
10790                 int adj_idx = i + delta;
10791                 struct bpf_insn insn;
10792 
10793                 insn = insns[adj_idx];
10794                 if (!aux[adj_idx].zext_dst) {
10795                         u8 code, class;
10796                         u32 imm_rnd;
10797 
10798                         if (!rnd_hi32)
10799                                 continue;
10800 
10801                         code = insn.code;
10802                         class = BPF_CLASS(code);
10803                         if (insn_no_def(&insn))
10804                                 continue;
10805 
10806                         /* NOTE: arg "reg" (the fourth one) is only used for
10807                          *       BPF_STX which has been ruled out in above
10808                          *       check, it is safe to pass NULL here.
10809                          */
10810                         if (is_reg64(env, &insn, insn.dst_reg, NULL, DST_OP)) {
10811                                 if (class == BPF_LD &&
10812                                     BPF_MODE(code) == BPF_IMM)
10813                                         i++;
10814                                 continue;
10815                         }
10816 
10817                         /* ctx load could be transformed into wider load. */
10818                         if (class == BPF_LDX &&
10819                             aux[adj_idx].ptr_type == PTR_TO_CTX)
10820                                 continue;
10821 
10822                         imm_rnd = get_random_int();
10823                         rnd_hi32_patch[0] = insn;
10824                         rnd_hi32_patch[1].imm = imm_rnd;
10825                         rnd_hi32_patch[3].dst_reg = insn.dst_reg;
10826                         patch = rnd_hi32_patch;
10827                         patch_len = 4;
10828                         goto apply_patch_buffer;
10829                 }
10830 
10831                 if (!bpf_jit_needs_zext())
10832                         continue;
10833 
10834                 zext_patch[0] = insn;
10835                 zext_patch[1].dst_reg = insn.dst_reg;
10836                 zext_patch[1].src_reg = insn.dst_reg;
10837                 patch = zext_patch;
10838                 patch_len = 2;
10839 apply_patch_buffer:
10840                 new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, adj_idx, patch, patch_len);
10841                 if (!new_prog)
10842                         return -ENOMEM;
10843                 env->prog = new_prog;
10844                 insns = new_prog->insnsi;
10845                 aux = env->insn_aux_data;
10846                 delta += patch_len - 1;
10847         }
10848 
10849         return 0;
10850 }
10851 
10852 /* convert load instructions that access fields of a context type into a
10853  * sequence of instructions that access fields of the underlying structure:
10854  *     struct __sk_buff    -> struct sk_buff
10855  *     struct bpf_sock_ops -> struct sock
10856  */
10857 static int convert_ctx_accesses(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
10858 {
10859         const struct bpf_verifier_ops *ops = env->ops;
10860         int i, cnt, size, ctx_field_size, delta = 0;
10861         const int insn_cnt = env->prog->len;
10862         struct bpf_insn insn_buf[16], *insn;
10863         u32 target_size, size_default, off;
10864         struct bpf_prog *new_prog;
10865         enum bpf_access_type type;
10866         bool is_narrower_load;
10867 
10868         if (ops->gen_prologue || env->seen_direct_write) {
10869                 if (!ops->gen_prologue) {
10870                         verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
10871                         return -EINVAL;
10872                 }
10873                 cnt = ops->gen_prologue(insn_buf, env->seen_direct_write,
10874                                         env->prog);
10875                 if (cnt >= ARRAY_SIZE(insn_buf)) {
10876                         verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
10877                         return -EINVAL;
10878                 } else if (cnt) {
10879                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, 0, insn_buf, cnt);
10880                         if (!new_prog)
10881                                 return -ENOMEM;
10882 
10883                         env->prog = new_prog;
10884                         delta += cnt - 1;
10885                 }
10886         }
10887 
10888         if (bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux))
10889                 return 0;
10890 
10891         insn = env->prog->insnsi + delta;
10892 
10893         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++, insn++) {
10894                 bpf_convert_ctx_access_t convert_ctx_access;
10895 
10896                 if (insn->code == (BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM | BPF_B) ||
10897                     insn->code == (BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM | BPF_H) ||
10898                     insn->code == (BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM | BPF_W) ||
10899                     insn->code == (BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM | BPF_DW))
10900                         type = BPF_READ;
10901                 else if (insn->code == (BPF_STX | BPF_MEM | BPF_B) ||
10902                          insn->code == (BPF_STX | BPF_MEM | BPF_H) ||
10903                          insn->code == (BPF_STX | BPF_MEM | BPF_W) ||
10904                          insn->code == (BPF_STX | BPF_MEM | BPF_DW))
10905                         type = BPF_WRITE;
10906                 else
10907                         continue;
10908 
10909                 if (type == BPF_WRITE &&
10910                     env->insn_aux_data[i + delta].sanitize_stack_off) {
10911                         struct bpf_insn patch[] = {
10912                                 /* Sanitize suspicious stack slot with zero.
10913                                  * There are no memory dependencies for this store,
10914                                  * since it's only using frame pointer and immediate
10915                                  * constant of zero
10916                                  */
10917                                 BPF_ST_MEM(BPF_DW, BPF_REG_FP,
10918                                            env->insn_aux_data[i + delta].sanitize_stack_off,
10919                                            0),
10920                                 /* the original STX instruction will immediately
10921                                  * overwrite the same stack slot with appropriate value
10922                                  */
10923                                 *insn,
10924                         };
10925 
10926                         cnt = ARRAY_SIZE(patch);
10927                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, patch, cnt);
10928                         if (!new_prog)
10929                                 return -ENOMEM;
10930 
10931                         delta    += cnt - 1;
10932                         env->prog = new_prog;
10933                         insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
10934                         continue;
10935                 }
10936 
10937                 switch (env->insn_aux_data[i + delta].ptr_type) {
10938                 case PTR_TO_CTX:
10939                         if (!ops->convert_ctx_access)
10940                                 continue;
10941                         convert_ctx_access = ops->convert_ctx_access;
10942                         break;
10943                 case PTR_TO_SOCKET:
10944                 case PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON:
10945                         convert_ctx_access = bpf_sock_convert_ctx_access;
10946                         break;
10947                 case PTR_TO_TCP_SOCK:
10948                         convert_ctx_access = bpf_tcp_sock_convert_ctx_access;
10949                         break;
10950                 case PTR_TO_XDP_SOCK:
10951                         convert_ctx_access = bpf_xdp_sock_convert_ctx_access;
10952                         break;
10953                 case PTR_TO_BTF_ID:
10954                         if (type == BPF_READ) {
10955                                 insn->code = BPF_LDX | BPF_PROBE_MEM |
10956                                         BPF_SIZE((insn)->code);
10957                                 env->prog->aux->num_exentries++;
10958                         } else if (resolve_prog_type(env->prog) != BPF_PROG_TYPE_STRUCT_OPS) {
10959                                 verbose(env, "Writes through BTF pointers are not allowed\n");
10960                                 return -EINVAL;
10961                         }
10962                         continue;
10963                 default:
10964                         continue;
10965                 }
10966 
10967                 ctx_field_size = env->insn_aux_data[i + delta].ctx_field_size;
10968                 size = BPF_LDST_BYTES(insn);
10969 
10970                 /* If the read access is a narrower load of the field,
10971                  * convert to a 4/8-byte load, to minimum program type specific
10972                  * convert_ctx_access changes. If conversion is successful,
10973                  * we will apply proper mask to the result.
10974                  */
10975                 is_narrower_load = size < ctx_field_size;
10976                 size_default = bpf_ctx_off_adjust_machine(ctx_field_size);
10977                 off = insn->off;
10978                 if (is_narrower_load) {
10979                         u8 size_code;
10980 
10981                         if (type == BPF_WRITE) {
10982                                 verbose(env, "bpf verifier narrow ctx access misconfigured\n");
10983                                 return -EINVAL;
10984                         }
10985 
10986                         size_code = BPF_H;
10987                         if (ctx_field_size == 4)
10988                                 size_code = BPF_W;
10989                         else if (ctx_field_size == 8)
10990                                 size_code = BPF_DW;
10991 
10992                         insn->off = off & ~(size_default - 1);
10993                         insn->code = BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM | size_code;
10994                 }
10995 
10996                 target_size = 0;
10997                 cnt = convert_ctx_access(type, insn, insn_buf, env->prog,
10998                                          &target_size);
10999                 if (cnt == 0 || cnt >= ARRAY_SIZE(insn_buf) ||
11000                     (ctx_field_size && !target_size)) {
11001                         verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
11002                         return -EINVAL;
11003                 }
11004 
11005                 if (is_narrower_load && size < target_size) {
11006                         u8 shift = bpf_ctx_narrow_access_offset(
11007                                 off, size, size_default) * 8;
11008                         if (ctx_field_size <= 4) {
11009                                 if (shift)
11010                                         insn_buf[cnt++] = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_RSH,
11011                                                                         insn->dst_reg,
11012                                                                         shift);
11013                                 insn_buf[cnt++] = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_AND, insn->dst_reg,
11014                                                                 (1 << size * 8) - 1);
11015                         } else {
11016                                 if (shift)
11017                                         insn_buf[cnt++] = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_RSH,
11018                                                                         insn->dst_reg,
11019                                                                         shift);
11020                                 insn_buf[cnt++] = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_AND, insn->dst_reg,
11021                                                                 (1ULL << size * 8) - 1);
11022                         }
11023                 }
11024 
11025                 new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, insn_buf, cnt);
11026                 if (!new_prog)
11027                         return -ENOMEM;
11028 
11029                 delta += cnt - 1;
11030 
11031                 /* keep walking new program and skip insns we just inserted */
11032                 env->prog = new_prog;
11033                 insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11034         }
11035 
11036         return 0;
11037 }
11038 
11039 static int jit_subprogs(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11040 {
11041         struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog, **func, *tmp;
11042         int i, j, subprog_start, subprog_end = 0, len, subprog;
11043         struct bpf_map *map_ptr;
11044         struct bpf_insn *insn;
11045         void *old_bpf_func;
11046         int err, num_exentries;
11047 
11048         if (env->subprog_cnt <= 1)
11049                 return 0;
11050 
11051         for (i = 0, insn = prog->insnsi; i < prog->len; i++, insn++) {
11052                 if (insn->code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL) ||
11053                     insn->src_reg != BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
11054                         continue;
11055                 /* Upon error here we cannot fall back to interpreter but
11056                  * need a hard reject of the program. Thus -EFAULT is
11057                  * propagated in any case.
11058                  */
11059                 subprog = find_subprog(env, i + insn->imm + 1);
11060                 if (subprog < 0) {
11061                         WARN_ONCE(1, "verifier bug. No program starts at insn %d\n",
11062                                   i + insn->imm + 1);
11063                         return -EFAULT;
11064                 }
11065                 /* temporarily remember subprog id inside insn instead of
11066                  * aux_data, since next loop will split up all insns into funcs
11067                  */
11068                 insn->off = subprog;
11069                 /* remember original imm in case JIT fails and fallback
11070                  * to interpreter will be needed
11071                  */
11072                 env->insn_aux_data[i].call_imm = insn->imm;
11073                 /* point imm to __bpf_call_base+1 from JITs point of view */
11074                 insn->imm = 1;
11075         }
11076 
11077         err = bpf_prog_alloc_jited_linfo(prog);
11078         if (err)
11079                 goto out_undo_insn;
11080 
11081         err = -ENOMEM;
11082         func = kcalloc(env->subprog_cnt, sizeof(prog), GFP_KERNEL);
11083         if (!func)
11084                 goto out_undo_insn;
11085 
11086         for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11087                 subprog_start = subprog_end;
11088                 subprog_end = env->subprog_info[i + 1].start;
11089 
11090                 len = subprog_end - subprog_start;
11091                 /* BPF_PROG_RUN doesn't call subprogs directly,
11092                  * hence main prog stats include the runtime of subprogs.
11093                  * subprogs don't have IDs and not reachable via prog_get_next_id
11094                  * func[i]->aux->stats will never be accessed and stays NULL
11095                  */
11096                 func[i] = bpf_prog_alloc_no_stats(bpf_prog_size(len), GFP_USER);
11097                 if (!func[i])
11098                         goto out_free;
11099                 memcpy(func[i]->insnsi, &prog->insnsi[subprog_start],
11100                        len * sizeof(struct bpf_insn));
11101                 func[i]->type = prog->type;
11102                 func[i]->len = len;
11103                 if (bpf_prog_calc_tag(func[i]))
11104                         goto out_free;
11105                 func[i]->is_func = 1;
11106                 func[i]->aux->func_idx = i;
11107                 /* the btf and func_info will be freed only at prog->aux */
11108                 func[i]->aux->btf = prog->aux->btf;
11109                 func[i]->aux->func_info = prog->aux->func_info;
11110 
11111                 for (j = 0; j < prog->aux->size_poke_tab; j++) {
11112                         u32 insn_idx = prog->aux->poke_tab[j].insn_idx;
11113                         int ret;
11114 
11115                         if (!(insn_idx >= subprog_start &&
11116                               insn_idx <= subprog_end))
11117                                 continue;
11118 
11119                         ret = bpf_jit_add_poke_descriptor(func[i],
11120                                                           &prog->aux->poke_tab[j]);
11121                         if (ret < 0) {
11122                                 verbose(env, "adding tail call poke descriptor failed\n");
11123                                 goto out_free;
11124                         }
11125 
11126                         func[i]->insnsi[insn_idx - subprog_start].imm = ret + 1;
11127 
11128                         map_ptr = func[i]->aux->poke_tab[ret].tail_call.map;
11129                         ret = map_ptr->ops->map_poke_track(map_ptr, func[i]->aux);
11130                         if (ret < 0) {
11131                                 verbose(env, "tracking tail call prog failed\n");
11132                                 goto out_free;
11133                         }
11134                 }
11135 
11136                 /* Use bpf_prog_F_tag to indicate functions in stack traces.
11137                  * Long term would need debug info to populate names
11138                  */
11139                 func[i]->aux->name[0] = 'F';
11140                 func[i]->aux->stack_depth = env->subprog_info[i].stack_depth;
11141                 func[i]->jit_requested = 1;
11142                 func[i]->aux->linfo = prog->aux->linfo;
11143                 func[i]->aux->nr_linfo = prog->aux->nr_linfo;
11144                 func[i]->aux->jited_linfo = prog->aux->jited_linfo;
11145                 func[i]->aux->linfo_idx = env->subprog_info[i].linfo_idx;
11146                 num_exentries = 0;
11147                 insn = func[i]->insnsi;
11148                 for (j = 0; j < func[i]->len; j++, insn++) {
11149                         if (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_LDX &&
11150                             BPF_MODE(insn->code) == BPF_PROBE_MEM)
11151                                 num_exentries++;
11152                 }
11153                 func[i]->aux->num_exentries = num_exentries;
11154                 func[i]->aux->tail_call_reachable = env->subprog_info[i].tail_call_reachable;
11155                 func[i] = bpf_int_jit_compile(func[i]);
11156                 if (!func[i]->jited) {
11157                         err = -ENOTSUPP;
11158                         goto out_free;
11159                 }
11160                 cond_resched();
11161         }
11162 
11163         /* Untrack main program's aux structs so that during map_poke_run()
11164          * we will not stumble upon the unfilled poke descriptors; each
11165          * of the main program's poke descs got distributed across subprogs
11166          * and got tracked onto map, so we are sure that none of them will
11167          * be missed after the operation below
11168          */
11169         for (i = 0; i < prog->aux->size_poke_tab; i++) {
11170                 map_ptr = prog->aux->poke_tab[i].tail_call.map;
11171 
11172                 map_ptr->ops->map_poke_untrack(map_ptr, prog->aux);
11173         }
11174 
11175         /* at this point all bpf functions were successfully JITed
11176          * now populate all bpf_calls with correct addresses and
11177          * run last pass of JIT
11178          */
11179         for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11180                 insn = func[i]->insnsi;
11181                 for (j = 0; j < func[i]->len; j++, insn++) {
11182                         if (insn->code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL) ||
11183                             insn->src_reg != BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
11184                                 continue;
11185                         subprog = insn->off;
11186                         insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(func[subprog]->bpf_func) -
11187                                     __bpf_call_base;
11188                 }
11189 
11190                 /* we use the aux data to keep a list of the start addresses
11191                  * of the JITed images for each function in the program
11192                  *
11193                  * for some architectures, such as powerpc64, the imm field
11194                  * might not be large enough to hold the offset of the start
11195                  * address of the callee's JITed image from __bpf_call_base
11196                  *
11197                  * in such cases, we can lookup the start address of a callee
11198                  * by using its subprog id, available from the off field of
11199                  * the call instruction, as an index for this list
11200                  */
11201                 func[i]->aux->func = func;
11202                 func[i]->aux->func_cnt = env->subprog_cnt;
11203         }
11204         for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11205                 old_bpf_func = func[i]->bpf_func;
11206                 tmp = bpf_int_jit_compile(func[i]);
11207                 if (tmp != func[i] || func[i]->bpf_func != old_bpf_func) {
11208                         verbose(env, "JIT doesn't support bpf-to-bpf calls\n");
11209                         err = -ENOTSUPP;
11210                         goto out_free;
11211                 }
11212                 cond_resched();
11213         }
11214 
11215         /* finally lock prog and jit images for all functions and
11216          * populate kallsysm
11217          */
11218         for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11219                 bpf_prog_lock_ro(func[i]);
11220                 bpf_prog_kallsyms_add(func[i]);
11221         }
11222 
11223         /* Last step: make now unused interpreter insns from main
11224          * prog consistent for later dump requests, so they can
11225          * later look the same as if they were interpreted only.
11226          */
11227         for (i = 0, insn = prog->insnsi; i < prog->len; i++, insn++) {
11228                 if (insn->code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL) ||
11229                     insn->src_reg != BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
11230                         continue;
11231                 insn->off = env->insn_aux_data[i].call_imm;
11232                 subprog = find_subprog(env, i + insn->off + 1);
11233                 insn->imm = subprog;
11234         }
11235 
11236         prog->jited = 1;
11237         prog->bpf_func = func[0]->bpf_func;
11238         prog->aux->func = func;
11239         prog->aux->func_cnt = env->subprog_cnt;
11240         bpf_prog_free_unused_jited_linfo(prog);
11241         return 0;
11242 out_free:
11243         for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11244                 if (!func[i])
11245                         continue;
11246 
11247                 for (j = 0; j < func[i]->aux->size_poke_tab; j++) {
11248                         map_ptr = func[i]->aux->poke_tab[j].tail_call.map;
11249                         map_ptr->ops->map_poke_untrack(map_ptr, func[i]->aux);
11250                 }
11251                 bpf_jit_free(func[i]);
11252         }
11253         kfree(func);
11254 out_undo_insn:
11255         /* cleanup main prog to be interpreted */
11256         prog->jit_requested = 0;
11257         for (i = 0, insn = prog->insnsi; i < prog->len; i++, insn++) {
11258                 if (insn->code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL) ||
11259                     insn->src_reg != BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
11260                         continue;
11261                 insn->off = 0;
11262                 insn->imm = env->insn_aux_data[i].call_imm;
11263         }
11264         bpf_prog_free_jited_linfo(prog);
11265         return err;
11266 }
11267 
11268 static int fixup_call_args(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11269 {
11270 #ifndef CONFIG_BPF_JIT_ALWAYS_ON
11271         struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog;
11272         struct bpf_insn *insn = prog->insnsi;
11273         int i, depth;
11274 #endif
11275         int err = 0;
11276 
11277         if (env->prog->jit_requested &&
11278             !bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux)) {
11279                 err = jit_subprogs(env);
11280                 if (err == 0)
11281                         return 0;
11282                 if (err == -EFAULT)
11283                         return err;
11284         }
11285 #ifndef CONFIG_BPF_JIT_ALWAYS_ON
11286         if (env->subprog_cnt > 1 && env->prog->aux->tail_call_reachable) {
11287                 /* When JIT fails the progs with bpf2bpf calls and tail_calls
11288                  * have to be rejected, since interpreter doesn't support them yet.
11289                  */
11290                 verbose(env, "tail_calls are not allowed in non-JITed programs with bpf-to-bpf calls\n");
11291                 return -EINVAL;
11292         }
11293         for (i = 0; i < prog->len; i++, insn++) {
11294                 if (insn->code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL) ||
11295                     insn->src_reg != BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
11296                         continue;
11297                 depth = get_callee_stack_depth(env, insn, i);
11298                 if (depth < 0)
11299                         return depth;
11300                 bpf_patch_call_args(insn, depth);
11301         }
11302         err = 0;
11303 #endif
11304         return err;
11305 }
11306 
11307 /* fixup insn->imm field of bpf_call instructions
11308  * and inline eligible helpers as explicit sequence of BPF instructions
11309  *
11310  * this function is called after eBPF program passed verification
11311  */
11312 static int fixup_bpf_calls(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11313 {
11314         struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog;
11315         bool expect_blinding = bpf_jit_blinding_enabled(prog);
11316         struct bpf_insn *insn = prog->insnsi;
11317         const struct bpf_func_proto *fn;
11318         const int insn_cnt = prog->len;
11319         const struct bpf_map_ops *ops;
11320         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux;
11321         struct bpf_insn insn_buf[16];
11322         struct bpf_prog *new_prog;
11323         struct bpf_map *map_ptr;
11324         int i, ret, cnt, delta = 0;
11325 
11326         for (i = 0; i < insn_cnt; i++, insn++) {
11327                 if (insn->code == (BPF_ALU64 | BPF_MOD | BPF_X) ||
11328                     insn->code == (BPF_ALU64 | BPF_DIV | BPF_X) ||
11329                     insn->code == (BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_X) ||
11330                     insn->code == (BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_X)) {
11331                         bool is64 = BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_ALU64;
11332                         bool isdiv = BPF_OP(insn->code) == BPF_DIV;
11333                         struct bpf_insn *patchlet;
11334                         struct bpf_insn chk_and_div[] = {
11335                                 /* [R,W]x div 0 -> 0 */
11336                                 BPF_RAW_INSN((is64 ? BPF_JMP : BPF_JMP32) |
11337                                              BPF_JNE | BPF_K, insn->src_reg,
11338                                              0, 2, 0),
11339                                 BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, insn->dst_reg, insn->dst_reg),
11340                                 BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JA, 0, 0, 1),
11341                                 *insn,
11342                         };
11343                         struct bpf_insn chk_and_mod[] = {
11344                                 /* [R,W]x mod 0 -> [R,W]x */
11345                                 BPF_RAW_INSN((is64 ? BPF_JMP : BPF_JMP32) |
11346                                              BPF_JEQ | BPF_K, insn->src_reg,
11347                                              0, 1 + (is64 ? 0 : 1), 0),
11348                                 *insn,
11349                                 BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JA, 0, 0, 1),
11350                                 BPF_MOV32_REG(insn->dst_reg, insn->dst_reg),
11351                         };
11352 
11353                         patchlet = isdiv ? chk_and_div : chk_and_mod;
11354                         cnt = isdiv ? ARRAY_SIZE(chk_and_div) :
11355                                       ARRAY_SIZE(chk_and_mod) - (is64 ? 2 : 0);
11356 
11357                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, patchlet, cnt);
11358                         if (!new_prog)
11359                                 return -ENOMEM;
11360 
11361                         delta    += cnt - 1;
11362                         env->prog = prog = new_prog;
11363                         insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11364                         continue;
11365                 }
11366 
11367                 if (BPF_CLASS(insn->code) == BPF_LD &&
11368                     (BPF_MODE(insn->code) == BPF_ABS ||
11369                      BPF_MODE(insn->code) == BPF_IND)) {
11370                         cnt = env->ops->gen_ld_abs(insn, insn_buf);
11371                         if (cnt == 0 || cnt >= ARRAY_SIZE(insn_buf)) {
11372                                 verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
11373                                 return -EINVAL;
11374                         }
11375 
11376                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, insn_buf, cnt);
11377                         if (!new_prog)
11378                                 return -ENOMEM;
11379 
11380                         delta    += cnt - 1;
11381                         env->prog = prog = new_prog;
11382                         insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11383                         continue;
11384                 }
11385 
11386                 if (insn->code == (BPF_ALU64 | BPF_ADD | BPF_X) ||
11387                     insn->code == (BPF_ALU64 | BPF_SUB | BPF_X)) {
11388                         const u8 code_add = BPF_ALU64 | BPF_ADD | BPF_X;
11389                         const u8 code_sub = BPF_ALU64 | BPF_SUB | BPF_X;
11390                         struct bpf_insn insn_buf[16];
11391                         struct bpf_insn *patch = &insn_buf[0];
11392                         bool issrc, isneg, isimm;
11393                         u32 off_reg;
11394 
11395                         aux = &env->insn_aux_data[i + delta];
11396                         if (!aux->alu_state ||
11397                             aux->alu_state == BPF_ALU_NON_POINTER)
11398                                 continue;
11399 
11400                         isneg = aux->alu_state & BPF_ALU_NEG_VALUE;
11401                         issrc = (aux->alu_state & BPF_ALU_SANITIZE) ==
11402                                 BPF_ALU_SANITIZE_SRC;
11403                         isimm = aux->alu_state & BPF_ALU_IMMEDIATE;
11404 
11405                         off_reg = issrc ? insn->src_reg : insn->dst_reg;
11406                         if (isimm) {
11407                                 *patch++ = BPF_MOV32_IMM(BPF_REG_AX, aux->alu_limit);
11408                         } else {
11409                                 if (isneg)
11410                                         *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_MUL, off_reg, -1);
11411                                 *patch++ = BPF_MOV32_IMM(BPF_REG_AX, aux->alu_limit);
11412                                 *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_REG(BPF_SUB, BPF_REG_AX, off_reg);
11413                                 *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_REG(BPF_OR, BPF_REG_AX, off_reg);
11414                                 *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_NEG, BPF_REG_AX, 0);
11415                                 *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_ARSH, BPF_REG_AX, 63);
11416                                 *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_REG(BPF_AND, BPF_REG_AX, off_reg);
11417                         }
11418                         if (!issrc)
11419                                 *patch++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(insn->dst_reg, insn->src_reg);
11420                         insn->src_reg = BPF_REG_AX;
11421                         if (isneg)
11422                                 insn->code = insn->code == code_add ?
11423                                              code_sub : code_add;
11424                         *patch++ = *insn;
11425                         if (issrc && isneg && !isimm)
11426                                 *patch++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_MUL, off_reg, -1);
11427                         cnt = patch - insn_buf;
11428 
11429                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, insn_buf, cnt);
11430                         if (!new_prog)
11431                                 return -ENOMEM;
11432 
11433                         delta    += cnt - 1;
11434                         env->prog = prog = new_prog;
11435                         insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11436                         continue;
11437                 }
11438 
11439                 if (insn->code != (BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL))
11440                         continue;
11441                 if (insn->src_reg == BPF_PSEUDO_CALL)
11442                         continue;
11443 
11444                 if (insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_get_route_realm)
11445                         prog->dst_needed = 1;
11446                 if (insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_get_prandom_u32)
11447                         bpf_user_rnd_init_once();
11448                 if (insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_override_return)
11449                         prog->kprobe_override = 1;
11450                 if (insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_tail_call) {
11451                         /* If we tail call into other programs, we
11452                          * cannot make any assumptions since they can
11453                          * be replaced dynamically during runtime in
11454                          * the program array.
11455                          */
11456                         prog->cb_access = 1;
11457                         if (!allow_tail_call_in_subprogs(env))
11458                                 prog->aux->stack_depth = MAX_BPF_STACK;
11459                         prog->aux->max_pkt_offset = MAX_PACKET_OFF;
11460 
11461                         /* mark bpf_tail_call as different opcode to avoid
11462                          * conditional branch in the interpeter for every normal
11463                          * call and to prevent accidental JITing by JIT compiler
11464                          * that doesn't support bpf_tail_call yet
11465                          */
11466                         insn->imm = 0;
11467                         insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_TAIL_CALL;
11468 
11469                         aux = &env->insn_aux_data[i + delta];
11470                         if (env->bpf_capable && !expect_blinding &&
11471                             prog->jit_requested &&
11472                             !bpf_map_key_poisoned(aux) &&
11473                             !bpf_map_ptr_poisoned(aux) &&
11474                             !bpf_map_ptr_unpriv(aux)) {
11475                                 struct bpf_jit_poke_descriptor desc = {
11476                                         .reason = BPF_POKE_REASON_TAIL_CALL,
11477                                         .tail_call.map = BPF_MAP_PTR(aux->map_ptr_state),
11478                                         .tail_call.key = bpf_map_key_immediate(aux),
11479                                         .insn_idx = i + delta,
11480                                 };
11481 
11482                                 ret = bpf_jit_add_poke_descriptor(prog, &desc);
11483                                 if (ret < 0) {
11484                                         verbose(env, "adding tail call poke descriptor failed\n");
11485                                         return ret;
11486                                 }
11487 
11488                                 insn->imm = ret + 1;
11489                                 continue;
11490                         }
11491 
11492                         if (!bpf_map_ptr_unpriv(aux))
11493                                 continue;
11494 
11495                         /* instead of changing every JIT dealing with tail_call
11496                          * emit two extra insns:
11497                          * if (index >= max_entries) goto out;
11498                          * index &= array->index_mask;
11499                          * to avoid out-of-bounds cpu speculation
11500                          */
11501                         if (bpf_map_ptr_poisoned(aux)) {
11502                                 verbose(env, "tail_call abusing map_ptr\n");
11503                                 return -EINVAL;
11504                         }
11505 
11506                         map_ptr = BPF_MAP_PTR(aux->map_ptr_state);
11507                         insn_buf[0] = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JGE, BPF_REG_3,
11508                                                   map_ptr->max_entries, 2);
11509                         insn_buf[1] = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_AND, BPF_REG_3,
11510                                                     container_of(map_ptr,
11511                                                                  struct bpf_array,
11512                                                                  map)->index_mask);
11513                         insn_buf[2] = *insn;
11514                         cnt = 3;
11515                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, insn_buf, cnt);
11516                         if (!new_prog)
11517                                 return -ENOMEM;
11518 
11519                         delta    += cnt - 1;
11520                         env->prog = prog = new_prog;
11521                         insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11522                         continue;
11523                 }
11524 
11525                 /* BPF_EMIT_CALL() assumptions in some of the map_gen_lookup
11526                  * and other inlining handlers are currently limited to 64 bit
11527                  * only.
11528                  */
11529                 if (prog->jit_requested && BITS_PER_LONG == 64 &&
11530                     (insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_lookup_elem ||
11531                      insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_update_elem ||
11532                      insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_delete_elem ||
11533                      insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_push_elem   ||
11534                      insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_pop_elem    ||
11535                      insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_peek_elem)) {
11536                         aux = &env->insn_aux_data[i + delta];
11537                         if (bpf_map_ptr_poisoned(aux))
11538                                 goto patch_call_imm;
11539 
11540                         map_ptr = BPF_MAP_PTR(aux->map_ptr_state);
11541                         ops = map_ptr->ops;
11542                         if (insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_map_lookup_elem &&
11543                             ops->map_gen_lookup) {
11544                                 cnt = ops->map_gen_lookup(map_ptr, insn_buf);
11545                                 if (cnt == -EOPNOTSUPP)
11546                                         goto patch_map_ops_generic;
11547                                 if (cnt <= 0 || cnt >= ARRAY_SIZE(insn_buf)) {
11548                                         verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
11549                                         return -EINVAL;
11550                                 }
11551 
11552                                 new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta,
11553                                                                insn_buf, cnt);
11554                                 if (!new_prog)
11555                                         return -ENOMEM;
11556 
11557                                 delta    += cnt - 1;
11558                                 env->prog = prog = new_prog;
11559                                 insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11560                                 continue;
11561                         }
11562 
11563                         BUILD_BUG_ON(!__same_type(ops->map_lookup_elem,
11564                                      (void *(*)(struct bpf_map *map, void *key))NULL));
11565                         BUILD_BUG_ON(!__same_type(ops->map_delete_elem,
11566                                      (int (*)(struct bpf_map *map, void *key))NULL));
11567                         BUILD_BUG_ON(!__same_type(ops->map_update_elem,
11568                                      (int (*)(struct bpf_map *map, void *key, void *value,
11569                                               u64 flags))NULL));
11570                         BUILD_BUG_ON(!__same_type(ops->map_push_elem,
11571                                      (int (*)(struct bpf_map *map, void *value,
11572                                               u64 flags))NULL));
11573                         BUILD_BUG_ON(!__same_type(ops->map_pop_elem,
11574                                      (int (*)(struct bpf_map *map, void *value))NULL));
11575                         BUILD_BUG_ON(!__same_type(ops->map_peek_elem,
11576                                      (int (*)(struct bpf_map *map, void *value))NULL));
11577 patch_map_ops_generic:
11578                         switch (insn->imm) {
11579                         case BPF_FUNC_map_lookup_elem:
11580                                 insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(ops->map_lookup_elem) -
11581                                             __bpf_call_base;
11582                                 continue;
11583                         case BPF_FUNC_map_update_elem:
11584                                 insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(ops->map_update_elem) -
11585                                             __bpf_call_base;
11586                                 continue;
11587                         case BPF_FUNC_map_delete_elem:
11588                                 insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(ops->map_delete_elem) -
11589                                             __bpf_call_base;
11590                                 continue;
11591                         case BPF_FUNC_map_push_elem:
11592                                 insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(ops->map_push_elem) -
11593                                             __bpf_call_base;
11594                                 continue;
11595                         case BPF_FUNC_map_pop_elem:
11596                                 insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(ops->map_pop_elem) -
11597                                             __bpf_call_base;
11598                                 continue;
11599                         case BPF_FUNC_map_peek_elem:
11600                                 insn->imm = BPF_CAST_CALL(ops->map_peek_elem) -
11601                                             __bpf_call_base;
11602                                 continue;
11603                         }
11604 
11605                         goto patch_call_imm;
11606                 }
11607 
11608                 if (prog->jit_requested && BITS_PER_LONG == 64 &&
11609                     insn->imm == BPF_FUNC_jiffies64) {
11610                         struct bpf_insn ld_jiffies_addr[2] = {
11611                                 BPF_LD_IMM64(BPF_REG_0,
11612                                              (unsigned long)&jiffies),
11613                         };
11614 
11615                         insn_buf[0] = ld_jiffies_addr[0];
11616                         insn_buf[1] = ld_jiffies_addr[1];
11617                         insn_buf[2] = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_DW, BPF_REG_0,
11618                                                   BPF_REG_0, 0);
11619                         cnt = 3;
11620 
11621                         new_prog = bpf_patch_insn_data(env, i + delta, insn_buf,
11622                                                        cnt);
11623                         if (!new_prog)
11624                                 return -ENOMEM;
11625 
11626                         delta    += cnt - 1;
11627                         env->prog = prog = new_prog;
11628                         insn      = new_prog->insnsi + i + delta;
11629                         continue;
11630                 }
11631 
11632 patch_call_imm:
11633                 fn = env->ops->get_func_proto(insn->imm, env->prog);
11634                 /* all functions that have prototype and verifier allowed
11635                  * programs to call them, must be real in-kernel functions
11636                  */
11637                 if (!fn->func) {
11638                         verbose(env,
11639                                 "kernel subsystem misconfigured func %s#%d\n",
11640                                 func_id_name(insn->imm), insn->imm);
11641                         return -EFAULT;
11642                 }
11643                 insn->imm = fn->func - __bpf_call_base;
11644         }
11645 
11646         /* Since poke tab is now finalized, publish aux to tracker. */
11647         for (i = 0; i < prog->aux->size_poke_tab; i++) {
11648                 map_ptr = prog->aux->poke_tab[i].tail_call.map;
11649                 if (!map_ptr->ops->map_poke_track ||
11650                     !map_ptr->ops->map_poke_untrack ||
11651                     !map_ptr->ops->map_poke_run) {
11652                         verbose(env, "bpf verifier is misconfigured\n");
11653                         return -EINVAL;
11654                 }
11655 
11656                 ret = map_ptr->ops->map_poke_track(map_ptr, prog->aux);
11657                 if (ret < 0) {
11658                         verbose(env, "tracking tail call prog failed\n");
11659                         return ret;
11660                 }
11661         }
11662 
11663         return 0;
11664 }
11665 
11666 static void free_states(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11667 {
11668         struct bpf_verifier_state_list *sl, *sln;
11669         int i;
11670 
11671         sl = env->free_list;
11672         while (sl) {
11673                 sln = sl->next;
11674                 free_verifier_state(&sl->state, false);
11675                 kfree(sl);
11676                 sl = sln;
11677         }
11678         env->free_list = NULL;
11679 
11680         if (!env->explored_states)
11681                 return;
11682 
11683         for (i = 0; i < state_htab_size(env); i++) {
11684                 sl = env->explored_states[i];
11685 
11686                 while (sl) {
11687                         sln = sl->next;
11688                         free_verifier_state(&sl->state, false);
11689                         kfree(sl);
11690                         sl = sln;
11691                 }
11692                 env->explored_states[i] = NULL;
11693         }
11694 }
11695 
11696 /* The verifier is using insn_aux_data[] to store temporary data during
11697  * verification and to store information for passes that run after the
11698  * verification like dead code sanitization. do_check_common() for subprogram N
11699  * may analyze many other subprograms. sanitize_insn_aux_data() clears all
11700  * temporary data after do_check_common() finds that subprogram N cannot be
11701  * verified independently. pass_cnt counts the number of times
11702  * do_check_common() was run and insn->aux->seen tells the pass number
11703  * insn_aux_data was touched. These variables are compared to clear temporary
11704  * data from failed pass. For testing and experiments do_check_common() can be
11705  * run multiple times even when prior attempt to verify is unsuccessful.
11706  */
11707 static void sanitize_insn_aux_data(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11708 {
11709         struct bpf_insn *insn = env->prog->insnsi;
11710         struct bpf_insn_aux_data *aux;
11711         int i, class;
11712 
11713         for (i = 0; i < env->prog->len; i++) {
11714                 class = BPF_CLASS(insn[i].code);
11715                 if (class != BPF_LDX && class != BPF_STX)
11716                         continue;
11717                 aux = &env->insn_aux_data[i];
11718                 if (aux->seen != env->pass_cnt)
11719                         continue;
11720                 memset(aux, 0, offsetof(typeof(*aux), orig_idx));
11721         }
11722 }
11723 
11724 static int do_check_common(struct bpf_verifier_env *env, int subprog)
11725 {
11726         bool pop_log = !(env->log.level & BPF_LOG_LEVEL2);
11727         struct bpf_verifier_state *state;
11728         struct bpf_reg_state *regs;
11729         int ret, i;
11730 
11731         env->prev_linfo = NULL;
11732         env->pass_cnt++;
11733 
11734         state = kzalloc(sizeof(struct bpf_verifier_state), GFP_KERNEL);
11735         if (!state)
11736                 return -ENOMEM;
11737         state->curframe = 0;
11738         state->speculative = false;
11739         state->branches = 1;
11740         state->frame[0] = kzalloc(sizeof(struct bpf_func_state), GFP_KERNEL);
11741         if (!state->frame[0]) {
11742                 kfree(state);
11743                 return -ENOMEM;
11744         }
11745         env->cur_state = state;
11746         init_func_state(env, state->frame[0],
11747                         BPF_MAIN_FUNC /* callsite */,
11748                         0 /* frameno */,
11749                         subprog);
11750 
11751         regs = state->frame[state->curframe]->regs;
11752         if (subprog || env->prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT) {
11753                 ret = btf_prepare_func_args(env, subprog, regs);
11754                 if (ret)
11755                         goto out;
11756                 for (i = BPF_REG_1; i <= BPF_REG_5; i++) {
11757                         if (regs[i].type == PTR_TO_CTX)
11758                                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, i);
11759                         else if (regs[i].type == SCALAR_VALUE)
11760                                 mark_reg_unknown(env, regs, i);
11761                 }
11762         } else {
11763                 /* 1st arg to a function */
11764                 regs[BPF_REG_1].type = PTR_TO_CTX;
11765                 mark_reg_known_zero(env, regs, BPF_REG_1);
11766                 ret = btf_check_func_arg_match(env, subprog, regs);
11767                 if (ret == -EFAULT)
11768                         /* unlikely verifier bug. abort.
11769                          * ret == 0 and ret < 0 are sadly acceptable for
11770                          * main() function due to backward compatibility.
11771                          * Like socket filter program may be written as:
11772                          * int bpf_prog(struct pt_regs *ctx)
11773                          * and never dereference that ctx in the program.
11774                          * 'struct pt_regs' is a type mismatch for socket
11775                          * filter that should be using 'struct __sk_buff'.
11776                          */
11777                         goto out;
11778         }
11779 
11780         ret = do_check(env);
11781 out:
11782         /* check for NULL is necessary, since cur_state can be freed inside
11783          * do_check() under memory pressure.
11784          */
11785         if (env->cur_state) {
11786                 free_verifier_state(env->cur_state, true);
11787                 env->cur_state = NULL;
11788         }
11789         while (!pop_stack(env, NULL, NULL, false));
11790         if (!ret && pop_log)
11791                 bpf_vlog_reset(&env->log, 0);
11792         free_states(env);
11793         if (ret)
11794                 /* clean aux data in case subprog was rejected */
11795                 sanitize_insn_aux_data(env);
11796         return ret;
11797 }
11798 
11799 /* Verify all global functions in a BPF program one by one based on their BTF.
11800  * All global functions must pass verification. Otherwise the whole program is rejected.
11801  * Consider:
11802  * int bar(int);
11803  * int foo(int f)
11804  * {
11805  *    return bar(f);
11806  * }
11807  * int bar(int b)
11808  * {
11809  *    ...
11810  * }
11811  * foo() will be verified first for R1=any_scalar_value. During verification it
11812  * will be assumed that bar() already verified successfully and call to bar()
11813  * from foo() will be checked for type match only. Later bar() will be verified
11814  * independently to check that it's safe for R1=any_scalar_value.
11815  */
11816 static int do_check_subprogs(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11817 {
11818         struct bpf_prog_aux *aux = env->prog->aux;
11819         int i, ret;
11820 
11821         if (!aux->func_info)
11822                 return 0;
11823 
11824         for (i = 1; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11825                 if (aux->func_info_aux[i].linkage != BTF_FUNC_GLOBAL)
11826                         continue;
11827                 env->insn_idx = env->subprog_info[i].start;
11828                 WARN_ON_ONCE(env->insn_idx == 0);
11829                 ret = do_check_common(env, i);
11830                 if (ret) {
11831                         return ret;
11832                 } else if (env->log.level & BPF_LOG_LEVEL) {
11833                         verbose(env,
11834                                 "Func#%d is safe for any args that match its prototype\n",
11835                                 i);
11836                 }
11837         }
11838         return 0;
11839 }
11840 
11841 static int do_check_main(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11842 {
11843         int ret;
11844 
11845         env->insn_idx = 0;
11846         ret = do_check_common(env, 0);
11847         if (!ret)
11848                 env->prog->aux->stack_depth = env->subprog_info[0].stack_depth;
11849         return ret;
11850 }
11851 
11852 
11853 static void print_verification_stats(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11854 {
11855         int i;
11856 
11857         if (env->log.level & BPF_LOG_STATS) {
11858                 verbose(env, "verification time %lld usec\n",
11859                         div_u64(env->verification_time, 1000));
11860                 verbose(env, "stack depth ");
11861                 for (i = 0; i < env->subprog_cnt; i++) {
11862                         u32 depth = env->subprog_info[i].stack_depth;
11863 
11864                         verbose(env, "%d", depth);
11865                         if (i + 1 < env->subprog_cnt)
11866                                 verbose(env, "+");
11867                 }
11868                 verbose(env, "\n");
11869         }
11870         verbose(env, "processed %d insns (limit %d) max_states_per_insn %d "
11871                 "total_states %d peak_states %d mark_read %d\n",
11872                 env->insn_processed, BPF_COMPLEXITY_LIMIT_INSNS,
11873                 env->max_states_per_insn, env->total_states,
11874                 env->peak_states, env->longest_mark_read_walk);
11875 }
11876 
11877 static int check_struct_ops_btf_id(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
11878 {
11879         const struct btf_type *t, *func_proto;
11880         const struct bpf_struct_ops *st_ops;
11881         const struct btf_member *member;
11882         struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog;
11883         u32 btf_id, member_idx;
11884         const char *mname;
11885 
11886         if (!prog->gpl_compatible) {
11887                 verbose(env, "struct ops programs must have a GPL compatible license\n");
11888                 return -EINVAL;
11889         }
11890 
11891         btf_id = prog->aux->attach_btf_id;
11892         st_ops = bpf_struct_ops_find(btf_id);
11893         if (!st_ops) {
11894                 verbose(env, "attach_btf_id %u is not a supported struct\n",
11895                         btf_id);
11896                 return -ENOTSUPP;
11897         }
11898 
11899         t = st_ops->type;
11900         member_idx = prog->expected_attach_type;
11901         if (member_idx >= btf_type_vlen(t)) {
11902                 verbose(env, "attach to invalid member idx %u of struct %s\n",
11903                         member_idx, st_ops->name);
11904                 return -EINVAL;
11905         }
11906 
11907         member = &btf_type_member(t)[member_idx];
11908         mname = btf_name_by_offset(btf_vmlinux, member->name_off);
11909         func_proto = btf_type_resolve_func_ptr(btf_vmlinux, member->type,
11910                                                NULL);
11911         if (!func_proto) {
11912                 verbose(env, "attach to invalid member %s(@idx %u) of struct %s\n",
11913                         mname, member_idx, st_ops->name);
11914                 return -EINVAL;
11915         }
11916 
11917         if (st_ops->check_member) {
11918                 int err = st_ops->check_member(t, member);
11919 
11920                 if (err) {
11921                         verbose(env, "attach to unsupported member %s of struct %s\n",
11922                                 mname, st_ops->name);
11923                         return err;
11924                 }
11925         }
11926 
11927         prog->aux->attach_func_proto = func_proto;
11928         prog->aux->attach_func_name = mname;
11929         env->ops = st_ops->verifier_ops;
11930 
11931         return 0;
11932 }
11933 #define SECURITY_PREFIX "security_"
11934 
11935 static int check_attach_modify_return(unsigned long addr, const char *func_name)
11936 {
11937         if (within_error_injection_list(addr) ||
11938             !strncmp(SECURITY_PREFIX, func_name, sizeof(SECURITY_PREFIX) - 1))
11939                 return 0;
11940 
11941         return -EINVAL;
11942 }
11943 
11944 /* non exhaustive list of sleepable bpf_lsm_*() functions */
11945 BTF_SET_START(btf_sleepable_lsm_hooks)
11946 #ifdef CONFIG_BPF_LSM
11947 BTF_ID(func, bpf_lsm_bprm_committed_creds)
11948 #else
11949 BTF_ID_UNUSED
11950 #endif
11951 BTF_SET_END(btf_sleepable_lsm_hooks)
11952 
11953 static int check_sleepable_lsm_hook(u32 btf_id)
11954 {
11955         return btf_id_set_contains(&btf_sleepable_lsm_hooks, btf_id);
11956 }
11957 
11958 /* list of non-sleepable functions that are otherwise on
11959  * ALLOW_ERROR_INJECTION list
11960  */
11961 BTF_SET_START(btf_non_sleepable_error_inject)
11962 /* Three functions below can be called from sleepable and non-sleepable context.
11963  * Assume non-sleepable from bpf safety point of view.
11964  */
11965 BTF_ID(func, __add_to_page_cache_locked)
11966 BTF_ID(func, should_fail_alloc_page)
11967 BTF_ID(func, should_failslab)
11968 BTF_SET_END(btf_non_sleepable_error_inject)
11969 
11970 static int check_non_sleepable_error_inject(u32 btf_id)
11971 {
11972         return btf_id_set_contains(&btf_non_sleepable_error_inject, btf_id);
11973 }
11974 
11975 int bpf_check_attach_target(struct bpf_verifier_log *log,
11976                             const struct bpf_prog *prog,
11977                             const struct bpf_prog *tgt_prog,
11978                             u32 btf_id,
11979                             struct bpf_attach_target_info *tgt_info)
11980 {
11981         bool prog_extension = prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT;
11982         const char prefix[] = "btf_trace_";
11983         int ret = 0, subprog = -1, i;
11984         const struct btf_type *t;
11985         bool conservative = true;
11986         const char *tname;
11987         struct btf *btf;
11988         long addr = 0;
11989 
11990         if (!btf_id) {
11991                 bpf_log(log, "Tracing programs must provide btf_id\n");
11992                 return -EINVAL;
11993         }
11994         btf = tgt_prog ? tgt_prog->aux->btf : btf_vmlinux;
11995         if (!btf) {
11996                 bpf_log(log,
11997                         "FENTRY/FEXIT program can only be attached to another program annotated with BTF\n");
11998                 return -EINVAL;
11999         }
12000         t = btf_type_by_id(btf, btf_id);
12001         if (!t) {
12002                 bpf_log(log, "attach_btf_id %u is invalid\n", btf_id);
12003                 return -EINVAL;
12004         }
12005         tname = btf_name_by_offset(btf, t->name_off);
12006         if (!tname) {
12007                 bpf_log(log, "attach_btf_id %u doesn't have a name\n", btf_id);
12008                 return -EINVAL;
12009         }
12010         if (tgt_prog) {
12011                 struct bpf_prog_aux *aux = tgt_prog->aux;
12012 
12013                 for (i = 0; i < aux->func_info_cnt; i++)
12014                         if (aux->func_info[i].type_id == btf_id) {
12015                                 subprog = i;
12016                                 break;
12017                         }
12018                 if (subprog == -1) {
12019                         bpf_log(log, "Subprog %s doesn't exist\n", tname);
12020                         return -EINVAL;
12021                 }
12022                 conservative = aux->func_info_aux[subprog].unreliable;
12023                 if (prog_extension) {
12024                         if (conservative) {
12025                                 bpf_log(log,
12026                                         "Cannot replace static functions\n");
12027                                 return -EINVAL;
12028                         }
12029                         if (!prog->jit_requested) {
12030                                 bpf_log(log,
12031                                         "Extension programs should be JITed\n");
12032                                 return -EINVAL;
12033                         }
12034                 }
12035                 if (!tgt_prog->jited) {
12036                         bpf_log(log, "Can attach to only JITed progs\n");
12037                         return -EINVAL;
12038                 }
12039                 if (tgt_prog->type == prog->type) {
12040                         /* Cannot fentry/fexit another fentry/fexit program.
12041                          * Cannot attach program extension to another extension.
12042                          * It's ok to attach fentry/fexit to extension program.
12043                          */
12044                         bpf_log(log, "Cannot recursively attach\n");
12045                         return -EINVAL;
12046                 }
12047                 if (tgt_prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_TRACING &&
12048                     prog_extension &&
12049                     (tgt_prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_TRACE_FENTRY ||
12050                      tgt_prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_TRACE_FEXIT)) {
12051                         /* Program extensions can extend all program types
12052                          * except fentry/fexit. The reason is the following.
12053                          * The fentry/fexit programs are used for performance
12054                          * analysis, stats and can be attached to any program
12055                          * type except themselves. When extension program is
12056                          * replacing XDP function it is necessary to allow
12057                          * performance analysis of all functions. Both original
12058                          * XDP program and its program extension. Hence
12059                          * attaching fentry/fexit to BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT is
12060                          * allowed. If extending of fentry/fexit was allowed it
12061                          * would be possible to create long call chain
12062                          * fentry->extension->fentry->extension beyond
12063                          * reasonable stack size. Hence extending fentry is not
12064                          * allowed.
12065                          */
12066                         bpf_log(log, "Cannot extend fentry/fexit\n");
12067                         return -EINVAL;
12068                 }
12069         } else {
12070                 if (prog_extension) {
12071                         bpf_log(log, "Cannot replace kernel functions\n");
12072                         return -EINVAL;
12073                 }
12074         }
12075 
12076         switch (prog->expected_attach_type) {
12077         case BPF_TRACE_RAW_TP:
12078                 if (tgt_prog) {
12079                         bpf_log(log,
12080                                 "Only FENTRY/FEXIT progs are attachable to another BPF prog\n");
12081                         return -EINVAL;
12082                 }
12083                 if (!btf_type_is_typedef(t)) {
12084                         bpf_log(log, "attach_btf_id %u is not a typedef\n",
12085                                 btf_id);
12086                         return -EINVAL;
12087                 }
12088                 if (strncmp(prefix, tname, sizeof(prefix) - 1)) {
12089                         bpf_log(log, "attach_btf_id %u points to wrong type name %s\n",
12090                                 btf_id, tname);
12091                         return -EINVAL;
12092                 }
12093                 tname += sizeof(prefix) - 1;
12094                 t = btf_type_by_id(btf, t->type);
12095                 if (!btf_type_is_ptr(t))
12096                         /* should never happen in valid vmlinux build */
12097                         return -EINVAL;
12098                 t = btf_type_by_id(btf, t->type);
12099                 if (!btf_type_is_func_proto(t))
12100                         /* should never happen in valid vmlinux build */
12101                         return -EINVAL;
12102 
12103                 break;
12104         case BPF_TRACE_ITER:
12105                 if (!btf_type_is_func(t)) {
12106                         bpf_log(log, "attach_btf_id %u is not a function\n",
12107                                 btf_id);
12108                         return -EINVAL;
12109                 }
12110                 t = btf_type_by_id(btf, t->type);
12111                 if (!btf_type_is_func_proto(t))
12112                         return -EINVAL;
12113                 ret = btf_distill_func_proto(log, btf, t, tname, &tgt_info->fmodel);
12114                 if (ret)
12115                         return ret;
12116                 break;
12117         default:
12118                 if (!prog_extension)
12119                         return -EINVAL;
12120                 fallthrough;
12121         case BPF_MODIFY_RETURN:
12122         case BPF_LSM_MAC:
12123         case BPF_TRACE_FENTRY:
12124         case BPF_TRACE_FEXIT:
12125                 if (!btf_type_is_func(t)) {
12126                         bpf_log(log, "attach_btf_id %u is not a function\n",
12127                                 btf_id);
12128                         return -EINVAL;
12129                 }
12130                 if (prog_extension &&
12131                     btf_check_type_match(log, prog, btf, t))
12132                         return -EINVAL;
12133                 t = btf_type_by_id(btf, t->type);
12134                 if (!btf_type_is_func_proto(t))
12135                         return -EINVAL;
12136 
12137                 if ((prog->aux->saved_dst_prog_type || prog->aux->saved_dst_attach_type) &&
12138                     (!tgt_prog || prog->aux->saved_dst_prog_type != tgt_prog->type ||
12139                      prog->aux->saved_dst_attach_type != tgt_prog->expected_attach_type))
12140                         return -EINVAL;
12141 
12142                 if (tgt_prog && conservative)
12143                         t = NULL;
12144 
12145                 ret = btf_distill_func_proto(log, btf, t, tname, &tgt_info->fmodel);
12146                 if (ret < 0)
12147                         return ret;
12148 
12149                 if (tgt_prog) {
12150                         if (subprog == 0)
12151                                 addr = (long) tgt_prog->bpf_func;
12152                         else
12153                                 addr = (long) tgt_prog->aux->func[subprog]->bpf_func;
12154                 } else {
12155                         addr = kallsyms_lookup_name(tname);
12156                         if (!addr) {
12157                                 bpf_log(log,
12158                                         "The address of function %s cannot be found\n",
12159                                         tname);
12160                                 return -ENOENT;
12161                         }
12162                 }
12163 
12164                 if (prog->aux->sleepable) {
12165                         ret = -EINVAL;
12166                         switch (prog->type) {
12167                         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_TRACING:
12168                                 /* fentry/fexit/fmod_ret progs can be sleepable only if they are
12169                                  * attached to ALLOW_ERROR_INJECTION and are not in denylist.
12170                                  */
12171                                 if (!check_non_sleepable_error_inject(btf_id) &&
12172                                     within_error_injection_list(addr))
12173                                         ret = 0;
12174                                 break;
12175                         case BPF_PROG_TYPE_LSM:
12176                                 /* LSM progs check that they are attached to bpf_lsm_*() funcs.
12177                                  * Only some of them are sleepable.
12178                                  */
12179                                 if (check_sleepable_lsm_hook(btf_id))
12180                                         ret = 0;
12181                                 break;
12182                         default:
12183                                 break;
12184                         }
12185                         if (ret) {
12186                                 bpf_log(log, "%s is not sleepable\n", tname);
12187                                 return ret;
12188                         }
12189                 } else if (prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_MODIFY_RETURN) {
12190                         if (tgt_prog) {
12191                                 bpf_log(log, "can't modify return codes of BPF programs\n");
12192                                 return -EINVAL;
12193                         }
12194                         ret = check_attach_modify_return(addr, tname);
12195                         if (ret) {
12196                                 bpf_log(log, "%s() is not modifiable\n", tname);
12197                                 return ret;
12198                         }
12199                 }
12200 
12201                 break;
12202         }
12203         tgt_info->tgt_addr = addr;
12204         tgt_info->tgt_name = tname;
12205         tgt_info->tgt_type = t;
12206         return 0;
12207 }
12208 
12209 static int check_attach_btf_id(struct bpf_verifier_env *env)
12210 {
12211         struct bpf_prog *prog = env->prog;
12212         struct bpf_prog *tgt_prog = prog->aux->dst_prog;
12213         struct bpf_attach_target_info tgt_info = {};
12214         u32 btf_id = prog->aux->attach_btf_id;
12215         struct bpf_trampoline *tr;
12216         int ret;
12217         u64 key;
12218
