12219         if (prog->aux->sleepable && prog->type != BPF_PROG_TYPE_TRACING &&
12220             prog->type != BPF_PROG_TYPE_LSM) {
12221                 verbose(env, "Only fentry/fexit/fmod_ret and lsm programs can be sleepable\n");
12222                 return -EINVAL;
12223         }
12224 
12225         if (prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_STRUCT_OPS)
12226                 return check_struct_ops_btf_id(env);
12227 
12228         if (prog->type != BPF_PROG_TYPE_TRACING &&
12229             prog->type != BPF_PROG_TYPE_LSM &&
12230             prog->type != BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT)
12231                 return 0;
12232 
12233         ret = bpf_check_attach_target(&env->log, prog, tgt_prog, btf_id, &tgt_info);
12234         if (ret)
12235                 return ret;
12236 
12237         if (tgt_prog && prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT) {
12238                 /* to make freplace equivalent to their targets, they need to
12239                  * inherit env->ops and expected_attach_type for the rest of the
12240                  * verification
12241                  */
12242                 env->ops = bpf_verifier_ops[tgt_prog->type];
12243                 prog->expected_attach_type = tgt_prog->expected_attach_type;
12244         }
12245 
12246         /* store info about the attachment target that will be used later */
12247         prog->aux->attach_func_proto = tgt_info.tgt_type;
12248         prog->aux->attach_func_name = tgt_info.tgt_name;
12249 
12250         if (tgt_prog) {
12251                 prog->aux->saved_dst_prog_type = tgt_prog->type;
12252                 prog->aux->saved_dst_attach_type = tgt_prog->expected_attach_type;
12253         }
12254 
12255         if (prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_TRACE_RAW_TP) {
12256                 prog->aux->attach_btf_trace = true;
12257                 return 0;
12258         } else if (prog->expected_attach_type == BPF_TRACE_ITER) {
12259                 if (!bpf_iter_prog_supported(prog))
12260                         return -EINVAL;
12261                 return 0;
12262         }
12263 
12264         if (prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_LSM) {
12265                 ret = bpf_lsm_verify_prog(&env->log, prog);
12266                 if (ret < 0)
12267                         return ret;
12268         }
12269 
12270         key = bpf_trampoline_compute_key(tgt_prog, btf_id);
12271         tr = bpf_trampoline_get(key, &tgt_info);
12272         if (!tr)
12273                 return -ENOMEM;
12274 
12275         prog->aux->dst_trampoline = tr;
12276         return 0;
12277 }
12278 
12279 struct btf *bpf_get_btf_vmlinux(void)
12280 {
12281         if (!btf_vmlinux && IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_DEBUG_INFO_BTF)) {
12282                 mutex_lock(&bpf_verifier_lock);
12283                 if (!btf_vmlinux)
12284                         btf_vmlinux = btf_parse_vmlinux();
12285                 mutex_unlock(&bpf_verifier_lock);
12286         }
12287         return btf_vmlinux;
12288 }
12289 
12290 int bpf_check(struct bpf_prog **prog, union bpf_attr *attr,
12291               union bpf_attr __user *uattr)
12292 {
12293         u64 start_time = ktime_get_ns();
12294         struct bpf_verifier_env *env;
12295         struct bpf_verifier_log *log;
12296         int i, len, ret = -EINVAL;
12297         bool is_priv;
12298 
12299         /* no program is valid */
12300         if (ARRAY_SIZE(bpf_verifier_ops) == 0)
12301                 return -EINVAL;
12302 
12303         /* 'struct bpf_verifier_env' can be global, but since it's not small,
12304          * allocate/free it every time bpf_check() is called
12305          */
12306         env = kzalloc(sizeof(struct bpf_verifier_env), GFP_KERNEL);
12307         if (!env)
12308                 return -ENOMEM;
12309         log = &env->log;
12310 
12311         len = (*prog)->len;
12312         env->insn_aux_data =
12313                 vzalloc(array_size(sizeof(struct bpf_insn_aux_data), len));
12314         ret = -ENOMEM;
12315         if (!env->insn_aux_data)
12316                 goto err_free_env;
12317         for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
12318                 env->insn_aux_data[i].orig_idx = i;
12319         env->prog = *prog;
12320         env->ops = bpf_verifier_ops[env->prog->type];
12321         is_priv = bpf_capable();
12322 
12323         bpf_get_btf_vmlinux();
12324 
12325         /* grab the mutex to protect few globals used by verifier */
12326         if (!is_priv)
12327                 mutex_lock(&bpf_verifier_lock);
12328 
12329         if (attr->log_level || attr->log_buf || attr->log_size) {
12330                 /* user requested verbose verifier output
12331                  * and supplied buffer to store the verification trace
12332                  */
12333                 log->level = attr->log_level;
12334                 log->ubuf = (char __user *) (unsigned long) attr->log_buf;
12335                 log->len_total = attr->log_size;
12336 
12337                 ret = -EINVAL;
12338                 /* log attributes have to be sane */
12339                 if (log->len_total < 128 || log->len_total > UINT_MAX >> 2 ||
12340                     !log->level || !log->ubuf || log->level & ~BPF_LOG_MASK)
12341                         goto err_unlock;
12342         }
12343 
12344         if (IS_ERR(btf_vmlinux)) {
12345                 /* Either gcc or pahole or kernel are broken. */
12346                 verbose(env, "in-kernel BTF is malformed\n");
12347                 ret = PTR_ERR(btf_vmlinux);
12348                 goto skip_full_check;
12349         }
12350 
12351         env->strict_alignment = !!(attr->prog_flags & BPF_F_STRICT_ALIGNMENT);
12352         if (!IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_HAVE_EFFICIENT_UNALIGNED_ACCESS))
12353                 env->strict_alignment = true;
12354         if (attr->prog_flags & BPF_F_ANY_ALIGNMENT)
12355                 env->strict_alignment = false;
12356 
12357         env->allow_ptr_leaks = bpf_allow_ptr_leaks();
12358         env->allow_uninit_stack = bpf_allow_uninit_stack();
12359         env->allow_ptr_to_map_access = bpf_allow_ptr_to_map_access();
12360         env->bypass_spec_v1 = bpf_bypass_spec_v1();
12361         env->bypass_spec_v4 = bpf_bypass_spec_v4();
12362         env->bpf_capable = bpf_capable();
12363 
12364         if (is_priv)
12365                 env->test_state_freq = attr->prog_flags & BPF_F_TEST_STATE_FREQ;
12366 
12367         env->explored_states = kvcalloc(state_htab_size(env),
12368                                        sizeof(struct bpf_verifier_state_list *),
12369                                        GFP_USER);
12370         ret = -ENOMEM;
12371         if (!env->explored_states)
12372                 goto skip_full_check;
12373 
12374         ret = check_subprogs(env);
12375         if (ret < 0)
12376                 goto skip_full_check;
12377 
12378         ret = check_btf_info(env, attr, uattr);
12379         if (ret < 0)
12380                 goto skip_full_check;
12381 
12382         ret = check_attach_btf_id(env);
12383         if (ret)
12384                 goto skip_full_check;
12385 
12386         ret = resolve_pseudo_ldimm64(env);
12387         if (ret < 0)
12388                 goto skip_full_check;
12389 
12390         if (bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux)) {
12391                 ret = bpf_prog_offload_verifier_prep(env->prog);
12392                 if (ret)
12393                         goto skip_full_check;
12394         }
12395 
12396         ret = check_cfg(env);
12397         if (ret < 0)
12398                 goto skip_full_check;
12399 
12400         ret = do_check_subprogs(env);
12401         ret = ret ?: do_check_main(env);
12402 
12403         if (ret == 0 && bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux))
12404                 ret = bpf_prog_offload_finalize(env);
12405 
12406 skip_full_check:
12407         kvfree(env->explored_states);
12408 
12409         if (ret == 0)
12410                 ret = check_max_stack_depth(env);
12411 
12412         /* instruction rewrites happen after this point */
12413         if (is_priv) {
12414                 if (ret == 0)
12415                         opt_hard_wire_dead_code_branches(env);
12416                 if (ret == 0)
12417                         ret = opt_remove_dead_code(env);
12418                 if (ret == 0)
12419                         ret = opt_remove_nops(env);
12420         } else {
12421                 if (ret == 0)
12422                         sanitize_dead_code(env);
12423         }
12424 
12425         if (ret == 0)
12426                 /* program is valid, convert *(u32*)(ctx + off) accesses */
12427                 ret = convert_ctx_accesses(env);
12428 
12429         if (ret == 0)
12430                 ret = fixup_bpf_calls(env);
12431 
12432         /* do 32-bit optimization after insn patching has done so those patched
12433          * insns could be handled correctly.
12434          */
12435         if (ret == 0 && !bpf_prog_is_dev_bound(env->prog->aux)) {
12436                 ret = opt_subreg_zext_lo32_rnd_hi32(env, attr);
12437                 env->prog->aux->verifier_zext = bpf_jit_needs_zext() ? !ret
12438                                                                      : false;
12439         }
12440 
12441         if (ret == 0)
12442                 ret = fixup_call_args(env);
12443 
12444         env->verification_time = ktime_get_ns() - start_time;
12445         print_verification_stats(env);
12446 
12447         if (log->level && bpf_verifier_log_full(log))
12448                 ret = -ENOSPC;
12449         if (log->level && !log->ubuf) {
12450                 ret = -EFAULT;
12451                 goto err_release_maps;
12452         }
12453 
12454         if (ret == 0 && env->used_map_cnt) {
12455                 /* if program passed verifier, update used_maps in bpf_prog_info */
12456                 env->prog->aux->used_maps = kmalloc_array(env->used_map_cnt,
12457                                                           sizeof(env->used_maps[0]),
12458                                                           GFP_KERNEL);
12459 
12460                 if (!env->prog->aux->used_maps) {
12461                         ret = -ENOMEM;
12462                         goto err_release_maps;
12463                 }
12464 
12465                 memcpy(env->prog->aux->used_maps, env->used_maps,
12466                        sizeof(env->used_maps[0]) * env->used_map_cnt);
12467                 env->prog->aux->used_map_cnt = env->used_map_cnt;
12468 
12469                 /* program is valid. Convert pseudo bpf_ld_imm64 into generic
12470                  * bpf_ld_imm64 instructions
12471                  */
12472                 convert_pseudo_ld_imm64(env);
12473         }
12474 
12475         if (ret == 0)
12476                 adjust_btf_func(env);
12477 
12478 err_release_maps:
12479         if (!env->prog->aux->used_maps)
12480                 /* if we didn't copy map pointers into bpf_prog_info, release
12481                  * them now. Otherwise free_used_maps() will release them.
12482                  */
12483                 release_maps(env);
12484 
12485         /* extension progs temporarily inherit the attach_type of their targets
12486            for verification purposes, so set it back to zero before returning
12487          */
12488         if (env->prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_EXT)
12489                 env->prog->expected_attach_type = 0;
12490 
12491         *prog = env->prog;
12492 err_unlock:
12493         if (!is_priv)
12494                 mutex_unlock(&bpf_verifier_lock);
12495         vfree(env->insn_aux_data);
12496 err_free_env:
12497         kfree(env);
12498         return ret;
12499 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
